product_title: Banana Yellow Gourmet Salt Water Taffy 1 Pound Bag
review_headline: avoid this style!
review_body: I got this by mistake, somehow.  there seems to be a regular yellow candy style AND then there is this red stripe variety.  I had ordered the yellow plain kind but they shipped this, instead.  I tried two pieces.  could not even finish either one.  tasted like wax or something very flavorless!  I would not buy this.  in fact, I did not, but for some reason, amazon shipped this to me.

product_title: Deluxe Mixed Nuts Raw, 2Lbs
review_headline: Ixnay on the rotten nuts.
review_body: Probably would have been good, but my nuts were rancid.

product_title: Plum Organics Little Yums Teething Wafers
review_headline: Made my baby sick
review_body: I was happy with these at first, but my 10 month old had two and then 6 ozs of formula and became cranky. About an hour later she threw up the two teething wafers only. Not for sure if those are what caused it, but I tried giving one to her two days later and she absolutely refused it. She even shuttered when she took a taste before refusing it. It may not be the product but maybe she has a sensitivity to rice or some other ingredient in them. Better off anyways since we don't, especially her, need to be consuming rice products often.

product_title: Vegemite 220g - Two Pack, with Amazon Prime, Australian Import
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: This Vegemite made me very ill. I broke out in hives and got a massive headache. I must be allergic to it. I tried to return it but was not able too.

product_title: Starbucks Decaf Pike Place Roast K-Cup for Keurig Brewers
review_headline: I am so sick of the horrible ingredients in Starbucks coffee like
review_body: Starbucks uses the paint stripper solvent Methylene Chloride to decaffeinate their coffee  As per the EPA, the effects of chronic exposure targets the central nervous system and animal studies have shown increases in liver and lung cancer and benign mammary gland tumors. REALLY?! I am so sick of the horrible ingredients in Starbucks coffee like: Caramel Coloring (a cancer causer), Pesticides, Carrageenan (a cancer causer), GMO High Fructose Corn Syrup, Refined Flours. GMO Chemically Derived Sugars, GMO Preservatives, Growth Hormone (in food products), Azodicarbonamide, GMO Inflammatory Oils. Just say boycott Starbucks until they eliminate all the dangerous ingredients in their coffee and decaffeinate without paint stripper.

product_title: Gemlik Type Black Olives LUX – 1.1lb (500g)
review_headline: Mine were rotten and tasted horrible...
review_body: I am Turkish and I've never had any problems with Marmarabirlik olives in my whole life.  HOWEVER, this is the first time I've ordered them online and I have to say there were the worst olives I've ever tasted.  They were rotten!  My Mom even commented that these olives are bad.  Maybe I got a bad batch because this company makes one of the very best Turkish olives on the market.  I'm extremely disappointed with this online order.

The taste is okay....Nothing spectacular....It tastes like it was made with rotted anchovies....
The main problem: I braised something using this sauce and my apartment stunk like rotted fish for days....
The cheap plastic bottle does not make this product more enticing.....

review_body: Good taste, but absolutely no flavor, both dry and brewed. Contacted Numi Customer Service. Got careless response, They sent me a couple of tea bags which were much worse than the loose Emperor's Puerh tea. After a month or so it smells rotten. Still taste is OK

Unfortunately it won't let me give no star.

If I had known this, I never would have ordered this, and Amazon.com needs to protect customers from this outrage. DO NOT ORDER THIS PRODUCT FROM AMAZON.COM!

review_body: I received nothing by crumbles and these made both myself and my mom sick to our stomach.  I will NEVER buy food online again.  Terrible idea.

product_title: Illy issimo Coffee Drink (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Gross and dangerous additives
review_body: Ugh. This stuff is the worst! I made the huge mistake of reading the reviews and not reading the ingredients :( Everyone was all pumped up about Illy being legit Italian and purist with just coffee and milk and cocoa... nope. It is full of weird chemicals and... Carrageenan!!! BARF! Really Illy? I and everyone I know avoids it like the plague as studies are constantly coming out about how detrimental to mammal digestive tracts it is. Wiki it, you'll find freaky facts about this seaweed derivative like "dietary studies have observed colitis-like disease and tumour promotion". I mean, it's flipping coffee. Do we have to put crap like this in everything? SO bummed. Get it together Illy.

product_title: Jiffy Pop Butter Popcorn, 4.5 oz (Pack of 3)
review_headline: This is a dangerous product
review_body:
Having followed the directions, I can say this is a dangerous product. It says it's acceptable to use on a gas range, but my range caught the remaining edge of the paper on fire, and that burned about 1/2 the popcorn. I had 2 of these, and this happened on the first one when I put it on med, so I tried low on the 2nd one and it happened again. It's clear this is not usable on a gas range.

I hate this product and I wish they would say this is approved only for gas ranges.

The smell was strange, unpleasant, like spoiled refuse. The worst part was after i covered the jar and the jar was moving on the counter from the bugs inside of it. Absolutely horrifying. I wish now I'd taken a video of it - it was like something out of Poltergeist! Needless to say this item was thrown way (not inside the house) and i will not purchase any Ajika products ever again. I wish I could get the smell out of my nose, it's lingering there like a bad dream.

review_body: My child threw up!

product_title: Orgain Organic Plant Based Protein Powder, Packaging May Vary
review_headline: Then I got sick with the double over painful gas cramps that others discuss and it takes two ...
review_body: It was okay.  I was okay with the stevia and adding things to it.  It is a powder and so you may have to use a spoon to stir on top of a blender.  There is a slight hint of vanilla and it is not gross.  I was using it to replace two meals a day for weight loss.  Then I got sick with the double over painful gas cramps that others discuss and it takes two days to get it out of you.  A doctor told me it was the inulin others mentioned here.  I have tried it again.  If I stick below ten grams of fiber from the inulin in one day, I am okay.  More than this, it is very painful, had to eat kefir and take pepto to make the pain stop. If you have trouble with inulin, limit your consumption to no more than one serving a day or every other day.  I did not have this problem with the liquid version of this product

product_title: Yogi Tea, Skin Detox - Soothing Rose Hibiscus, 16 Count (Pack of 6), Packaging May Vary
review_headline: Extremely sick
review_body: I liked the taste, but this made me extremely sick. The first two times I drank it, it was fine. By the third day I felt sick immediately. I had been running back and forth from the bathroom at least 50 times in one day. I was nauseous, light-headed, and bed ridden for three days. I'm a pretty healthy person as it is, I just wanted to try a new tea. I guess I should've looked more into what detoxing does to you. The morning after taking it, I threw up immediately and continued to make rounds to the bathroom. I wasn't able to eat so naturally, I lost 3 pounds. Terrible experience :/

I contacted customer service (Yum Yum Gum) regarding the issue on several occasions, but was ignored each time. They are far from inexpensive, otherwise I would have ignored the issue completely. Oh well!

product_title: Vegemite (220 gram)
review_headline: Turns out vegemite sandwiches are some form of punishment for really horrible criminals. It tasted like rotten nutella

Turns out vegemite sandwiches are some form of punishment for really horrible criminals. It tasted like rotten nutella. So must be an acquired taste. My hats off to the man that can eat a jar of this.

product_title: Amish Jam - 8 Oz Jar - Qty 3
review_headline: Avoid, avoid, avoid! Too sweet, Tasteless, and Rhubarb-less emulsion
review_body: I wish I had read other reviews on Amazon before ordering six jars.  As other buyers of rhubarb jam note (amidst positive reviews for cranberry and blackberry spreads), the rhubarb jam contains not a hint of rhubarb. It is a very sweet red emulsion with no taste of rhubarb I or any of my family members could detect.  I had intended to give the jam as presents, but will have to discard as the jam is not "presentable" to friends or returnable to the maker.  I grew up eating rhubarb jam in Maine as a child and hoped the Amish version from Illinois would approximate or come close to the flavor and texture I remembered.  I was completely disappointed.

product_title: Barcel, Xplosion Takis Chips, 9.9 Ounce
review_headline: the taste will make you sick
review_body: These chips are absolute garbage DO NOT BUY

product_title: Now Foods, Xylitol
review_headline: Good, but danger to dogs
review_body:
DEADLY TO DOGS,
The package says, "Note: Do not feed Xylitol to dogs or other pets".
But Xylitol is so harmful that it can kill a dog. It is 100 more times more toxic to dogs than chocolate.
The package should have a "WARNING" not a note. This is deadly, seriously understated on the package.
I personally like the product and use it in my morning oatmeal. Tastes good. My dog got into my morning oatmeal and $2,000. later after 24 hours of glucose IV and monitoring, she is ok.

Also, however, people should also know that the latest scientific research shows that the entire "glycemic index" concept of perceived potential benefits from low glycemic impact is now reputed. Low glycemic foods have not been shown to benefit people with diabetes in long term study.

SOURCE: Frank Sacks, M.D., professor, cardiovascular disease prevention, Harvard School of Public Health, Boston, Mass.; Robert Eckel, M.D., professor, medicine, University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus, Aurora, Colo.; Dec. 17, 2014, Journal of the American Medical Association

review_headline: stinky!

I had a second package, also not expired, that hadn't been opened yet so I opened it to sniff test.  It reeked just as bad.  Maybe that's the way it smells but I did not feel comfortable giving any more to my baby.  Too bad because I am a huge believer in eating sprouted grains...

product_title: RxBar Real Food Coconut Cacao Protein Bar, 1.83 Ounce (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Product gave me and my girlfriend gastroenteritis and I'm exploring legal action.  I would avoid this company at all costs!
review_body: Last week I came down with severe gastroenteritis that had me ill for several days.  I couldn't figure out what the issue was as this product was the only dietary change I had made (I do not eat in restaurants).  After I cleared my illness, my girlfriend came over and had a bar and sure enough she became ill the next day.  I now knew it was the bars.  I have contacted the company to inform them of their poor quality control and given that I work in a medical center with Infectious disease doctors, I will be having the bars tested for both norovirus and bacterial toxins that could have lead to the food poisoning.  I will never buy anything from this company ever again.  The taste of the bars was fine, but having severe illness from a food bar is unacceptable given so many other companies to choose from.  Avoid this company at all costs.

product_title: Traditional Medicinals  Tea
review_headline: Made my little one sick
review_body:
The pros: It tasted very good. It has a strong licorice flavor. I liked it hot with milk and honey.

The cons: Unfortunately although this tasted great, I can't recommend this. After 2 days of drinking this tea, my baby started throwing up quite frequently. Once I stopped drinking the tea she got better. We haven't figured out if she was allergic to somethingin it or what happened. She hasn't shown any allergy symptoms to anything else. I was drinking 3 cups a day when I was doing this and the box recommends 3-5 cups daily. If you decide to try this product I recommend using it with caution.

product_title: Onnit MCT Oil - Pure MCT Coconut Oil, Ketogenic Diet and Paleo Optimized with C8, C10, Lauric Acid - Perfect for Coffee, Shakes, and Cooking (Flavorless - 24oz)
review_headline: I don't feel anything and it made me sick. 2nd onnit product that i didn't like.
review_body: I always heard about mct oil from Joe Rogan, caveman coffee, and Dave Asprey, so I got a bottle and so far I haven’t noticed anything. Well see if that changes  by the time I’m done with the bottle. It says its tasteless, but I personally taste like there’s a hint of soap in it. It reminds me of bubble solution you might use for little kids. Don’t take more than 1 tablespoon if you’re new to this stuff. It caused a day of watery defecation for me. I’m serious, it was a day. Sounds gross, but it’s a fact you have to know before taking this stuff. So start slow and build up over a few weeks. If you take too much, Your body will tell you over and over. This is the second time I’ve tried an onnit product and I ended up not liking it. Alpha brain gave me really bad stomach pains and this MCT oil doesn’t do anything for me and it gave me diarrhea. If I notice I feel any better then I’ll update this.

product_title: X-Mode Energy Shots on Tap
review_headline: So far it's made me very ill.
review_body: I drank 1 oz of this Friday and 2 ozs Sat. I had stomach cramps and puked all day and night Sat into Sunday morning now. I'm afraid to use the product again. After not using it a while I might try it one more time to confirm whether it was the product or a coincidence.

product_title: JR Mushrooms Pure Cinnamon Oil
review_headline: Liver damage? This is CASSIA (unsafe cinnamon) not CEYLON.
review_body: At first I love this -- great taste, strong. Then I read in the questions on this Amazon page that it's CASSIA NOT CEYLON. I read that cassia can cause liver damage! I was eating quite a bit of it and wasn't feeling well, and I'm now concerned about liver damage. :(. This must be why it says NO WHERE on the bottle what type of cinnamon it is, or the ingredients at all!! Not cool. I've wasted money and hopefully didn't harm my body with this. I'm now going to have to pay more to buy the other kind somewhere else. Sucks.

product_title: Starkist Solid White Albacore Tuna - 5 oz Can ( 8 Pack)
review_headline: Pink, stinky, sloppy, mush that I feel stupid for eating
review_body: I would give zero stars if possible. I just bought a 4 pack of what should've been solid white albacore, what I opened was a disgusting pink slop that no matter how much you drain it, you end up draining pink ooze until there's not much left. Impossible to get the water out. It had thee most horrendous smell, far beyond the bit of fishiness I expect when opening a can of Tuna. That should've been my warning to throw it out!! But no, I was stupid and made the salad and we all got sick. Only those of us that ate it, my husband and son hate tuna so it's even more obvious it was the tuna. Everyone but the 2 that didn't eat it became ill. My mom got it the worst, but she's the oldest, so beware if you serve this to children or elderly. When in doubt, THROW IT OUT! I know I won't be buying this brand again.

review_headline: got sick (and not from ick factor)

product_title: Bragg Nutritional Yeast Seasoning, Premium, 4.5 Ounce (2 Bottles)
review_headline: AVOID!!--- Folic acid is SYNTHETIC, dangerous
review_body:
If something is labeled as "folic acid", that is how you know it's synthetic. The natural form is called "folate". "Folic acid" is only used to describe synthetic form of this necessary nutrient.

Furthermore, upon contacting Braggs directly, they stated that their Folic acid was indeed 100% synthetic.

This is important because synthetic folate [i.e. Folic Acid] has been linked many, many times to serious illnesses/ diseases/ etc. It is far safer to buy a different nutritional yeast, and get your FOLATE naturally.

Please be careful with products! Even a company like Braggs that makes great ACV cannot be relied on to give us everything safely.

product_title: Jelly Belly Dr. Pepper Jelly Beans, 1 Pound
review_headline: Interesting, but I'll avoid in the future
review_body: These did not have a distinct taste of Dr Pepper, but only a mild aftertaste. For the price, this was completely unexpected. The quantity was also very small for the cost. I would not buy again knowing these two factors.

product_title: Miracle Noodle Gluten-free Shirataki Pasta
review_headline: Eh, kinda stinky. But okay-ish.
review_body: I bought these after having tried Nasoya Shirataki noodles. These are okay. The smell to me is like being in a fish-scented athletic shoe factory. Rubber and fish. You do really have to rinse them. I gave only three stars because the Nasoya noodles have very little odor and do not seem as slimy. Also, these are not cut all all the way through, so if you want a more elbow macaroni type noodle, you have to cut these yourself a bit. I have noticed that all shirataki noodles are one..big... long...noodle. I probably won't buy these again because they do stink to high heaven and I am able to get shirataki that is not nearly as offensive. Some people are not nearly as offended by the smell, so I guess it is just a matter of odor tolerances. They are not bad otherwise, make good noodle salad and all the noodle things I miss on a low carb diet.

product_title: STRONG & KIND Bars, 12 count
review_headline: Tastes GREAT - but made me sick!
review_body:
A couple of other reviews mentioned that these bars made them feel sick/nauseous. I thought that seemed pretty unlikely, and was probably just a coincidence. But lo and behold, I ate one yesterday afternoon (jalapeno flavor) and still feel nauseous this morning!

That being said, it seems like very few people have this reaction and they do taste really, really good. That's why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1. Just beware - these could potentially make you feel sick to your stomach.

I threw it out even though I had planned on having it for a couple of meals. I hope the Broccoli Cheese is better or I'm going to abandon this brand.

review_body: Perhaps the oil didn't perform as expected because it had been in a warm area then shipped in a box via a cold truck so that the oil arrived cloudy.  The cloudiness cleared when the oil was brought up to room temperature.

product_title: Bragg - Organic Apple Cider Vinegar with Mother
review_headline: Avoid like the plague! I've been sick since starting this regimen.
review_body:
Nausea, dizziness and sore throat. Started having these problems since I started taking ACV. My mother bought this exact brand from the grocery and told me to religously take it because it she claimed that it lowers blood pressure and cures a myriad of other diseases, and boy was I so wrong to listen to her! I felt way better before taking this stuff!

Not everything you read on the internet is true folks! This product has done nothing for me other than give me health problems. Also do your research. You will be shocked to find out how prolonged consumption of this stuff can severely damage your GI tract (esophagus) and your intestines. I'm not sure why the reviews for these are so high. But I've also read that many manufactuters purchase fake reviews on Amazon and other sites to entice people to purchase their product. Maybe this could be the case here? I'm about to set an appointment with a doctor when I felt perfectly fine before I even took this product.

product_title: Oreo Cookie Dough Cookies
review_headline: Utterly disgusting!!!! Made me sick.
review_body:
Since when does cookie dough taste like maple syrup and burnt stale coffee? When oreo tries to make cookie dough cookies. These are so bad, I ate 2 and threw them out. 45 min later I got a really bad/painful stomach ache and felt sooo incredibly nauseous. Somethings WRONG with these. I can't fathom how these made it into production. Didn't the CEO of oreo TASTE THESE? The board of directors?? Someone??? What happened?
THAT BAD.

product_title: Pure Natural Miracles Cacao Powder Raw and Organic
review_headline: A dangerous experience!
review_body:
Despite the fact that this little baggie considers itself the repository of "pure natural miracles" and touts the fact that it is "certified organic," what the "Larviks Investment Group," (the hypesters behind this marketing) don't tell you could eventually kill you -- so please attend carefully to the following information.
The Nutrition Action Healthletter (pub. by The Center for Science in the Public Interest) recently drew attention to the results of toxic heavy metal tests (specifically arsenic, lead and cadmium) which were run on cocoa powders late last year by ConsumerLab.  The entire report is available at consumerlab.com, but here are the results in brief: all of the cocoa powders tested were contaminated with cadmium and two of them were also contaminated with lead.
Now, this little "miracle" was not one of the products tested, but considering that ALL the tested cocoa powders, some of which, like this one, are also sourced in Ecuador, failed should be enough to give one pause.
Of course, the "true believers" among you may feel sufficiently reassured by all this miraculous marketing to continue using this product. But as someone who recently discovered upon reading ConsumerLab's report that he had been ingesting 34 times the Canadian limit of cadmium and 58 times the California Prop 65 limit of cadmium (for a warning to be required) on a daily basis for the last three years (using a different cocoa powder product), I have to admit that I'd like a fully-independent, verifiable confirmation of this product's safety before using it.
And for those of you who don't know, cadmium is a toxic, heavy metal, a probable carcinogen, destructive of kidneys and bone, and accumulates in the body due to its biological half-life in humans of 10 to 35 years.
Your health, your call!

product_title: Z Natural Foods Coconut Milk Powder, 100% USDA Certified Organic, 1 lb.
review_headline: Makes me violently ill
review_body:
This gives me terrible stomach cramps every time I have some and then later other unpleasantness happens. There is no nutritional run down or ingredient list on the package(which isn't even legal) but from answers on here it has maltodextrin in it and my best guess is that this is the cause though I hadn't notice this issue before. I'll have to keep an eye on labels and see if other maltodextrin products cause it.

It's made in Vietnam though so who knows what's really in it.

It tastes on par with real powdered milk so not great but not awful and would be good mixed in things, if it didn't make me double over in pain!

Yes are they expensive? Yes are they KitKat? no

product_title: STRONG & KIND Bars, 12 count
review_headline: This product might make you sick
review_body:
This made me sick. Stomach cramps and nausea. I ate one bar Strong and Kind Honey Smoked BBQ at about 10:30 am. Stomach cramps and nausea started about 30 minutes later. These symptoms persisted until bedtime! I was OK the next day.

I thought I should let this be known to any perspective buyers of this product. I don't know what ingredient may have caused me to react this way. It isn't very spicy hot, fairly mild actually. The only ingredient unusual to me are the pumpkin seeds. I can't remember ever eating any separately in the past, but it it wouldn't be wise for me to conclude they were the cause.

My recommendation is for you to be aware of the possibility having a similar reaction to mine.

product_title: Tea Tree Therapy, Soap Bar, Vegetable Base, 3.5 oz
review_headline: You might want to avoid using it on your privates.
review_body: I was very optimistic about using this soap for my whole body when showering, after the great results I had with the Tea Tree Oil vaginal suppositories. I was wrong. While the smell of the bar is in fact a little pronounced without being really overpowering, I do have to advise women against the application of this soap to your vaginal area. The only time I used it in the shower - and I was perfectly fine before -, it caused me a discomfort that I had never experienced before. I won't ever use it again - might work better for your face.

product_title: Healthworks Cacao Powder Parent
review_headline: poisons and toxic. avoid. must be roasted.
review_body:
raw cacao must be boiled or roasted to remove the natural poisons, toxins, phytic and oxalic acid.

Do you eat raw potatoes ? no of course not. you boil them to remove the poisons and phytic acid.

All the benefits of cacao have been shown on people who ate normal 70% dark chocolate.
No sane person eats raw cacao.
My message is simple - eat a 60%/70% dark chocolate and you will be far safer.

review_body: I made short  cake out of this two times.  Tasted good to me and kids liked it !  Unfortunately it made me feel horrible.  This is probably ok for someone just gluten free.  But there is something in this that does not mix with me.  If you have a really sensitive stomach to more than just gluten.  This may not be the right choice.

product_title: STRONG & KIND Bars, 12 count
review_headline: got me sick

Flavor isn't too bad but I got CRAZY stomach problems, like the worst stomach ache of my life followed by sickness. Maybe I was unlucky and was sent an expired one or something but I will never ever again even dare to try a strong & kind product.

product_title: Purina ONE SmartBlend Sensitive Systems Formula Dry Dog Food - (1) 16.5 lb. Bag
review_headline: Purina ONE Smartblend foods made dog intensely sick!
review_body: We bought the Smartblend Chicken first & our 60lb Aussie vomited & had intense diarrhea. We exchanged it for Smartblend Sensitive Systems hoping the chicken was either a bad batch or for whatever reason just didn't settle with our dog.  Exact same thing happened! Vomit & diarrhea within hours. Our dog is a tank & literally not kidding has NEVER had this problem with ANY other dog food ever & we've given him many different foods / brands, all various qualities, over the years. We stopped this food each time immediately & of course he was back to normal. Obviously I have no way of knowing what exactly is in these Purina Smartblend dog foods causing him to be sick but clearly I'll never buy these foods again & I'd suggest to be VERY cautious about buying Purina!

product_title: Roland Caviar Whole Grain Lumpfish, Red, 2 Ounce (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Old rotten fish
review_body: This caviar is gross. Package did not match picture either. Mine was in black and had a different "roland" logo on it. Taste like cat fish that has sat out in the sun. Even my brother who eats fresh water fish all the time spit it out. The dog did enjoy it.

product_title: NOW Foods Brazil Nuts, Raw, 12-Ounce Bag
review_headline: Great tasting nuts, too many can be dangerous to your health
review_body: These nuts are a great source of selenium, a trace mineral you need for many reasons.  The nuts themselves would get a 5-star for taste and freshness most of the time but I'm deducting 3 stars because of the dangers of too much.  ONE nut a day is all it takes.  Unfortunately the package calls 5 nuts as a 'serving' which would lead one to believe that's how many you need to eat to get your daily quota of selenium.  Too much selenium can cause both basal and squamous cell skin cancer, which I didn't find out until after the fact.  The clerk at the local health food store says she eats 3-4 a day for her thyroid.  I started eating 3 a day without thoroughly researching first, and after a couple of months of eating the NOW organic brazil nuts my face is covered with small  squamous cell pre-cancers that must be removed by a dermatologist.  The research is out there it can cause it, I believe my face is proof of it.  The timing can't be coincidence.  so do your own research,  just BE CAREFUL and not eat too much of a good thing!

product_title: Tofu Shirataki Noodles 10 Bags Angel Hair Shape
review_headline: Made me sick, inconsistency is alarming
review_body: I've had this twice--the first time was fine, I didn't have a problem with the texture or taste and was excited to have it again. The second time, I prepped it in exactly the same way (miso noodle soup), but even though I rinsed as thoroughly as the first time, there was a strange chemical taste in the background. I ate it, but right afterwards threw up! I am not prone to vomiting and this kind of thing has never happened to me before, so it was somewhat alarming. Even now, a day later, I still have a strange feeling on my tongue. Since I did nothing differently in the prep from the first time, I find this very concerning, especially as I have no idea exactly what I ingested that made me have such a negative reaction. I will definitely NOT be trying these noodles again and obviously cannot recommend them.

product_title: Starwest Botanicals Guarana Seed Powder 1lb
review_headline: that is what you would think it tasted like. Smells like dirt or rotten log
review_body:
I have been taking this for a week now... i can say its doesnt get you jacked up that is why there is no crash afterwards. Im using a level tea spoon in mouth washing down with water. When first taking.... this is how I described the taste.... If you see a rotting log in the woods and you took a bit out of it..... that is what you would think it tasted like. Smells like dirt or rotten log??? I take it twice a day... It does seem to help keep you moving.... I have been taking the caffeine pills from prolab for years.... So that could be the reason Im not feeling the power of this dust..... If your looking for some energy and dont want the pills or coffee I would give this a try. It doesnt get your heart racing... I would say it gives you a push not a shove in the right direct
ion........ UPDATE:.......after taking twice a day for a month now I recommend you dont buy this product....... I want to feel the energy........ with this product you really have to try hard and pretend its doing something??? not good. I also said it gave you a push..... now im saying its more like a tap in the right direction.

I am going to try to get a refund or have the company replace it, but I think it should be noted that ordering in winter may not be your best option as it is cold.

product_title: Earth Friendly Dishmate (1x25Oz)
review_headline: potentially unsafe METHYLISOTHIAZOLINONE ingredient per Environmental Working Group
review_body:
Checked Environmental Working Group review on METHYLISOTHIAZOLINONE after another Amazon one star review noted it is unsafe.
Sure enough - although I have been using this soap for years to pre-clean my dishes before loading them in the dishwasher, and I have been happy with the scent and with the lack of reaction to it by my sensitive skin. So, I will now stop using it, and start using a do-it-yourself castille based recipe that I found on the internet, instead - I am so tired of trusting companies that promote environmentally safe logos/brands to actually use safe chemicals in their formulas, and then later being disappointed that my family has been exposed to potentially hazardous chemicals for years by trusting them. Booo. Two stars only because I was previously happy with its performance and did not obviously react to it up to now...perhaps companies have a hard time finding preservatives for liquid cleaners that are safe so their products can sit on the months for months or years before being used up? That's why I'll start making my own...as I'll know exactly what's in it and I'll likely use it up before needing any preservatives.

Upon drinking the first cup 20 mins later I was feeling nausea (I had nothing prior to this except my morning water; I normally had my Vitamin World Matcha first thing - so no different just different brands) 10 mins later hunched over my sink and not because I wanted to be.  Ok, so I wanted to believe it wasn't the Matcha so after a while I went about getting dressed for work.  I have been sipping my smoothie: spring greens, and baby spinach, sun warrior vanilla protein powder, the new Matcha, spririnal, water, pineapple, mango, and banana.  My stomach is not liking this - the Only New component is the DoMatcha.  So I must cancel my subscription and never order this again.

product_title: La Tourangelle, Avocado Oil Spray, 5 Fl. Oz.
review_headline: Bitter, rotten, putrid, foul
review_body:
I purchased La Tourangelles' Avocado oil with high expectations since I adore the Pistachio oil they produce. To say I was disappointed in the Avocado oil is an understatement. The can arrived so badly damaged that I had to check the integrity of the seal before I would even consider tasting it, then wished the can had been destroyed completely.
The oil was thin, light in color and silky when rubbed between the fingers, no feeling of grit or clumps of mystery goo. That is where the pleasantries end.
"Disgusting" is simply not a strong enough term. The oil smelled foul and cloying, the stench hitting the nostrils like a runaway bullet train. The taste is beyond adequate description but I will try throwing out a few adjectives.
Bitter, rotten, putrid, foul, sour, death.

product_title: Monk Fruit In The Raw Sweetener, 4.8 Ounce
review_headline: Contains Dextrose and/or Maltodextrin, so avoid!
review_body: Careful, as this product contains Dextrose, a form of glucose, which simply shouldn't be in such a product, and/or Maltodextrin, a known GMO corn derivative that also contains MSG is but simply not listed. Both of which are no good for the if you are avoiding consuming sugar or chemicals! This is presented as a natural sweetener (as Monk fruit extract really is), but the stuff they add to it just makes this all wrong. If you want real Monk fruit sweetener, make sure it's 100% pure or only mixed with Erythritol or Stevia, both of which are more healthy and proper for consumption.

product_title: Bodum - Starbucks Recycled 8 Cup Coffee Press
review_headline: Melted in the dishwasher making it unsafe to use!!
review_body: I purchased this french press in Starbucks. I worked great. The filter was efficient and the press did it's job nicely. However don't put it in the dishwasher. I don't remember if there was any warning on the label. My husband put the press in the dishwasher. The glass and inner parts were fine. The outer casing melted and cracked making this press very unsafe to use. When it first melted I still used it, but eventually the part holding the glass beaker broke while I was pouring the coffee. The beaker and innards did not break, but I got myself pretty good with hot coffee.

product_title: Tasty Bite Rice
review_headline: Incredibly icky (tastes like the bag, not rice)
review_body:
I ordered this because of the good reviews. Obviously, my idea of tasty rice is different than the 5-star reviewers. I got this for convenience, but since we ended up throwing the bags in the trash, not so convenient.

This rice is awful. It tastes of the packaging (ie, picks up the flavor of the bag very, very strongly).

My husband hated it. I hated it. And I was very disappointed. Pity, because if it had tasted good, I'd have made it a pantry staple for those days when you want something in a couple minutes, not cook a full meal with rice from scratch. We've had basmati rice from various places--Indian restaurants, Pakistani restaurants, Persian restaurants, made at home--and what was in this bag did not come close to being even acceptable.

If you don't mind plasticky/chemically taste in your basmati, yeah, sure, order this. Otherwise, stay away.

product_title: JR Mushrooms Pure Cinnamon Oil
review_headline: Not the real thing; unsafe for some
review_body:
January 7, 2015: I have concerns about this product, so queried Olive Nation as to whether this oil comes from true cinnamon bark, Cinnamomum zeylanicum, which is known as \\"Ceylon cinnamon\\". Amit at Olive Nation sent me an answer today. Although bark is depicted on the label, this oil is not from true cinnamon bark but from the leaf of the cassia plant. It is not true \\"Ceylon cinnamon\\".

Cinnamon consumers who use it daily (such as diabetics who want to lower blood sugars with cinnamon) would do well to use caution with cassia products. According to Web MD cassia contains significant amounts of a chemical called coumarin that can cause or worsen liver disease or impact kidneys in some people.

Update January 12, 2015: I shopped for true cinnamon bard from Ceylon cinnamon on line and queried the merchant, DruEra, to ensure it is genuine. The response I received: \\"We market Ceylon Cinnamon Bark oil which is food grade and 100% Cinnamomum Zeylanicum\\".

DruEra was quick to ship. I received my package today. The order came in a nice wood box, and the safety encasing of plastic over the bottle assured me it was never opened. The Cinnamomum Zeylanicum bark oil I received is complex and exceedingly rich in terms of fragrance and flavors. When I tried a drop it did not burn my tongue and was soothing to my stomach. A 3 oz bottle cost me $40 plus $9 shipping/handling and arrived via Fed Ex with signature required. The expiration date on the bottle is 12/2016. I do not recall so enjoyable an experience with cinnamon as with this one, and plan to purchase from this merchant in the future.

product_title: 5th Avenue Candy Bar
review_headline: Suggest avoid buying - This candy is old or poorly stored.
review_body:
While the price is ok, the candy was old; the sugary peanut butter internal layers have absorbed moisture and become crystallized and hardened. Outer chocolate layer is ok. But the inside is grittier, tougher to chew, not as melt-in-the-mouth as normal, fresh product. Suggest avoiding purchase until shelf life/best used by date is published in the description. 5th Avenue is a fav of mine, but is becoming tougher to find by the carton where the per bar cost is much less than buying it on candy shelves. My local Sam's club has discontinued selling cartons.

I consumed the carton but I will avoid buying until I can be assured inventory is fresh. I have some experience in candy manufacture and sales, I have seen this condition occur from age or from storage in high temperature/high humidity conditions.

product_title: Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Valerian Tea, 16 Tea Bags
review_headline: This tea tasted and smelled terrible and made my boyfriend sick to his stomach and ...
review_body: We wish we could return it and give zero stars.  This tea tasted and smelled terrible. It made my boyfriend so sick to his stomach that he was throwing up the entire night.

product_title: Godiva Coffee, Hazelnut Creme , 12-Ounce (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Its hazelnut lover's paradies, but If you like full-bodied coffee with bitterness, tanginess, acidity, etc. avoid it.
review_body: Let me tell you something about this coffee! its not bad but it aint great either, it might just be the hazelnut flavor though. Im accustomed to having dark looking strong flavored (with all the range of flavors), and unaltered coffee with no additional flavors added. But I decided to give this one a try, simply because a friend recommended me this brand and out of all the other choices this seemed the most appealing (personal preference of course). The problem is that this lacks the character of a "good" cup of coffee, no acidity, no bitterness,no tanginess, no after taste, just simply a kick of hazelnut with caffeine. So if you love Hazelnut you would love this but if you want full bodied coffee avoid this. It makes coffee seem like a kids drink and tastes almost candyish (if that's even a word) to me. I hope this is useful!

product_title: Golden State Fruit Summit Christmas Fruit and Treats Gift Box
review_headline: Missing items and rotten fruit
review_body: This was purchased as a gift and I was disappointed to see the product delivered did not include all items listed listed in the product description.  The Frosted Sugar Cookie, Roasted Salted Mixed nuts, and the Chocolate Almond Bark were not delivered.  The 5 mandarin oranges had to be immediately tossed as they were already rotten and inedible.  The pears and apple were in good condition, as was the basket the product was delivered in, but the missing items and spoiled oranges meant less than half of what was purchased was delivered/unusable.  I would not purchase this item again.

product_title: Coke Life Reduced Calorie Coca Cola with Stevia 12 Oz Cans - Case of 12
review_headline: Nice attempt to break free of aspartame, but it made me sick
review_body:
Bad taste. It made me very sick; shaky like, stiff, nausea, hot and cold, bit dizzy.
Read about the side effects of Stevia. It also does not mix well with sugar. Stevia effects the hormones and lowers blood sugar in a unnatural way.

Nice attempt Coca Cola to break free of aspartame and other artificial sweeteners 'POISON' forced into our food, drink by the Drug Companies, Monsanto.., but this won't sell.

Please make a product with NO SWEETNER; let us add our own.

product_title: Godiva Chocolatier Classic Gold Ballotin Candy
review_headline: Classic Gold? How about rotten and old...
review_body: Chocolates looked old and beat.  They had begun to turn white, which is pretty lame when buying them as a gift.

product_title: Hamburger Popin' Cookin' kit DIY candy by Kracie
review_headline: avoid this!
review_body: It did not work out at all as expected; after all the waiting, my daughter found it to be an incredible let-down.

product_title: Twinings Earl Grey Tea, Keurig K-Cups, 24 Count
review_headline: Kinda icky
review_body: Kinda blech after the first one. The first cup was tasty, but any subsequent just tested like tea and chemicals. I still cannot drink it and it's been several months since my first taste. Maybe it's just me. Just sayin.

product_title: Spike Original All Purpose Gourmet Natural Herbal Seasoning, 7 Oz
review_headline: Arrived in opened faded dry rotted box that had been severely beaten.
review_body: Expensive garbage. I had heard so much about this seasoning but could not find it locally at that time so took a chance online. What a mistake! Aside from being devilishly overpriced, the box arrived crushed, so faded that the date wasnt legible, and partially open. I didn't know if the box had purposely been tampered with or abused during the shipping process, either way it went into the trash. Total WASTE (in every sense of the word).

product_title: Bulksupplements Pure Stevia Powder
review_headline: terrible aftertaste, avoid
review_body: Very bitter, terrible aftertaste, avoid!

product_title: Fresh Jicama (5lb)
review_headline: the item was rotten when it's got to me :(
review_body:
the item was rotten when it's got to me :(
the item was rotten when it's got to me :(

product_title: Hampton Farms Salted & Roasted In-shell Peanuts * Large Bag * Net Wt. 80 Oz (5 Lbs.)
review_headline: over roasted rotten peanuts
review_body: I purchased two bags of unsalted Hampton Farm peanuts from Sam’s club and both bags had more rotten or over roasted nuts than edible nuts.  I thought I may of just hit a bad batch so I bought another bag at a different store only to have the same results, I threw out more than I ate.  I wrote Hampton Farms to tell them I thought they had a quality control issue and they sent me a couple complimentary bags of both salted and unsalted peanuts.  The unsalted bags were fine, plumb peanuts the salted were absolutely horrible, rotten, over roasted and over salted peanuts.  I would  think if you are going to send out complimentary bags you would make sure they were top of the shelve quality… so I repeat I really think they are having a quality control issue.

product_title: Campbell's Slow Kettle-Style Soup, 15.5 Ounce Microwavable Bowls
review_headline: left me sick and miserable
review_body: This soup had an Uber strong fishy smell and it was too spicy for my taste. The problem is that it left my stomach feeling terrible to where I almost had to leave work. I don't review many things but I can reassure you that this is not a good soup decision.

product_title: Ella's Kitchen Baby Cookies, 3.8 Ounce (Pack of 5)
review_headline: Very dangerous. Please do not buy.
review_body: These cookies are very dangerous. They break apart in huge chunks that do not dissolve at all. On more than one occasion we have had serious choking incidents with these. At first I thought it was my baby but now at 13 months he has eaten an entire chocolate chip cookie without incident and still choke on these. I can't believe they say 7 months. This company is being irresponsible by continuing to produce and market these to infants. Please, heed my warning and do not give these to your sweet babies.

product_title: Gourmet Fries Seasoning Salt & Vinegar
review_headline: ill try a different brand maybe it will be better i wanted this for my air popped popcorn
review_body: I had read all the reviews and decided to order this anyways even with the negative reviews but they were SPOT ON!!! it isnt vinegary its very plastic/chemical tasting i tried it multiple times trying to use it i also used it on popcorn and other items and it still was odd tasting ill just go back to my reg liquid vinegar. ill try a different brand maybe it will be better i wanted this for my air popped popcorn.

product_title: PG Tips Decaf 80 Ct Tea Bags - 2 Pack
review_headline: Made me ill
review_body: Brewed up so strong it made my stomach turn.  Cheap tea, cheap chemical decaffeination process, bad flavor.

product_title: Sprouting Broccoli Seeds, One Pound - Todd's Seeds
review_headline: Ok if you are looking for seeds that do not sprout and smell like rotten fish
review_body: Tgis is the second time I have ordered Todd's Seeds.  The first batch was ok and about 50% of the seeds sprouted.  I thought I would give them another try, but this batch of seeds has failed 100% of the time I have attempted to sprout them.  Before they sprout, the seeds go rancid and smell like rotting fish.  I would not recommend purchasing this item from Amazon given the low germination rate.

product_title: Tru Sweets Organic Candy Canes, 10-Count Canes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Awesome if you're looking to avoid red #40 or corn ...
review_body: Awesome if you're looking to avoid red #40 or corn syrup, but if you're looking for peppermint, these aren't for you. I had to check the box to see if it actually had any mint in it, all I taste is the sweetness of the brown rice syrup.

product_title: Pistachios Shelled Kernels Roasted Salted, 2lbs
review_headline: a lot of rotten nuts and if you can tolerate ...
review_body: a lot of rotten nuts and if you can tolerate the taste of them watch out for pieces of shell in all the broken pieces of nuts.

product_title: Luter's Artisan Genuine Smithfield Thin Sliced Ham - Ready To Eat (8 ounce)
review_headline: I wouldn't think a cured ham like this should spoil but it certainly had a rotten ...
review_body: Just opened this and was first thrown by the yellowy color of the ham slices.  Went ahead and took a couple of bites, now ready to throw the whole package in the trash.  Tasted awful.  I wouldn't think a cured ham like this should spoil but it certainly had a rotten taste!  Ugh!  I bought a whole ham and had it sent as a Christmas present to family.  Feel like I need to warn them to be cautious.  We actually bought three packages of the sliced (see pic). Have not opened the other two and they do look like they might be okay.

product_title: French Roast, Whole Bean Coffee, Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC.
review_headline: coffee to avoid.
review_body: This coffee is stale !!! I tried it twice and now it's going into the trash. I really cannot afford mistakes but I can't stand stale coffee either. Good coffee is important to me. I want everybody to know. Avoid this coffee.

product_title: Kraft, Handi Snacks, Premium Breadsticks N Cheese, 6.54oz Box (Pack of 4)
review_headline: avoid
review_body: disappointed as the sticks were stale and the cheese was old tasting,

product_title: Nabisco, Handi Snacks, Mister Salty Pretzels and Cheese, 5.52oz Box (Pack of 4)
review_headline: avoid also
review_body: same problems as breadsiicks.  old and not palatable---even the kids would not eat them

product_title: Aunt Gussie's No Sugar Added Cookies
review_headline: Taste great. Sugar alcohols made me so sick
review_body: Taste great.  Sugar alcohols made me so sick!

product_title: Thailand Sticky rice basket
review_headline: Cute basket, but stinky!
review_body: After waiting quite a while for this to arrive from Thailand, I was sad to find it unusable. I think it had been stored in the same container with smoked fish. No amount of sunshine and airing out would remove the smoked fish smell -- not so great for sticky rice!

product_title: Jordan's Skinny Gourmet Sugar Free Syrup
review_headline: taste nothing like caramel, but rather rotten and sour
review_body: taste nothing like caramel, but rather rotten and sour. I tried other brands before, and none was that bad, not even close. Not worth the money savings, grab some Torani or Davinci, at least they taste somewhat like caramel. This one is sour and awful.

product_title: Juka's Red Palm Oil (100% Natural From Africa)
review_headline: but do your best to avoid it
review_body: This stuff is waaayyyyy too greasy.  A little bit goes a long way, but it adds a somewhat nasty flavor to anything you cook with it. I don't know how long this stuff sat on the shelf before it was sold, but do your best to avoid it. The "red" in it may be natural, but this stuff would be better as a leather dye.

product_title: Bridgford Summer Sausage
review_headline: rotten smell
review_body: This was the most fowl smelling meat I've ever opened! I immediately checked the date, still had another year. Then a trail of grease comes pouring out! I happened to notice on the front in small black letters "smoke flavor added" that's where the cheap price comes in. The taste was about as good as I expected, bad. I will never skimp out on a few extra bucks for the good stuff again.

product_title: Choco Treasure Everyday Single Egg (Pack of 12)
review_headline: You want your family to get sick -= DON"T eat the chocloate. Made In China and quality is very concerning.
review_body: You want your family to get sick -= DON"T eat the chocloate. Made In China and quality is very concerning.

Good quality and we are very pleased! 2014-11-29 US 52208992 R1XSJLGZFJT1RX B00IIZPVIU 766313707 Amazing Grass Raw Reserve Greens + Protein- Vanilla Spice, 10 Servings, 9.2 Ounces Grocery 1 15 19 N N Headaches - spirulina and E3 blue green algae I like most of the Amazing Grass products, but not this one. I bought a small packet and developed a nasty headache after using it. I looked back over the ingredients and found the probable culprits - spirulina and E3 blue green algae. Many people develop headaches after consuming these substances, so if you're one of them, avoid this. There are also serious issues with respect to the potential toxicity of blue green algae. If you're interested, search for "Why Blue Green Algae Makes Me Tired". 2014-11-29 US 39789300 R3UZ5W68AXX65E B00PUSOCTW 551293722 Morning Pep 2.5 lbs 100% Pure Birch Xylitol sweetener (Not From Corn) NON GMO - KOSHER - GLUTEN FREE - PRODUCT OF USA. 2.5 lbs Grocery 5 1 2 N N High quality, beneficial sweetener Xylitol has been used as a sweetener for over a hundred years, but has not been readily available to U.S. consumers in bulk until recently, although it and other similar sweeteners are used frequently in commercially-prepared foods. It can be found naturally in many plants, and commercial production focuses on extracting it from the fiber from corn cobs or wood pulp. It can even be extracted from the fiber leftover when sugar is made from cane.

There are several health benefits to xylitol compared to sugar. It has significantly fewer calories than sugar and a significantly lower glycemic index, and the body does not use insulin to metabolize it, so it may benefit diabetics and those who are overweight. It also inhibits rather than feeds the acid-producing bacteria that cause tooth decay, so it is often added to toothpaste, oral washes, and chewing gum. The American Academy of Pediatric Dentistry even supports recommending products with xylitol for use by children at moderate to high risk of dental caries.

I compared plain Morning Pep Xylitol to ordinary granulated refined sugar. The xylitol crystals are larger but are pure white, just like the sugar crystals. It has a neutral odor rather than a sweet smell like sugar. It seems to dissolve in liquids at about the same rate as sugar, perhaps a bit slower.

The sweetness is very similar to that of sugar and it has absolutely no unpleasant aftertaste, but it is not quite as immediately intense on the tongue as sugar is and the flavor is not quite as complex. However, when it is added to a beverage with flavor like coffee or tea, I can detect absolutely no difference. Xylitol sweetens perfectly.

When used in baking, more liquids may need to be used and it doesn't brown and caramelize like sugar does, but simply melts. There are plenty of recipes available on the internet and it is fun to experiment. Xylitol is generally used 1:1 instead of sugar.

The Morning Pep Xylitol is of high quality, very pure and even in consistency and color. It is made in the U.S.A. and comes packaged in heavy, resealable, moisture-proof pouches, which is very convenient. I definitely recommend it.

Morning Pep provided xylitol for evaluation and review.pure and even in consistency and color. Product exactly as described, shipped exactly as promised. 2014-11-29 US 28446397 RFDLMJC9OAG90 B003UPDBJO 443366487 Pop Rocks 3 Pack 12 Units Per Box Assorted Flavors,8.88 OZ Grocery 5 0 0 N Y Five Stars They are Pop Rocks- enough said. 2014-11-29 US 46272718 R1REPNU427UXJZ B003Z54Q7A 94621105 Boba Loca Bubble Boba Tea Taro Powder Mix, 4 lbs (1.81kg) BAG Grocery 5 5 5 N Y I recommend you purchase from there I can verify what other reviewers have said - You can buy this cheaper at bobastore.com, so if you want to try it, I recommend you purchase from there, unless you have preference to order through amazon specifically.

I can't say I'm an expert on bubble tea, but I've enjoyed 2-3 from local shops almost every month for the last 2 years or so. At 4-5 dollars a pop, it adds up quick. Taro was one of my favorites, and is great mixed with just milk and no tea.

This product is identical to the taro drinks I've enjoyed. It's purple (lavender?), super sweet, and smells delicious. In fact at 4 lbs, I recommend that you purchase this with a friend, unless you are running a business. I found that even with my thorough enjoyment of taro, it was too difficult to consume all of the taro powder I had without getting sick of it.

But this stuff is the real deal. I've had bad taro from restaurants, and I can honestly say that this is the best taro powder I've had. I recommend getting some coconut powder/mix to go with it- Taro and Coconut are some of my favorite flavors to mix when I go to a bubble tea shop. It looks like it costs a lot, but if you consider how much you'll save not buying from the store - it's a no brainer. 2014-11-29 US 40800404 RRGWW65XIJJZ B0035LYCPU 910734314 Heartland Food Products Belgian Waffle and Pancake Mix, Malted Vanilla, 5 Pound Grocery 3 0 0 N Y Three Stars Not nearly as good as Carbons. 2014-11-29 US 15082374 R36PVRJZY0GAUG B005HUVI1I 644382665 Davidson's Tea Apricot Grocery 1 9 10 N Y This is *not* 'gunpowder' green tea. I will go back to buying Numi gunpowder tea and I will stop trying to save a few dollars when I already know I've found a good product.

product_title: Choco Treasure Mixed Sports, 12-Count box
review_headline: Eat the chocolate - better call into work sick
review_body: Well, ordered a box of these. The chocolate is scary stuff. We see chocolate and think it's AOK to eat...99% of the time. This chocolate is the 1%. All kids got sick and four parents = STAY AWAY

product_title: Coffee-Bitch-Slap-Extra Strong & Extra Smooth High Caffeine Coffee, Whole Bean
review_headline: Smells and Taste's like stinky socks
review_body: I was so excited to receive the coffee, based upon the reviews I thought it would be strong and "smooth".  I programmed my coffee maker so I would wake up to a nice cup of coffee and woke up thinking, "it smells like stinky socks, what in the world smells so bad?"  I poured a up of coffee and took a sip, I have never found coffee that was horrible, I've never met a cup of coffee I had to pour down the drain, I always thought that was just disrespectful but this is not coffee, it is ground up dirty, stinky socks.  Needless to say, it was a very expensive lesson, I've tried the other strong coffee Amazon sells and it has been great, I thought this would b fun to try well...I was wrong.  Expensive lesson learned.

product_title: Coke Life Reduced Calorie Coca Cola with Stevia 12 Oz Cans - Case of 12
review_headline: GMO, high fructose corn syrups and ill practices of business. yuck!
review_body: Your practice of business with millions of lobbyists at our capitol appalls me. I luckily live in Austin, TX where we have pride in our locally made sodas made with actual natural ingredients rather than high fructose corn syrups and genetically modified crops (GMO) banned in over 30 regions. I'm NOT a science experiment!

product_title: Eversafe MRE Full Meal Kit with Heater - Single Sample (Civilian MRE)
review_headline: avoid these mres.
review_body: This brand of mre is not a good one. Ordered 2 and one mre didn't have the flameless ration heater. The other one had no dessert! Neither one had coffee, creamer, sugar, moist towellete, brown mre spoon. I would recommend xmre. Thankfully amazon refunded me.

product_title: La Tourangelle, Avocado Oil Spray, 5 Fl. Oz.
review_headline: Tasted and smelled like rotten avocados
review_body: Tasted and smelled like rotten avocados...I'm not sure what I expected though...it makes sense that it would smell like that, I guess.

product_title: Premium Madagascar Vanilla Beans 1/4 lb (26-30 beans) JR Mushrooms Brand
review_headline: moldy/rotten
review_body: My first shipment was great, but this shipment,  95% of the vanilla beans were useless and rotted/moldy. Not fermented, I mean bad, off. I was very disappointed and couldn't get amazon or the vendor to do much as it seems it's very hard to make a claim these days.  They just lost my business buying vanilla beans in bulk. Too bad, b/c I need to buy half a pound of beans.

product_title: Green Mountain Coffee Wild Mountain Blueberry, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
review_headline: A good blend, but consume one or two a week to avoid overkill
review_body: A decent blend. You will recognize the flavor as blueberry. The fragrance is awesome which is what boosted this rating to a "3". Do know that too many in a row could kill it for you overall and then you'll avoid it in the future so maybe limit consumption to once or twice a week to further draw out the enjoyment.

product_title: Nut Roaster's Reserve Premium In-Shell Mixed Nuts (2.5 pounds) -- Almonds, Walnuts, Pecans, Hazelnuts
review_headline: Bag had more Brazilian nuts that were rotten with tiny ...
review_body: Bag had more Brazilian nuts that were rotten with tiny lil worms in them, very few almonds & walnuts, not sure I'll be ordering nuts from online anymore.

product_title: Hyland's 4 Kids Cold 'n Cough Nighttime Relief Liquid, Natural Relief of Common Cold Symptoms, 4 Ounces
review_headline: This was his 3rd day of being sick and even at his worst he immediately calmed down when I picked up
review_body: If I could give this a zero I would. I gave this to my 2 year old so that he could get a little rest since he was drowning in his mucous and couldn't breathe through his nose. He fell asleep quickly but less than an hour later he woke up crying really hard. I picked him up to soothe him but he was inconsolable for 15 minutes. This was his 3rd day of being sick and even at his worst he immediately calmed down when I picked up...except this one time after getting this syrup. Only after reading another review from another parent with a similar response did I realize it was definitely due to this drug. I do not recommend this product unless you want an inconsolable child who is already miserable from a cold.

product_title: Sunflower Seeds, Raw, Hulled, Organic, 5# Bulk

review_headline: You may wish to avoid reading the nutrition facts.

I like my coffee milky and sweet, so I just kept adding the creamer until I got my coffee the way I like it. I like it; it is sweet and creamy and has good spicy pumpkin flavor, but I can't afford to be adding 300 unnecessary calories to my morning coffee on a regular basis.

review_headline: Felt ill and stopped up digestion...

I wanted to like these so much but every time I ate them I couldn't digest them. My digestive system just couldn't deal..
And I felt ill each time after eating them. I would eat about 1/2 a cup w/ some chocolate chips.
I tried snacking on them on their own.
I also tried the new technique of soaking them in th fridge overnight, which is supposed to make them more digestible. For me each attempt was a failure.
I felt ill every time and I think it is bcs they were rancid .. It really is soo hard to get very fresh nuts.
I don't want to be mean to the company I just want to make sure others w/ digestive issues don't go through what I did.

review_headline: Tastes like rotted non-sweet beets
review_body:
- Tastes awful to me, unbearable. Tastes exactly like non-sweet beets, which to me tastes like vomit. I believe there are folks who like the taste tho, just like some old folks like eating liver, head cheese, etc.
- This has added lemon juice in it. I don't recall reading that before I ordered it.
- This has 75 mg of sodium per serving, which is higher than other beet juices.
In summary: worse than I had hoped, I'm throwing the entire case of bottles in the trash. Somehow a different brand ("Pure Clean Powder" brand) tastes way better than this.

product_title: ONE ORGANIC Matcha Green Tea Powder (250g) - USDA Certified Organic
review_headline: Might be OK in mixes, but avoid this for drinking
review_body:
Matcha green tea is a type of green tea where you ingest the whole tea leaf (in the form of finely ground powder), rather than drink the water from steeped green tea leaves. It can take up to an hour to grind an ounce of matcha, and that labor-intensiveness plus the relative freshness of the matcha tends to dictate the price, which usually ranges from reasonable-but-expensive to very-very-expensive.

This offering from One Organic is cheap culinary grade matcha. As a comparison, you can get "economy"/daily-use drinking matcha direct from Japan for about $12-15 an ounce. This matcha is @$20 for nearly 9 oz. Unfortunately, price is truly an indicator of quality matcha, and this tea tastes as cheap as it costs.

Right out of the package, you can see a clear difference between this matcha and higher grades. Fresh, good matcha should be neon green in color - the One Organic matcha is a dingy "Army" green by comparison (see the picture I posted for a comparison between One Organic and a "better than average" quality matcha that I had on hand which runs about $14 per oz, and is considered good quality but not highest quality).

I nearly always prepare my matcha as usucha, or "thin type" matcha (this refers to the consistency, not the flavor), and my usual amount is about 2 grams of matcha to roughly 4 oz of water, although you can change these proportions slightly to suit your taste. I tried several attempts of two different preparations using the One Organic matcha: matcha + water, and matcha + water mixed into @6 oz of unsweetened almond milk. I found both types of preparations to be undrinkable - very bitter and flat, with none of the smoothness and creamy mouthfeel (a quality called "umami", that is somewhat hard to describe, but is a kind of savory, "meaty" flavor) that a good matcha should have. Some of the better quality matchas even taste sweet. While some matcha can be slightly bitter, the bitterness is very mild and should not be the overwhelming aspect.

I tried different strengths of both types of preparation, and couldn't get anything other than an overwhelmingly bitter taste from the One Organic matcha.

I'm giving this two stars since if you only use it as a healthful additive to smoothies and baked goods and can disguise the taste, then perhaps this is good value for your money. But if you are interested in trying matcha straight (matcha + water), this would be a terrible introduction to it, and I cannot recommend it.

If you want to try matcha as its own drink, then don't start with this matcha. You might walk away thinking this is how matcha should taste and then never try it again. Instead look for "ceremonial-grade" matcha rather than "culinary-grade" matcha. Even the lowest-price ceremonial grade matcha will have a flavor profile that is more accurate to how good matcha tastes. Personally, my "daily-use" matcha is usually @ $12 per oz; when I want to treat myself, I'll sample a higher grade matcha that falls between $14-$20 per oz. If you really want to splurge for the best of the best, go for the $40-$50 per oz matchas.

Also, keep in mind that the reason why matcha tastes how it does is because of the potency of the high amount of amino acids it contains. A matcha that doesn't taste like "good" matcha is inferior not just in flavor but in the potency of its healthful elements.
[Sample provided for review]tter, the bitterness is very mild and should not be the overwhelming aspect.

product_title: Roland Sardines in Water, Skinless & Boneless, Low Sodium, 4.375 Ounce (Pack of 10) (Packaging May Vary)
review_headline: Great sardines- dangerous cans!
review_body: The larger sardines, like these ones, are always drier and denser, more tuna-like, than the small brisling sardines with the bones.  Sardines smashed onto a freshly baked sourdough baguette with garden tomato, red onion, olives, etc, whatever I have around really, is a simple, heavenly lunch- my favorite.     I also use sardines in other dishes and since no one else in my household is OK with bones, I have recently tried all of the skinless/boneless brands available on Amazon.  These ones are my favorite brand in water- they really pack in the sardines unlike other brands that may be 50/50 water/fish.  You get three fat, whole sardines compared to others that are three or four sad broken pieces swimming in oil/broth. Since I usually use some kind of sauce with these, the dryness isn't a factor for me, but it may be for some.  They are not overly salty and have a fresh, clean taste.    For taste and value, these would get 4 or 5 stars, however, the majority of these cans were defective. The pull tabs broke right off with little pressure and I had to stab the seam with a butter knife and use pliers to pull the lid back.  I managed without slicing off any digits, but it was a dangerous process!  I will put these back on subscription when there are no more complaints of defective cans.      (I will also change my star rating if/when the manufacturer fixes the cans- maybe they'll take note if there are several low ratings for this problem)

product_title: Wonderbag Non-Electric Portable Slow Cooker with Recipe Cookbook
review_headline: food temps unsafe
review_body:
I was very intrigued and wanted a Wonderbag the moment I read about it on Amazon. I thought it was a really GREAT thing that this was helping people and that my purchase was not only going to benefit me, but also someone that really needed it. I waited until I could justify the purchase and bought it this week. I followed the fluffing up directions, let it sit overnight and made a chili the next day, following every direction explicitly regarding boil times as if was my first time using it and I wanted it to work.

My chili contained beans, vegetables, and canned beef. After it boiled for the appropriate time I took the temp to make sure it wasn't over the 350 and wouldn't hurt the bag. I placed it in the bag nice and tight and forgot about until a couple of hours later I heard the food bubbling. I thought to myself , GREAT ! It's really keeping it warm and letting it cook. At dinner time 7 hours later I tell my husband I made chili and I go to get it out, and you can tell it is definitely NOT hot, at all. I took the temp and it was at 122. I don't know how long it was at that temperature and had to throw away the food.

Here are my issues - The Wonderbag will keep my food warm, and it will keep it cool, but from my experience the only safe way to use the bag is in that fashion for up to 2 hours. The danger zone is below 145 or so for bacteria to grow, and it can grow quickly. Someone else's 1 star review goes over that in more depth. It's not safe and it shouldn't be marketed as a slow cooker, it should be marketed as a way to keep hot foods hot for longer, or cold foods cold. It's good for that, and for that purpose I'd give it more stars.

My last issue is an Amazon glitch stating that this cannot be returned. If you contact them directly they are able to assist you and send you a return shipping label. Three weeks after I received a refund they still have not fixed the \\"no returns\\" glitch which is unacceptable. AlsoWonderbag should list safe food temps because many of the people that think this bag is just marvelous are going to end up getting sick from bacterial growth from the low holding temps.

product_title: Bolthouse Farms DAILY GREENS "Kale, Spinach, Romaine" 15.2 oz (12 Count)

product_title: Miracle Berry Fruit Tablets:TEN tablets Yellow Box Miracle Fruit Frooties Miraculin Tablets Large Size Tabs 10 600mg Per Tablet
review_headline: It's supposed to help you by not using any type of sweetener if you are craving something sweet while trying to avoid refined su
review_body: Let's get real. This will arrive to your door heralded as a new diet-miracle. Why? It's supposed to help you by not using any type of sweetener if you are craving something sweet while trying to avoid refined sugars or artificial sweeteners. While this berry's power to sweeten is truly novel, this product is not going to revolutionize the sweetener industry unless they figure out how to make it in mass quantities. Here's how this works: You unpack one precious tablet from the blister package, swirl it about on your tongue until it dissolves and then eat something sour. Hmmmm. OK. I tried sucking on a lime wedge. Not bad, tasted quite sweet, like key lime pie. In the same half hour, I tried some lime infused unsweetened sparkling water. Tasted a bit like a sweet 7-Up. Plain yogurt? Becomes sweet. Sound good? It might be if the effects lasted more than 45 minutes and you did not have to pay more than $1.25 per tablet. That's right... this brand was the cheapest I found online, and I still only got 10 tablets in a box for nearly $15. I think as a party trick it might be fun to pass out lime or lemon wedges with a tablet on the side to your guests, but otherwise, I think I will continue my search for alternative sweeteners.

I tried just picking the apples out (which was nearly impossible due to the fact that they chop them up into pieces smaller than a sunflower seed, and about 75% of my bag was apple bits), but the flavor of the rotted apples had affected the flavor of everything else. I won't be buying any more of the WildRoots mixes that contain apples.

The best cinnamon for medicinal use is Ceylon cinnamon. Cassia cinnamon is the cheapest and most common (e.g., Dollar Store) and is much lower in coumarin, but again... don't take it regularly.  Because cinnamon is a food, the FDA pays little attention... just as you can easily buy fish loaded with mercury.

product_title: Larabar Fruit & Nut Bar, Gluten Free (Pack of 5)
review_headline: Good bar, but dangerous to the teeth
review_body:
I like Larabar's food bars & the chocolate varieties are My favorite. I would have kept eating these save for the fact that while eating an Apple pie bar, 2nd bite, something in the bar, probably a shell of some kind. Needless to say it broke 1/4 of my back molar off my tooth. At work, in pain and had to go to my dentist so I could eat. I ended up spending $800.00 for the dentist and getting my 1st crown.
I did email the Larabar company and let them know what happened and that I wasn't expecting them to do anything but fix the processes they use to insure this doesn't happen again with someone else. Within about 2-3 days someone for the company called, asked a list of questions, when I reiterated that I wasn't seeking compensation, just a fix to the issue. The gentleman from Larabar said I would be receiving some letters in the mail in a week - 10 days. Sure enough, I received the letters and what they where was request for 20 years of dental records, proof my dentist actually did the work and so forth. I wasn't looking for compensation, just someone to fix the problem.
They are a great food bar, but as of now, nothing has happened, so I don't eat Larabars and recommend if you're going to eat them do it at your own risk.
The bars themselves get **** 4 stars and the company for not listening * 1 star

product_title: Green & Black's Organic Dark Chocolate Bar, Mint, 3.5-Ounce Bars (Pack of 10)
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body:
I have the Green and Blacks Organic Dark Chocolate Mint, but it does NOT say anything about a mint "center". It just says "intense mint taste" and I purchased two of them since I love both dark chocolate and mint and I usually purchase York Peppermint paddies and another brand of dark chocolate and mint. But this one does two things. It does taste wonderful and I find that the mint taste is more intense than others- and the chocolate is more silky and smooth.

But this thing left me sick! I was in the bathroom from just 1/2 serving and a serving is "12 pieces". I had only 6 pieces. I will not be having 6 pieces in one day anymore. I know exactly what it is. It is the peppermint oil. It seems that this brand uses more peppermint oil than other brands and I can taste more peppermint in this brand. I think I'll just stick with York. safer.

product_title: Albanese Sugar Free Mini Fruit Worms, 1 Pound
review_headline: Avoid unless you want to get sick
review_body: These sugar free worms made me so sick. Very bad stomach pains all day. I didn't even think of the possibility of it being from the worms until I read the other reviews here. The worms tasted really good. I just wish they didn't make me sick. Nope.

product_title: Raw Whole Macadamias (1 Pound Bag)
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: These did not sit right in my stomach.  I got sick after eating them every time and even skipped work one day.  I'm usually fine with macadamia nuts.

product_title: Avitae Caffeinated Water
review_headline: bad batch?? made me sick.
review_body:
Before opening a bottle, the water looks perfectly fine and clear, but within an hour or two after opening each bottle the water starts to become gray and cloudy, at which point it starts to make me feel sick.
I thought perhaps I had received a shipment that was past its expiration date, but this was not the case - the printed expiration dates on all the bottles was for 2015, so I have no idea why the stuff seemed spoiled.

product_title: Healthworks Cacao Powder Parent
review_headline: Please avoid this product!
review_body:
Please avoid this product for the following reasons:

1- I have tried two different brands of organic raw cacao before and this one tastes nothing like them.The others tasted more intense and had darker color and were very slightly bitter. This one tastes more like any unsweetened cocoa powder that I buy at the grocery store. Most importantly, after three days of consumption, it caused me rashes all over my body. I'm not allergic to anything and didn't change anything in my diet except using this powder.

2- What added insult to injury, is that after I decided to not use it again, I thought of giving it as a gift to one of my friends. So I thought to put it all in one of the gift jars instead of the plastic bag so it would look nice. While transferring the powder to the jar, guess what! I found a dead butterfly, one of those tiny ones inside the bag. YES! A dead insect inside my food.......

3- Before purchasing, I was blinded by the good reviews so that I didn't bother to read any of the negative reviews. I wish I did so I would know that this company does not exist. It's possibly a person or a group of people who work from their homes and selling these items and are not located in the US . I tried to contact them by phone but on the web site I didn't find have any phone numbers or even an address and they pretend to be nice to their customers by replying to every negative review and asking customers to contact them via the email, but they do that to shut them up while in reality, if you contact them, they maybe reply once and then just ignore the rest of your messages!

Anyways, I don't care while this product is organic or not because I won't use it again but I will certainly contact Amazon and report the insect issue as they need to investigate whether this seller follows the US packaging standards or not.

product_title: Synergy Cherry Chia
review_headline: Smells like rotten beer and tastes like rotten fruit
review_body: Smells like rotten beer and tastes like rotten fruit. i seriously thought i had bought a bad bottle but it wasn't expired and apparently it's suppose to have that fermented background taste.

product_title: 20-count Grove Square Hot Cocoa and Cappuccino Single Serve Cups for Keurig K Cup Brewer Sampler
review_headline: Not worth the bsrgain price! People in 12-step programs need to avoid!
review_body: They all taste like there is alcohol inside! Watery, flavorless! Returning! And the spiced cider by them gave me a 3 day stomach ache that I am not yet over! Tried finding ingredient lists or calories and nothing.

product_title: Cracker Jack - 24/1.25 oz. bags
review_headline: Crap, avoid, not good at all.
review_body: Cost me $1,500 on broken teeth, avoid this product if you want to keep your teeth!!! it's so bad

product_title: Judy's Candy Co. Sugar Free Assorted Caramels
review_headline: Taste great but made me sick!
review_body: Unfortunately I had a bad reaction to an ingredient in these caramels, perhaps the Maltitol syrup.

product_title: Caffè Furia Decaffeinato, Italian Coffee Capsules for Nespresso Espresso Makers
review_headline: Marginally compatible-avoid until improved
review_body: Marginally compatible at best.  25-50% of the time I either had a water mess! leaky drains due to excess water runoff behind the pod or only a dribble of coffee or no coffee at all due to no puncturing of the pod front.  Avoid this one until they improve the performance. Cleaning the machine, prepuncturing, different cycle times failed to produce consistent results.  Too bad, because the flavor, when/if you got it was pretty good.

product_title: Intenso Caffe Nespresso Compatible Variety Pack (100 Count)
