I was looking into making this purchase and then chatted w/ an Amazon representative who verified that this item and descriptor seem to be too good and the representative doubted the vendor here the Lucky Vitamin would honor the sale/contract. She said that Amazon as always would stand behind my purchase with the A-Z promise but they could not force this vendor to live up to their own webpage postings.
So I did not order this item as the descriptor states { Alo Aloe Vera & Wheatgrass Drink (12x11.8 OZ) } per $1.59 w/ $5.95 for shipping and the picture clearly shows twelve bottles of Alo Aloe Vera & Wheatgrass Drink.

I would have ordered anyway and fought the good fight but I don't need the hassle of this small fry issue. But I do wish to warn others to beware of this seller

This vendor the Lucky Vitamin needs to verify the contents of their webpage postings before they go live onto the internet. As it stands it appears to be false advertising on the Lucky Vitamin part.

I would avoid this vendor as they do appear to be neither efficient nor truthful in their Amazon webpage postings.
--
-- Caveat emptor --

product_title: Earth's Best Organic Whole Grain Rice Infant Cereal - Case Of 12 - 8 Oz.
review_headline: Made my baby sick
review_body: Introduced this as baby's first food last week. Within two days he was having diarrhea after every feeding with the rice cereal, was covered in eczema and had horrible diaper rash.  (Also realized after purchasing that Amazon is way over priced. A shame, since I ended up just tossing the rest of the box.)

product_title: Walden Farms Mayo, Ranch, 12-Ounce (Pack of 3)
review_headline: great idea, but tastes pretty icky
review_body: I wish I couild like this more. It just has a weird taste. The starches or artificial stuff they use to replace the real cream and fat makes it taste really weird. If you're used to diets and things that taste bad you probably won't care. But if you're looking for ranch mayo, this ain't it.

product_title: Harmony ORGANIC WHITE TEA, 100 Tea Bags, 200g/ 7.05
review_headline: Now avoid China grown teas
review_body: Less than $5 at discount stores... Update: China has so much fluoride in teas. Kills bone etc.

product_title: Purple Dendrobium Orchids (10 stems Orchid with Rhinestone Mesh Ribbon Vase)
review_headline: Ordered for my sick cousin
review_body: Feedback from the receiver:  These flowers were pretty, but the vase was "too big" for the flowers.  Her daughter actualy brought a vase from home to the hospital because it bothered them.  Also, delivery was not as prompt as I expected, a day later than expected.

product_title: Roland Pearled Farro, 3 Pounds
review_headline: Great price on bulk Farro--freeze to avoid bugs!
review_body: Our local upscale grocer carries Farro in smaller packages, and is often sold out. I saved a substantial amount buying here in bulk, and it arrived quickly. I'll be back for more. Yummy stuff, if you like brown rice, you'll love Farro.  Updated:  After several months, I noticed that there were living BUGS in the bag. I threw it away, after using maybe 1/3 of it.  If you buy bulk Farro (or any other grain) please know that you should FREEZE it for a couple of days to kill any bug eggs. I now freeze rice, too.

product_title: Café Bustelo Coffee Espresso
review_headline: made me sick....
review_body:
i got this from local stop and shop.

honestly i don't know what's different about this stuff but it has been producing weird bad effect with me. the first time i used it, yea, high buzz. then the second day less. then ever since it's been producing weird, confusion sensations.

i been testing this for some time ad enough so far. it's been ruining my sensations for days, i decided to stop using this stuff. definitely, inconsistent effects and weirdness with stuff. i had other brands like this but not everyone makes stuff like this.

definitely better brands out there i tried.

and let's face it, coffee isn't something that pleasant in taste, the intention is the stimulus effect. if there's no stimulus and even worse, if it produces confusion, i don't think i want to bother...

very unsatisfied with this product.

product_title: Amazing Grass Raw Reserve Green Superfood Formulas
review_headline: if you've GERD, avoid this
review_body: This gives me the boost of energy but at a cost, I was left with burning irritation in my mouth and throat for few hours everytime I drank it as if I've just had some hot chilli soup. It took me a while to figure out what was causing it but as I started taking note of what I was eating, I found that this bottle has nasty cayenne pepper in it. Seriously, why would they need to put this stuff in it, take this pepper out, I'll buy it next time, for now this is my first and last bottle. I bought into all these positive reviews. Sorry, but I had to post this so other GERD sufferers don't have to go through all the hassles.

product_title: Miracle Noodle Gluten-free Shirataki Pasta
review_headline: WARNING!! Product can make you seriously ill!
review_body: i prepared this product with pasta sauce and actually really liked it, however THE PRODUCT MADE ME VIOLENTLY ILL.  I could not leave the bathroom for three hours and for two days afterwards I had serious gas and bad stomach pains, like someone was stabbing me in the stomach.  If something is too good to be true (no calories), then it usually is.  My advice is to eat a little at a time to see if you can tolerate it.

product_title: Premium Avocado Oil from California, by Bella Vado
review_headline: It's like rotten avocados
review_body: I am so sad to report how much I hate this avocado oil!  It smells & tastes just like rotten or at least super over-ripe avocados.  I really don't know how anyone can tolerate it.  Even my husband who likes his avocados very ripe couldn't use it.  I have been looking for an organic, unrefined avo oil, but this one is unbearable.  I'm going back to the refined one I used to buy until I find something else.

product_title: Knorr Bouillon
review_headline: Just tastes like salt.  Also includes MSG, which is something you should avoid
review_body:
It just tastes like salt. I didn't taste a cilantro flavor. It would be better to pick up some fresh cilantro at the grocery store or use something like [[ASIN:B000WS1KH2 Simply Organic Cilantro Certified Organic, 0.78-Ounce Container]].

The main ingredients listed on the Knorr Minicubes box are salt and monosodium glutamate (MSG).

There is a lot to dislike about MSG. See [[ASIN:B003UNL8LY The Truth About Aspartame, MSG and Excitotoxins]]. Here is a short segment from the book:

Mike Adams: I'm here with Dr. Russell Blaylock, and I'd like to explore some of the more advanced aspects of some of the things you are working on. Dr. Blaylock, I think readers know the basics of both MSG and aspartame, but can you review what you've already written about excitotoxins?

Dr. Russell Blaylock: I have three books. The first one is the exeitotoxin book, \\"Exeitotoxins:
The Taste That Kills,\\" and the latest one is and updated paperback reprint of \\"Health and Nutrition Secrets That Can Save Your Life.\\" The third one is \\"Natural Strategies for Cancer Patients,\\" which is directed at nutritional treatments for cancer. It contains some material about aspartame and MSG. Excitotoxins have been found to dramatically promote cancer growth and metastasis. In fact, one excitotoxin researcher noticed that, when cancer cells were exposed to glutamate, they became more mobile, and you see the same effect with MSG. It also causes a cancer cell to become more mobile, and that enhances metastasis, or spread. These MSG-exposed cancer cells developed all of these pseudopodia and started moving through tissues, which is one of the earlier observations from cancer.

product_title: Grove Square Caramel Apple Cider
review_headline: Tastes rotten!
review_body: This stuff tastes like the bruised spot on an apple. It really was not good. I would definitely not purchase this SUGAR FREE version ever again!

product_title: Campbell's, Chunky, Chipotle Chicken & Corn Chowder Soup, 18.8oz Can (Pack of 6)
review_headline: rotten eggs
review_body:
I got sick just over week ago but had no idea what it was. I knew it was something I ate. Well, I ate this last night and found out it was this soup!
The next day there is a horrible sulfur aftertaste that keeps coming back and back and back.

I actually got online to see if it had been recalled. There is something seriously wrong with this soup. I might call Campbell's.

product_title: Davidson's Tea Bulk
review_headline: icky, overpowering herbal shampoo smell and taste, where is the earl grey flavor?
review_body: Whoa, ok-I trusted that this was going to be a good tea because so many people had such good reviews. I figured I could at least appreciate it even if it was a little different from the norm. upon opening the bag-which I was quite excited to receive, I was overwhelmed with the aroma, not of tea, but of some herbal shampoo I've used in the past. Very much like a pure essential oil, hardly any tea in the aroma at all. And the same is true of the taste, the oil of bergamont is so strong that the tea is an afterthought. I love earl grey and I wish this was at least somewhat like that taste. Looks like I'll be continuing my search for a really quality earl grey loose leaf tea. I don't even know If I can give this to anyone...its so overpowering and the oil of bergamont has that bitter aftertaste... sooooooooooo disappointed-what do I do with this stuff?......

product_title: Miracle Noodle Gluten-free Shirataki Pasta
review_headline: stinky but good tasting
review_body: This has an amazing texture but bad  fish smell. The texture is like jello beads or tapioca. The smell is pretty rough though.

product_title: Milk-bone Treat & Play Milk-Bone Biscuit Size Medium
review_headline: dangerous!
review_body: My miniature pinscher chewed pieces off it first day she had it threw it in trash!!! Dangerous / hazardous for any animal.

product_title: Ekobrew Refillable K-cup Starter Kit for Keurig 2.0 and 1.0 Brewers
review_headline: Ekobrew itself is fine, avoid the gift pack.
review_body: Received this and the spoon and cup broke within a week. Company said they would replace but never did, wouldn't buy the gift pack but would buy just the ekobrew.

product_title: Navitas Naturals Organic Goji Berries
review_headline: CAUTION may be making you sick
review_body: I have had good luck with these in the past, but berries from the last two bags have given me stomach pain and severe diarrhea.  I used to have them with oatmeal, and it took me a couple of days to figure out that it was the GOJI berries that were causing it because it would take an hour or so before it would hit.  That was over a month ago, today I decided to try a couple of berries from a new bag and again I had stomach pain a severe diarrhea.  The current bag that is making me sick says "best by 03/18/15, LOT #2501326121"

product_title: Nutiva Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, 15 Ounce
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: I've been trying to eat healthier so I bought this coconut oil. EVERYTIME I used it in something I felt sick. At first I didn't make the connect but then I specifically made something with this in it and made sure that I wasn't allergic to anything else and it just made me feel sick. I then thought maybe it is just coconut oil in general but when I went to my mom's house and made something with her coconut oil I didn't feel sick at all. I wont be buying this again.

product_title: Nutiva Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, 15 Ounce
review_headline: Unless you love everything tasting like coconut, avoid.
review_body: This product shipped quickly and when it arrived both jars of oil had melted so they were sloshing around inside so we had to wait to open them. When we used this oil, it made all our food taste overwhelmingly like coconut. We are NOT coconut people, so this was really disappointing. If you love the taste of coconut, you should use this for cooking, otherwise I'd avoid it.

product_title: Green Cow Beef Trachea, 15 Count
review_headline: Really stinky, but the dogs love 'em!
review_body: I have to first say that all three of my medium-sized dogs LOVE these.  I purchased them when I was unable to get the Green Cow rawhide bones any longer and thought I'd see how these were received by my dogs.  Not sure how effective they are for cleaning their teeth, as the package claims, because the dogs each chewed theirs up within minutes.  They seem to be sort of the consistency of pork rinds rolled up like a tortilla...if that makes sense.  And it's too soon to know if they will agree with their tummies.  Now for the not-so-good...they are some of the foulest smelling things I have ever smelled.  I would say they rank right up there with dirty undies but worse, and you can smell them without even opening the bag they came in.  Not sure I will buy them again, which will sadden my dogs.

product_title: Pacific Natural Milk, 6 Count
review_headline: Terrible Flavor, avoid at all costs.
review_body:
I bought the unsweetened Vanilla flavor because the sweetened kind upped the calories in a major way (70 to 160). I can't think of anything in my adult life that I could use this for. I tried it on honey flake cereal and it tasted like I poured dirty water on it. Please get the sweetened kind if you are curious.

Not a hint of vanilla flavor, can't imagine drinking it plain or in coffee. Expensive for watered down milky grey hemp liquid.

For the omegas, I would highly recommend adding hemp oil to your smoothies, cereal, etc. or or tossing some hemp seeds in your cereal if that's what you're looking for.

Rice milk is way yummier.

product_title: MIXED CONGEE 12x13.4OZ
review_headline: No expiration date, kind of made me ill
review_body:
I have bought this stuff at the local Asian food store and liked it a lot.

For some reason the cans I bought from this merchant made me feel slightly off and gave me a headache.

I'm not sure if this is related but I noticed there's no expiration date on the cans.

Since the cans were pretty beaten up and the label was faded, there's no way to tell how old the product actually is but I'd guess it was pretty far past its expiration date.

product_title: Pacific Foods Organic Poblano Pepper and Corn Chowder, 17-Ounce Cartons, 12-Pack
review_headline: Good Soup, but be careful if you need to avoid sugar.
review_body: I purchased the Poblano Pepper and Corn Chowder and the Roasted Garlic Mushroom Lentil soups by Pacific based on the ingredients portion of the label that was posted alongside the picture of the soup.  My problem with these soups are not the taste per se.  They taste fine and I rather enjoy the Garlic Mushroom Lentil. In both cases, the ingredients that were initially posted were simply, natural and basic (meaning no un-necessary additives).  Well imagine my surprise when I discovered that the ingredients of the soups I received in no way shape or form matched what you see on the labels.  Specifically, both soups now contain sugar (something that was not always the case), which is something that I think should be more clearly stated for people who might have issues with eating food that contains that item.  It appears that at some point, the ingredients were altered, which is fine but when it comes to things like sugar, salt, and certain preservatives, I think the manufacturer should make their inclusion in the product very clear.

product_title: Pacific Foods Organic Roasted Garlic Mushroom Lentil Soup, 17 Ounce Cartons, 12-Pack
review_headline: Good soup, but be careful if you need to avoid sugar
review_body: I purchased the Poblano Pepper and Corn Chowder and the Roasted Garlic Mushroom Lentil soups by Pacific based on the ingredients portion of the label that was posted alongside the picture of the soup.  My problem with these soups are not the taste per se.  They taste fine and I rather enjoy the Garlic Mushroom Lentil. In both cases, the ingredients that were initially posted were simply, natural and basic (meaning no un-necessary additives).  Well imagine my surprise when I discovered that the ingredients of the soups I received in no way shape or form matched what you see on the labels.  Specifically, both soups now contain sugar (something that was not always the case), which is something that I think should be more clearly stated for people who might have issues with eating food that contains that item.  It appears that at some point, the ingredients were altered, which is fine but when it comes to things like sugar, salt, and certain preservatives, I think the manufacturer should make their inclusion in the product very clear.

product_title: Xanthan Gum 1lb Powder USP FCC Food Grade
review_headline: Possibly dangerous toxic reactions to Zanthan Gum - Please do your research before buying
review_body:
I'm not allergic to any foods. This Thanksgiving I went to my sisters, she made gravy with Zanthan Gum. Shortly after sampling the gravy I had a severe anaphylaxis reaction; my face looked like a puffer fish, my heart was racing, vertigo, my tongue started to swell - an Epi Pen had to be administered to prevent possible death.

I'd caution against use of this or at a minimum do your research! I'd say Gluten is much safer than Xanthan Gum. Although Xanthan Gum is in many foods as a preservative, this product by is used in excess to what most food manufacturers include in their products. Please at least look up Xanthan Gum in Wikipedia or other reliable sources before using.

Certainly would never give to children! Also, google \\"Simply Thick\\"(includes ingredient Xanthan Gum) to see new FDA recommendations based on numerous deaths, and ongoing lawsuits, of babies dying a direct result of Simply Thick added to their formula.

product_title: Green Mountain Naturals Keurig K-Cups, 72 Count
review_headline: For some reason these always make me sick.
review_body: I've always gotten this every year hoping they would change their recipe. So far no luck. It tastes fine however it smells so much better. I personally can not drink this because it gives me bad heart burn for whatever reason. In the end I always end up giving them to someone else.

product_title: Xanthan Gum, 4 oz.
review_headline: Possible dangerous / deadly toxic reactions to product if used in quantities greater than .5% of total food or liquid volume
review_body:
This Thanksgiving I went to my sisters, she made gravy with Zanthan Gum. Shortly after sampling the gravy I had a severe toxic reaction; my face looked like a puffer fish, my heart was racing, vertigo, my tongue started to swell, I developed sepsis and my lungs partially collapsed.

The packaging does not provide any guidance or black box warning (as it should!) about the severe toxicity if used in quantities greater than .5% of total volume of food or liquid. The manufacturer is negligent and even deceptive in marketing this manufactured product as if it were all natural.

Xanthan gum is a largely indigestible polysaccharide that is produced by bacteria called Xanthomonas Camestris. Manufacturers place the bacteria in a growth medium that contains sugars and other nutrients, and the resulting product of bacterial fermentation is purified, dried, powdered, and sold as xanthan gum. (Makes you wonder who first thought to put it in food, doesn't it?)

In other words, xanthan gum is an industrial processed product-- It is a polysaccharide produced by a biotechnological fermentation process--a chemical. There is nothing natural about xanthan gum.

Certainly never mix or serve to small children until the dangers are fully explained by the FDA's ongoing investigations. Currently, there are on-going lawsuits as a result of Xanthan Gum being added to baby formula to thicken it, the babies intestines developed holes and collapsed, resulting in deaths.

FDA has issued new cautions and studies as to this food additive's safety. It certainly should not be sold in bulk giving the appearance that it is a flour of some type very misleading and possibly deadly. We'll likely all hear more soon on this issue - just be cautious and know what and how much you are putting into your food and body - or your family's.

One lesser-known use of xanthan gum is in the oil industry. As a thickener, it can be added to drilling fluid or drilling mud to improve its function. Drilling fluid serves several purposes, including cooling the drill bit, providing hydrostatic pressure, and helping to lift solids out of the borehole and keeping those solids in suspension when drilling stops.

Gluten-free is not the same food just without Gluten, something else is added in it's place. FInd out what and how safe it it is - better yet, just avoid any foods with Gluten if you do have Celiac's disease. Shortcuts are rarely quite as simple as them may seem in my experience.d or drilling mud to improve its function. Drilling fluid serves several purposes, including cooling the drill bit, providing hydrostatic pressure, and helping to lift solids out of the borehole and keeping those solids in suspension when drilling stops.

Gluten-free is not the same food just without Gluten, something else is added in it's place. FInd out what and how safe it it is - better yet, just avoid any foods with Gluten if you do have Celiac's disease. Shortcuts are rarely quite as simple as them may seem in my experience.

product_title: Navitas Naturals Organic Maca Powder, 1 Pound Pouches
review_headline: Made me and my husband sick after using daily recommended serving size in a smoothie...
review_body: I purchased this after reading up on it, as it's supposed to be excellent for you. However, my husband and I both got sick after using the recommended daily serving in our smoothies. Not sure if it was a "bad" batch, but we sent it back for a refund, as neither of us was willing to try it again...

product_title: Matcha DNA Certified Organic Matcha Green Tea
review_headline: It's from China and I don't trust it. I've mostly been sick since I started drinking it.
review_body: I bought it, tried for several weeks, and only found myself getting sick. Don't know if it's the tea or not. But I don't trust consuming any product from China. I will trash this product and look for a source that I can better trust. It also tastes bad.

product_title: Walnuts Halves & Pieces, Raw 5 lbs. - Sincerely Nuts
review_headline: these people are smart they mixed old and new,some pieces taste ok other rotten.its not organic its not cheap.
review_body: these people are smart they mixed old and  new walnuts togather,some pieces taste ok other rotten.its not organic its not cheap(.i am better off with local grocery store.)some of the pieces taste and smell bad and do not taste fresh

product_title: Blue Diamond Almond Nut-Thins
review_headline: Pepper Jack Flavour is icky
review_body: normally, I love nut thin crackers and fill my pantry with them, but the pepper jack cheese flavour is gross. i can't describe it any better than that. It's like a false, powdery, artificial, gross flavour. I'll stick to the non flavoured nut thins.

product_title: Hormel Chilli No Beans Easy Open Can, 6 Count, 15 Ounce
review_headline: soy meat = beans= sick kid
review_body: My daughter is allergic to peanuts, which is a legume.  Because of that, she has an intolerance to all beans - including Soy beans.  Her tongue swells, and her stomach cramps if she eats soy and soy products.  I bought her a couple of cans of  no-bean chili from two different companies, to see which one she would like better.  She ate your Hormel chili No Beans, and after two bites, she couldn't swallow a drink of water, because of the swelling in her throat.  Of course it then occurred to me that you might be stretching your meat, like taco bell does and other companies do to stay "economical".  So I read (too late) the third ingredient is "textured vegetable Protein" which is fake meat made from soy. Soy is a bean - a legume, specifically, so exactly what I was avoiding by buying "no Bean" chili.  Sorry, you really shouldn't label this product "NO Bean" since the meat is actually made from soy beans.

product_title: Smucker's  Apricot Preserves, 18-Ounce (Pack of 6)
review_headline: A gooey, dangerous mess!!
review_body: I chose this review, not because the product tasted bad, but because the idiot who wrapped the 6 jars for shipping put the jars together in one bag and sent them off in a box containing a heavy 12" deep sauce pan with a dome lid.  Needless to say, these jars of preserves arrived smashed to smithereens and all the other items in the main box were coated with preserves.  A big gooey, dangerous, leaking mess.  The post office delivered the box in a big garbage bag set it on my front porch.  Thanks Amazon!!  Now I would like my whole jars of Pineapple Preserves, individually wrapped and remailed to me.

product_title: Kernel Season's Cheesy Jalapeno Popcorn Seasoning, 2.4 Ounce Shakers (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Awful...avoid at all costs
review_body: Had to give it away. Could not even put it on the popcorn without having a coughing spell. Something is wrong with this.

product_title: Dave's "Scorpion Pepper" Special Reserve 2014
review_headline: Extremely dangerous.
review_body:
Extremely dangerous and cannot be classified under any circumstance as food item. i can take very very hot food. I nearly went to the hospital with having just a couple of drops on an entire dish. Violet spasm, difficult breathing, immediate vomiting.
I have never come across anything like this in my life.
This is a weapon and can cause terrible injury.

product_title: Nutella - Hazelnut Spread, CASE, (96 x .52 oz)) 96 COUNT
review_headline: Expired upon arrival and made me sick.
review_body: When I received this nutella, it was put out for a buffett breakfast. I personally had one and it was hard, not soft like the rest of the nutellas we receive from U.S. Foods. Shortly after eating the packet, I started to get sick and immediatly checked the kitchen for an experiration date. The expiration date was hidden under a sticker that said single serving. The expiration date said sell by OCT and the date was scratched off the package. I checked multiples of these in the same package and they all had the same hidden expiration date with a scratched off date, like the company was trying to hide that the product was expired. I am so dissapointed with Amazon and shocked. I don't know if I can trust them anymore.

product_title: Alessi Biscuits
review_headline: At least one rotten package
review_body:
Today in the middle of making TiraMiSu, I have stumbled on a package with almost all of the lady fingers having dark green mold spots. So far, it is the first bad 7-ounce package (Exp. date 04/15/14). I took a picture!
I keep unopened packages in a cool and dry place.
P.S It took me twice as long to make the TiraMiSu -- I had to double check every single "finger" from the other three packages.

product_title: GoPicnic Gold Star Premium Ready-to-Eat Meals
review_headline: Snack Sticks are bad, they are rotten and moldy in the package!!!
review_body:
Update: I emailed gopicnic.com and they were very helpful in researching this problem and solving it. Their customer service was great and I could tell by their response they were concerned about this issue and are working to fix it.

Original Review: All of the snack sticks in this order are rotten and moldy, we just received them from Amazon this month. The packaging says best by Jun 4 2014 but something is definitely wrong. I feel bad that I sent these to school for my daughter to eat for lunch. Amazon says it's an item that is not returnable (food item) so I have emailed gopicnic. Very disappointing.

product_title: Coffee People Sweet & Creamy Nutty HAZELNUT ICED COFFEE (1 Box of 22 K-Cups)
review_headline: Hideous. Doesn't taste very good, and 9 grams of sugar + 3.5 grams fat makes it one to avoid.
review_body: Hideous. Doesn't taste very good, and 9 grams of sugar + 3.5 grams fat makes it one to avoid. Sorry.

product_title: Nestle Quality Street
review_headline: Old Stale and Melted Chocs made us sick!
review_body: I bought this for my mother who is English for her upcoming visit. We received it and the chocolate had  white bits on it as if it had been melted and gone stale. We thought it might still be ok to eat so we had one piece each and within half an hour we had stomach ache. I contacted the seller to request a refund but never received a reply. I tried again. No reply. One thing you should know, and I hate to say this since I'm half English, the English aren't great with customer service. They simply do not care.  If you have a problem, you are stuck with it and you're out your money. Poor quality item, terrible communication and bad work ethic. This review is a true account of what happened so if you buy from this person, do so at your own risk!!

product_title: Davidson's Tea Bulk
review_headline: Heed the other warnings and avoid this one.
review_body:
I like tea, I like Oolong tea, and this tastes like neither. It does not have the floral scent of Formosa Oolong, but an odd odor of 'peach' about it. There is no real taste to it, maybe it's old but it's wrong.

Other reviews warned away from this, and this is one time I should listened. Also, it is a 'no return' item.

The price may look good, but there's a reason it's so cheap.

product_title: 12 Count Box of Energems Milk Chocolate Energy Gems
review_headline: sooo ill!!!
review_body: A coworker and I are both very I'll from taking one each not recommended!!!!! We have severe stomach pain and chills from taking only one!!

product_title: Capitol Old Fashioned Marble Pound Cake [6 Pack]
review_headline: avoid!
review_body: Worst tasting pound cake you could ever think of buying. goes in the list as one of the worst tasting things iv ever ate in my life! may sound like im overreacting but its seriously that bad!

product_title: Back To Nature Cookies
review_headline: Crazy, dangerous packaging
review_body:
I buy a lot of these for my vending machines and have always liked the cookies but had questions about the packaging. Sometimes packages have twice as much product as they should; sometimes they seem light. Customers have complained (about the light ones, naturally; nobody ever said a thing about the overweight ones). Recently I received an open bag with a big magic-marker X on it. Clearly, whatever was in there was not supposed to be sold and consumed.

I have tried contacting Back to Nature (actually Kraft) many times. Their phone number says to visit their website, and hangs up on you. The website looks like it takes messages, but all you get back is error messages. I put the bad bag into an envelope and mailed it to the address on the packages, but it came back as insufficient address. These people have put a lot of effort into not being reachable.

What did you sell me, Kraft? What was in that open bag with the X on it? Why have you made yourselves impossible to reach?

product_title: Sun Maid Calimyrna Figs, 6-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
review_headline: rotten
review_body: half of the figs in the first bag i opened were either rotten or filled with a pollen dust. not to mention the heavy sulfur dioxide taste

product_title: Navitas Naturals Organic Maca Powder, 1 Pound Pouches
review_headline: Makes me sick
review_body: This stuff is nasty. It gave me heart palpitations and insomnia, and triggered severe PMS symptoms including breast pain, headache, irritability, and bloating. So I read something online about being able to use this stuff as a facial mask, and I thought I could use it up that way, mixing it with almond milk and spreading it on my face to dry. Incredibly, I felt the same ill effects when using it as a mask. I guess it went right through my skin to the bloodstream. I ended up throwing it out. Horrible product, hard to understand its popularity.

product_title: Deli Fresh Greek Kefalograviera Cheese (Dodoni), approx. 16oz (1lb)
review_headline: It was hot and rotten when it arrived made me sick
review_body: The cheese was no good when it arrived. It was hot and greasy and it took longer than usual to ship it so it went bad at some postal warehouse. It made me feel sick and was a waste of my hard earned money. I have ordered this cheese before and loved it but this batch went bad and tasted and smelled horrible.

product_title: Serendipity 3 Frrrozen Hot Chocolate Mix, 1.5 Pound Tins (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Serpen-icky
review_body: It was recommended this by ladies in line from the candy store. They raved about it! So I had to try it. It tasted very processed. I guess I have to go to New York to get they real thing. I like real chocolate this was not it.

product_title: Dirty Cracked Pepper and Sea Salted Potato Chips, 2 Ounce -- 25 per case.
review_headline: They are NOT all natual... some of the additives are dangerous.
review_body:
Look up maltodextrin and malic acid.... both are ingredients in Dirty chips!!!! The maltodextrin gives me and my
family extreme upset stomachs and diarrhea. My friend could not figure out why she got diarrhea every time she
had a po boy and chips. She cut out the chips and her stomach cleared up. Maltodextrin is being added to too many
dairy products also.
I think it is very deceptive to call the additives in these chips all natural.

product_title: Orgain Organic Nutritional Shakes, 4 Flavors, 11 Ounce, 12 Count
review_headline: It was curdled. Yuck!
review_body: I order the chocolate Orgain religiously. I decided to try the Vanilla. It was curdled and disgusting. Not sure if this one was bad or if they are like this. Yuck!!

product_title: Davidson's Tea Apricot
review_headline: I now tend to avoid it
review_body: I first found this at a Marshall's store and loved it.  I then found it via Amazon and ordered it.  However, I tend to avoid it because it tends to create bitter tea, even though I like the aroma.  I would recommend another white tea, perhaps the white ginger pear one at Trader Joe's.

product_title: Campbell's Go Soup Microwavable Pouch
review_headline: Blah! Really salty stuff, avoid it.
review_body: Taste isn't bad, but it is awefully salty. Won't buy it again! Probably not even worth a 1 star. If I could I would give it no star.

product_title: Annie Chun's Roasted Seaweed Snacks
review_headline: Horrible, spelled and tasted like rotten fish.
review_body: Horrible.  Everyone in my house agreed.  The folks who eat vegetables, said it tastes like Rotten fish.  I agree.  These things were much thinner than a potato chip (basically see through), and were NOT crispy as advertised.  Basically, it was horrible.  My wife, daughter, and I all had 1 bite, and then threw the 12 packages away.  I wouldn't feed these to my dog because then my dogs breath would smell like rotten fish.

product_title: Mio Liquid Water Enhancer Cherry Blackberry 1.62 Ounce (Pack of 4)
review_headline: I feel ill when I drink this.
review_body:
The tap water at work is laden with minerals and doesn't taste very good. I was spending a pile of money on bottled water from the vending machine. I've tried to use this to make the tap water drinkable.

I use MiO-fit instead of sport drinks during and after workouts and like it (alot). For some reason, the plain MiO makes me feel ill each time I drink it. I've used this flavor and the Peach Tea flavor with the same result.

The flavor seems OK but the trouble for me is too little of the product tastes watered down and is no more appealing than the bad-tasting tap water; adding more MiO quickly makes the water way too sweet. Drinking it makes me feel like I did as a kid after eating too much candy on Halloween. Yucky...

product_title: 100% Pure Grape Seed Oil - 1 Gallon by Massimo
review_headline: avoid!
review_body: Nope!

product_title: Doug's Last Wish Ultimate Steak Seasoning USDA Certified Organic
review_headline: disgusting, sick, cruel!
review_body: What kind of twisted sick mind decided to come up with this?!  To mock the horrific slaughter of a gentle animal in this way- you are VILE!

product_title: Doug's Last Wish Ultimate Steak Seasoning USDA Certified Organic
review_headline: Sick sick sick advertising
review_body: Man's inhumanity to his fellow Man is only eclipsed by his inhumanity to animals. Talk about brainwashing the public indeed...

product_title: Orgain Organic Nutritional Shakes, 4 Flavors, 11 Ounce, 12 Count
review_headline: Great drink when not curdled from 3rd party vendor.
review_body: Two out of 3 deliveries have had the drink almost curdled. There are solid like pieces that don't dissolve when shaken. Wherever these are coming from I suspect they are stored in extreme temps. When I buy this from Whole Foods or Walgreens, they are smooth and drinkable.

product_title: Blueberry Tea 4 oz bag of loose tea
review_headline: avoid this supplier
review_body: I really like Blueberry RED tea, but I never got it from this supplier who is listed on Amazon. First the order didn't come.  Then he said he sent a second shipment.  Then when it Finally came, it was blueberry BLACK tea!  Not my cup of tea.  I like writing good reviews, but ...!!!

product_title: Jeannie Prebiotics 100% No Animal Content Gelatin-free Dessert [High Fiber & Vitamin C], Assorted Flavor, 3.6oz Boxes (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Ingredients contain artificial & dangerous food additive and linked to intestinal inflammation, IBS, and more
review_body: The boxes were packaged well and shipped on time.  Additionally, I received a personal note and two extra boxes to share.  However, I was quite disappointed with the ingredients of the desserts.  The desserts are marketed as \\"Functional Health Foods,\\" and \\"it supports the immune system and maintains colon health.\\"  Yet, and I am really sorry I completely missed it, all the flavors contain different FD&C dyes (i.e. Red #40) which are artificial and dangerous (toxic) food additives.  Some flavors contain carrageenan which is linked to intestinal inflammation and Irritable Bowel Syndrome and more (for more information, go to either of these websites - [...]  AND/OR  [...] ).

product_title: Organic Valley Organic Single Serve Milk, 8 Ounce Aseptic Cartons
review_headline: Some of milk boxes were rotten!
review_body: I have purchased several times for my daughter’s lunch milk. The other day she came home from the school and told me that the milk was rotten. I thought she just didn’t want to drink it. Next day, I sent the milk box with my husband and he texted me during his lunch time that said the box milk was rotten. So I returned the rest and never heard any apology from the seller .

product_title: Vita Coco Kids Coconut Water, 6 Ounce Container
review_headline: Made us sick
review_body: I thought what a great healthy alternative to juice boxes, but they made my daughter so sick she was vomiting, so I tried one and got sick too. I drink Vita Coca all the time with no issues, just won't ever drink these again. They don't taste good either.

product_title: Mott's Medleys - Assorted Fruit Flavored Snacks - 80 Single Serve Pouches (4 LBs Total)
review_headline: unsafe snack
review_body: I will admit, we LOVE the taste of these snacks. However, they have corn syrup in them and I try try my best to keep my family GMO free.If they get rid of the corn syrup and replace it with something wholesome, I would buy them again.

product_title: Bombay Basmati Brown Rice, 10-pounds Sack
review_headline: This rice is very old and rotten
review_body: I ordered two 10 lbs sacs of this rice couple of weeks ago.  The rice is very very old and full with worms and bugs.  Disgusting!!!!!  Not even good for pig consumption.  NEVER EVER ORDER BOMBAY BROWN BASMATI RICE.  WASTE OF MONEY AND NERVES.

product_title: Earth's Best Organic My First Vegetables Baby Food Variety Pack (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Horrible tasting - made my baby sick
review_body:
I relied on \\"Earth's Best\\" as an organic wholesome brand. I guess organic doesn't always mean its going to taste remotely to what is labeled? I purchased this variety jar set as my babies \\"first foods\\" and regret it very much so. The carrots were the first we tried, by jar 2 my baby started vomiting violently. We called the Dr who suggested a trip to ER. They suspected food poisoning, as only food for baby is breast milk. We stopped solids for 2 weeks, wondering if it was too early (it wasn't, baby was 6.5 months old - pediatrician approved for foods, ER too said this is not gag reflex but stomach issue due to food/quality). We started again with the pea jar, and my baby only had 2 spoons and locked its mouth shut. I wondered, can it taste so bland? No. It tasted like flour and water, super nasty, super fake taste, nothing even remotely like peas. I felt so bad that I fed this poor quality to my baby, and vowed that was the end with Earth's Best, and from then only make my own baby food.

Once in a while, I do buy ready made baby food, for fruits/veggies which are not in season. My baby loves Plum Organics, no issues of gagging, no mouth shutting, and most importantly, no ER visits with possible food issues.

product_title: Aroy-D Pure Coconut Cream, 33.8 Fluid Ounce (Pack of 3)
review_headline: There is a hidden artificial ingredient - I got sick
review_body: This "cream" is not thick like other coconut cream, even when chilled all day in the refrigerator. Also, the cream did not separate and rise to the top when chilled; instead it was homogenous. Those should have been my clues #1 and #2. I made a recipe that I have made many times with another brand of organic coconut cream, using this brand for the first time. Within a half hour of eating it, I had a headache and stomach pains. Also, the flavor of this recipe that we usually love was bland and flat this time. As another reviewer commented, there must be an artificial chemical ingredient, or it's pesticide residues or something of that nature coming through. I recommend AVOIDING this product.

product_title: Yukon Gold Potato - 2 lbs Tubers
review_headline: Potatoes rotted after planting
review_body: We took a chance on ordering these potatoes since they were advertised as "certified".  We planted them like we have always planted potatoes.  Now they have all rotted.  We threw our money away purchasing these potatoes.

product_title: Campbell's Go Soup Microwavable Pouch
review_headline: This soup made me physically ill.
review_body: I have tried 5 different types of this Campbell's \\"Go\\" soup and I have enjoyed them more than the Campbell's Chunky that I used to get. That is until I tried this one. I microwaved this for two and half minutes in the pouch, let it cool for about 10 minutes attempted to eat it. Ate the first spoonful and I detected a strangely overwhelming bitter taste, thought it was unpleasant/weird and went for another spoonful. After swallowing the second spoonful my stomach began clenching and I became ill. Needless to say I am more than just disappointed. I have had curry several times (usually at a restaurant) and I have never had this happen.

product_title: Annie's Homegrown Snickerdoodle Bunny Cookies (Gluten-Free), 6.75 Ounce
review_headline: Good, but this batch made me sick!
review_body: I love these cookies, but I think I got a bad batch.  Everytime I ate them I was sick.  Not sure why?~

product_title: Da Vinci SUGAR FREE Blueberry Syrup with Splenda, 750 ml
review_headline: icky
review_body: It was very watery and not much like a syrup. It tasted nasty but it could have been the spenda. The flavor was so powerful

product_title: Carnation Instant Breakfast Essentials, Variety Pack, 10 count, 1.26-Ounce Units (Pack of 3)
review_headline: The ingredients in Breakfast essentials made me sick
review_body: I wish they will have formula without Lactose and without Soy ingredients. I am sensitive to Lactose and allergic to soy products.The present formulas( Classic French vanilla and chocolate flavor) made me sick.

product_title: Santo Domingo Ground Coffee 1lb. Bag
review_headline: Made me very ill, Coffee Drinkers Drink at your own risk.
review_body: Either someone tried to poison me or this coffee is really really strong, but about a half hour after drinking this evil stuff I began to feel some bad effects. Nausea, shakiness, stomach ache, dizziness, just really really bad! I have yet to find any other bad reviews about this causing anyone else such effects, but I am done with this forever. I am returning this to amazon for a refund, the tastes is wonderful but I got to pay for drinking it for the remainder of the day. Either I am really sensitive to this or I got a bad batch, not sure which since I have never had problems with coffee before and I usually drink Starbucks dark roast with no problems. Just wanted others to know the effects this coffee had on me, so the word is out there.

product_title: Udi's Gluten Free Everything Inside Bagel 14oz (Pack of 4)
review_headline: It made me ill
review_body: I read all the reviews on the Celiact website and it sounded like just what I needed as I have Celiac disease and I am lactose intolerant. It made me very sick so I am thinking that it must have contained a form of lactose that was not apparent to me.

product_title: Solofill K3 GOLD CUP 24K Plated Refillable Filter Cup for Coffee Pod
review_headline: Use a Keurig for what it was meant for - K-Cup Coffee and avoid this like the plague
review_body:
My office recently purchased a Keurig to replace its dying drip machine. I enjoy quality coffee - I have a Pavoni Europiccola at home - and thought the Keurig with the Solofill K3 would make at least a decent cup.
I've used my Kyocera hand grinder at varying grinds and come to the same result every time: either a sludge-filled (think a B- cup of french press coffee) disgusting mess or a cup of tasteless brown water (actually, scratch that, both cups are tasteless). And by the way I'm not exaggerating. This thing truly makes a horrible cup of coffee.
I'm not sure what the other reviewers are drinking, but it certainly didn't out of the item I received in the mail.
If you have a Keurig (either by choice or out of necessity) do yourself a favor and stick with the K-Cups. It's (usually) not a great cup of coffee, but it's pretty darn good. If you want a tempermental cup that will cost you a lot of angst, buy yourself a single serve french press. With practice it will make a better cup of Joe than this trinket.

product_title: Raspberry Yogurt Covered Pretzels (1 Pound)
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: Gave me the squirts for days until I took pepto and, a few days later, digestive enzymes.  Might be unfermented yogurt cultures that start fermenting in your stomach and colon,  Bad news!

product_title: Maxwell House International Coffee Suisse Mocha Cafe, 7.2-Ounce Cans (Pack of 4)
review_headline: Too much sugar - dangerous - may become diabetics with that much sugar. Should
review_body:
Too much sugar - dangerous - may become diabetics with that much sugar.
Should have been made available with Stevia instead of sugar

product_title: Blueberry Yogurt Pretzels, 1 Lbs
review_headline: These made me sick
review_body: Gave me the squirts for days until I took pepto and, a few days later, digestive enzymes.  Might be unfermented yogurt cultures that start fermenting in your stomach and colon,  Bad news!

product_title: Yogurt Covered Pretzels 5 Pound Bag (Bulk)
review_headline: Might make you sick
review_body: Don't know if these are the same recipe as [[ASIN:B005Y5Y6MY B005Y5Y6MY]] or [[ASIN:B006MYTUWM B006MYTUWM]] , but those made me sick.  Had the squirts until I took pepto and, days later, digestive enzymes.  Recipe for those looks like unfermented yogurt cultures waiting to explode in your stomach and colon.  I would not suggest buying.

product_title: Miracle Frooties 600mg Miracle Berry 5 Tablet pack XL Tablets
review_headline: Works, makes you sick
review_body: I had one of these and then I tried it on a lemon and it tasted like syrup, then I couldn't stop eating the lemon, then I got sick and died.

product_title: Hi-Country Beef Jerky, Teriyaki, 16-Ounce Value Pack
review_headline: Came moldy and rotted. S*** packaging.
review_body: This item arrived at my house two days late and tasted horrible. To my disgust and surprise, i found many pieces moldy and rotted. I am never buying this product again.

product_title: Nabisco Oreo Sugar Free Chocolate Sandwich Cookies
review_headline: rotten
review_body: This product was dried up - crumbled and most of all had no taste..never again will order this product for my family.

product_title: Sam Mills Pasta D'Oro Gluten Free Rigatoni, 1-Pound (Pack of 6)
review_headline: gross!! Made me sick!
review_body: Maybe my body wasn't used to gluten free stuff or something...I felt sick all night after eating some of these.. I made the mistake of ordering 10 packs and  I threw them all away. I was going to donate to homeless but I realized they would hate it/and or feel sick! Too weird for me!

product_title: KIND Healthy Grains Granola Clusters
review_headline: made me sick
review_body: Every time I ate this iwould get bad bloating-gas-diarrhea but it was hours later so I didn't connect it. The last time I ate it I had severe diarrhea that lasted all night. Idk what's in this stuff that would cause such a reaction - it was really bad

product_title: Mario Pitted Black Olives, Medium, 3.25-Ounce Cans, (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Some rotten cans
review_body: Couple cans were full of rotten stinky olives, what a waste, couple cans were fine though, i do not recommend them

product_title: Neuro Nutritional Supplement Drink, 14.5 Ounce Bottles (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Was addicted to this stuff for a month and got extremely sick due to it
review_body: For about a month straight I was drinking neurosonic and neurobliss the five days of my work week. It got me feeling great through my day, never really questioned that drinking two of them would be awful for you. I started noticing I was having bowel problems didnt think much of it, just thought it was my diet. Then I was extremely fatigued when I would get home, muscle soreness, and just all around weakness. Well the last day I ever drank them about an hour after consuming I was presistantly vomiting for 12 hours, couldn't keep anything down and was dry heaving non-stop. And still thought it was just overworking myself, until my doctor explained to me everything that was actually in it, I was actually slowly overdosing myself on neuro.... All my symptoms were direct resolutes of the ingredients packed into it, took a while to have my body feeling normal again. Will never buy this product again. Neuro needs to better explain its products ingredients and how much should be drank in a month long period.... Probably only one bottle a month...

product_title: Blue Lotus - Masala Chai - Ready to Savor in a Moment…
review_headline: Black Pepper tea - avoid
review_body: This product is not a well balanced Chai. The taste is very predominantly black pepper. Very little flavor other than pepper. Avoid unless you like Chai that is extremely pepper flavored.

product_title: Iams Proactive Health Adult Chunks 17.5 Lbs
review_headline: Made my dog sick
review_body: I don't know how this particular bag differs from any other bag of IAMS I've purchased in the store, but my dog got sick after the first time he ate out of the bag I bought on Amazon. Had diarrhea for two days and was going all over the house. If you're going to order food from the internet, order it directly from a pet supply store, where they're more likely to do random QA inspections.

product_title: Bergin Nut Company Brazil Nuts Whole Raw, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Stale, 30% taste musty, rotten or otherwise off, lots of wasted nuts
review_body:
Well, this wasn't a nice experience.

I was browsing for organic nuts and stumbled across these.

In the end, I ended up ordering them because they were some of the cheapest and largest amount of nuts I had found.

When I finally received them, it turns out they were not organic. I had to do a doubletake and immediately checked my order history. It's true, they really weren't organic.

Unfortunately, this is yet another one of Amazon's listing errors. I apparently did not notice this prior to ordering either; think my brain read 'ounce' as 'organic'. I was searching for around 35 minutes prior to ordering, so that no doubt had something to do with it.

I figured what the hell; they were already delivered, I really wanted nuts, and because nuts are encased in shells (and thus protected from things like pesticides.. for the most part), I decided I'd eat them.

Oh boy..

They are stale. Both packages, stale.

The best by date says January 26th 2014. (mfg code 171260) Either they were not kept in proper storing conditions at Amazon's warehouse, or the best by date is a farce. Or, even worse, they are stored poorly at Bergin's facilities.

Even worse is the fact that on average about 1 nut out of 3 either tastes rotten, musty or otherwise has a foul taste to it, causing me to immediately spit it out, sometimes being forced to rinse my mouth out as well. This is the worst part about it, as I could deal with them being stale, but constantly being hit with a foul taste so often is not acceptable in any way.

I guess this is part of the reason I buy organic. Quality control with almost all non-organic (hell, even some big organic) companies is absolutely terrible.

Hoping I can get a refund or some sort of credit on this order. I definitely do not want a replacement and am not buying the only organic product they offer ([[ASIN:B000WJ6C3I Bergin Nut Company Organic 16 Ounce]] after this experience.

I guess I will have to either live without nuts (unhealthy) or try to pay up for a better, and obviously organic, brand of nuts (financial strain). *sigh*

If anyone knows where I can order organic nuts in bulk (5+ pound bags for example), please let me know. Amazon's search feature is absolutely terrible and I could barely find such bulk products.rganic 16 Ounce]] after this experience.

I guess I will have to either live without nuts (unhealthy) or try to pay up for a better, and obviously organic, brand of nuts (financial strain). *sigh*

If anyone knows where I can order organic nuts in bulk (5+ pound bags for example), please let me know. Amazon's search feature is absolutely terrible and I could barely find such bulk products.

product_title: Orbit Sugarfree Gum Fabulous Frutini, 14-piece Pack (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Nasty, threw them out. Old and rotten.
review_body: They were yuck!! I had to throw them away. Tasted like dirt. I was sold garbage. Don't buy. A waste of money

product_title: Fresh Spanish Limes (Kenepa) 2lbs
review_headline: Not high quality, mostly rotten
review_body: These were smaller than kenepas I've eaten in the past. Size isn't a huge deal... but half of these were rotten. Some too soft to touch without bursting, dark and gross. There were lots of sticks in the box, perhaps adding to the weight. Of the non-rotten ones, some tasted bitter, or sour. Most were astringent. I was rather disappointed, my friends were not able to share the opportunity to share a fruit I've had great experiences with in the past. That was disappointing.

product_title: Airborne (New Zealand) Manuka Honey 500g / 17.85oz
review_headline: Sad to have to avoid Airborne
review_body: I have bought and enjoyed Airborne products for years, and have not minded paying a premium for the Manuka honey.  I trusted Airborne implicitly, but apparently that trust has been misplaced.  The US FDA has published an import warning that specifically names Airborne as selling adulterated honey.  [...]

product_title: Dante Confections 98% Cocoa Stevia Chocolate Bars, Sugar-Free
review_headline: got me sick! :-(
review_body: think it was the chocolate liquor...I may just not be cut out for chocolate...oh well, search continues for cocoa and stevia and noth more nor less

product_title: Nabisco, Triscuit, Brown Rice Baked with Red Bean, Roasted Red Pepper, 9oz Box (Pack of 3)
review_headline: These made me sick!
review_body:
Considering that the regular triscuits never made me ill (not even once) ... the powder used on these crackers made me feel really ill. I gave some to a friend and he got massive diarrhea and started vomiting within an hour or so of ingesting them.

Whatever is used in these crackers gives really bad indigestion, heartburn, or etc. Leave it to the Americans to mess up some potentially very good ingredients!

product_title: Red Hots (Cinnamon Imperials)-2 1/2 lbs.
review_headline: Unsanitary unsafe packaging
review_body: These candies arrived in a simple consumer-grade zip-lock bag, not in manufacturer packing. The candy  appears to have been purchased in bulk and just scooped into bags and shipped. There is no reason to believe the weight is accurate, no reason to think the bag is sanitary ..no label as to content, weight, manufacturer, nutrition information...well you get the drift..it is in  plastic bag exactly like you have in your kitchen. I am sure this is totally illegal packaging and for good reason. This product should be puled from Amazon before someone gets sick.

product_title: Sugar-Free Gummi Bears 2.3 lb case
review_headline: Makes you sick
review_body: Ok, I did not read the warning, so I will allow for a two rating.  But get the ones with the sugar, unless you are diabetic, eating these is plain stupid. So ill, I lost half day of work, great colon cleanse if you need one.

product_title: Huy Fong Chili Garlic Sauce, 18-Ounce Jars (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Delicious sauce, unsafe packaging
review_body: We love, love, love this sauce in our house and so my father sent us this 12-pack.  The inner seal on 4 of the 12 jars is leaking, 2 of the 4 are only half-sealed.  The distressing part of this is that I emailed the company about the problem and heard nothing. zip. nada.  If they care so little about obvious product safety issues like leaking jars, what else is going on in their production line? I am not going to bother my father with a complicated return since half the jars were eaten before we noticed the problem.  This is not the only time I have encountered a problem with the seals; I had 2 jars from Target that had bad seals but thought it was just a one day production problem. It is a shame because the sauce itself is wonderful but not worth the risk.

product_title: Amoretti Cocktail Mix, 28 Ounce (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Tasted like rotten tangerine
review_body:
The product arrived well packed and in good condition, but tasted like tangerines a few weeks past their prime. I can understand the other review because the flavor was masked by other juices and sugars, but on it's own blended with ice with our without alcohol I wasn't impressed.

Update: I did contact the company about the issue and they were very quick to send me a replacement as well as another flavor to try out. The ones that they sent me were certainly better and the tangerine one specifically didn't have that rotten taste, so I might have just received a bad one initially. Still think there are better ones out there for me tastes, but I would say they are decent.

Changing from 2 stars to 3 because it's just average. Great customer service though.

product_title: Miracle Noodle Gluten-free Shirataki Pasta
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body:
First off, I had no issue with the initial smell or the texture. That being said...

EDITED

Everything I said about this could attributed to the very strong allergic reaction I had to this product. I ended up making a trip to the ER, being put on steroids, and being miserable for more than a week. I spent days weak as a kitten, dizzy like I was drunk, and had elevated blood pressure. You probably won't have the same experience but I advise caution. It left me horribly sick and feeling as if I would die. But again, that's my personal experience which is why I've edited this review to reflect that. I'm keeping the one star as it reflects my experience.

Finally feel somewhat normal again after a week, still not 100% yet. My review is very negative but I had a very strong reaction to this stuff. If you are sensitive to some vegetables, fruits, and eggs like I am you definitely want to take caution when trying this product. A shame, I could see myself getting a lot of mileage out of these as I seem to be the only negative reviewer who didn't have an issue with the smell and texture.

product_title: Maisie Jane's Bagged Natural Almonds, 16-Ounce (Pack of 3)
review_headline: Made me ill
review_body:
I read the reviews and thought this was going to be a good purchase. The first day I had a large handful, within a short period of time, I was physically ill. I was suspect of course since I never had these almonds before. I've had Planters and Diamond before with no issues, so I know I'm not allergic. I waited nearly two weeks before I tried these almonds again, taking only 1/2 dozen and eating them alone so there was no chance of another food interfering here. Sure enough, I was sick to my stomach again.
These are not a returnable item, so I'll just have to toss them. Two unopened bags, but I'm not comfortable giving them away. Not sure how to contact Amazon about possible food poisoning issues. I don't see a proper contact us.. thought I could comment on the return, but that isn't happening.
Careful with these almonds folks.

product_title: Coppertone Sport High Performance, Sunscreen Continous Spray SPF 100 6 oz
review_headline: Cannot recommend this sticky, stinky product
review_body: This spray-on sun screen has a terrible smell which lingers on the skin and forms a sticky layer film which is very difficult to wash off. It's just gross. As enticing as it may be to purchase a spray-on, high-SPF sun screen, do not spend your money on this product. If you've already purchased it, call Coppertone. They'll send you a postage label to mail it to their lab and issue a refund.

product_title: Natural Raw Almonds (4 Pound Bag)
review_headline: Good, but dangerous.
review_body:
I enjoyed the taste of these almonds. However, when I contacted the company regarding their pasteurization method, they said that not only were all their \\"raw\\" almonds pasteurized, but that they usually use the PPO method. PPO is a highly toxic fumigation treatment with propylene oxide, which unbelievably, was used as a fuel by the American Motorcycle and National Hot Rod Associations....until they banned it, because of its known carcinogenic risks to human beings!
I don't even feel right throwing these almonds outside for the squirrels. Yuck. So disappointed.

product_title: All Natural Vintage Wuyi Oolong (Wu Long) Tea - 100 Individually Wrapped Teabags - 7.0 Oz
review_headline: Very strong laxative effect; made me sick for 2 days
review_body:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000G1PAC6/ref=oh_details_o05_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1
[[ASIN:B000G1PAC6 All Natural Vintage Wuyi Oolong (Wu Long) Tea - 100 Individually Wrapped Teabags - 7.0 Oz]]

This product arrived on time, well shipped and sealed package inside. I was looking for a good tasting oolong tea to add to my supply of green and black teas. Like the good tasting, clear amber oolong tea I enjoy in Chinese restaurants. Upon opening the box and taking out a bag to make a cup, some brown 'powdery debris dust' shook out. The cup of tea was more brown and not as amber and clear as the restaurant oolong tea I wanted, although the taste was similar; not unpleasant. A bit as if mixing a good oolong with a bit of lipton tea only not as clear as either. An hour or two later, however, I was doubled over with a stomach ache and the tea's laxative effect was more severe than drinking a bottle of magnesium citrate which the doctor may recommend before a test or when backed up for a week and needing to pass a kidney stone. Only with a stomach ache to boot. It continued and I was sick for two days and could not leave home. I have never had a problem when traveling but assume much the same as when some people pick up a bug which has a similar effect. I have just read reviews that say some people use this for weight loss. I think there must be better, more healthy ways if that is what you want. I just want a good tasting cup of pure, benign, comforting oolong tea. I am tossing this stuff.

product_title: GoPicnic Gold Star Premium Ready-to-Eat Meals
review_headline: The good, the bad, and the stinky.
review_body: This is a variety pack, and the turkey stick is great. The turkey pepperoni packs are also awesome little treat boxes. The have 5 little packets of delicious food in each box, and I love that they require nothing: no refrigeration, no heating. Just open the box and enjoy! I would give those boxes a rating of five. However, the tuna box was awful: very stinky. Soo, I would give the variety pack a 3 rating only because of the tuna. FYI, the salmon in another order was similarly awful, but all of the others are just wonderful and wonderfully convenient! Personal opinion!

product_title: Optimum Nutrition Shaker Cup Mixer Protein Shake Workout Large Bottle, 32 fl oz
review_headline: Horrible product - avoid at all cost
review_body:
Wow, what a horrible bottle. The main problem is the seal that is created when screwing on the cap with the bottle itself- it just doesn't always screw on well and makes you question whether you have a tight seal or not. Secondly, the grid part which serves to break up the powders doesn't function as well and quickly as the spring balls do - and is much harder to clean in that sense since you have to pop the grid in and out to properly clean it. Plus there's more surface area to clean in general.

Pros:
- Large size - holds ~ 28 ounces of water
- Interior is easier to clean as it has a wider mouthed opening, thus allowing for larger hands to adequately clean the bottom

Cons:
- Screw on top doesn't always screw into place well. My friend had the same issue
- spring ball > grid in terms of efficiently breaking up the powder.
- Cap falls off all the time - is held in place by only two small pegs
- Ergo - the bottle shape itself doesn't fit very well in the hands, especially for people with smaller hands.

I'd never buy this bottle again. If you're gonna spend any money at all, just spend the $8 to get something better.

product_title: Libby's Organic Beans
review_headline: do not buy if you avoid sugar
review_body: It has cane sugar - that is not listed under contents-- Amazon needs to do a better job- due to diets - allergies etc

product_title: Healthy Times Premium Organic Teething Biscuits, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Messy and dangerous
review_body: These leave a brown mess everywhere and my baby can easily break off big chunks, which do not easily dissolve (choking hazard)

product_title: Darrell Lea Soft Eating Liquorice, 7 Ounce (Pack of 8)
review_headline: Made me sick!
review_body: This is not what I thought it would be! Ugh! I usually love liquorice but this stuff is awful. Will not buy again.  Amazon.com is awesome and I will continue to order from them.

product_title: Haribo Gold-Bears Minis, 72-Count, 1 Pound 9.4 Ounce
review_headline: Made me sick!
review_body: This product made me sick and I will avoid Haribo products in the future. However, other family members did find them o.k, but not good.

product_title: Galil 100% Organic Whole Roasted Chestnuts, 20-Ounce Bags (Pack of 3)
review_headline: One bag contained rotten chestnuts
review_body: The order contained 3 20-Ounce packages of chestnuts. ALL of the nuts in one of the packages were mildewed. Some of the nuts in the other two packages were mildewed as well, but I was able to salvage some of them. When I tried to return the order I found that it "not returnable." I certainly will not order this item again.

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: I didn't even eat one and it made me sick!
review_body: This brownie mix is not gluten free. I didn't get a chance to even eat a brownie. I only licked the whisk and spatula after mixing. About 15 minutes later I had stomach cramps and had to run to the bathroom (typical gluten reaction for me). If you are very sensitive to gluten I wouldn't take the chance with these brownies. I am surprised to see \\"celiac foundation\\" on the box.

product_title: Gold Mine Kelp Noodles, 16-Ounce Pouches
review_headline: arrived rotten and toxic!
review_body: I ordered some of these to try and they were good so I subscribed to received them bimonthly.  However, my last batch was brown and smelled like toxic waste.  Read some more of the low reviews and you'll see others saying the same thing.  You cannot return these because they are food.  From what I understand they aren't too healthy even when not rotten so maybe buy locally when you want them even if it's more expensive.

product_title: Yam Bean/Mexican Turnip/Jicama 10 Seeds - Pachyrhizus
review_headline: Experienced gardener, rotten seeds!
review_body: Same as the previous reviewer. All seeds rotten. I've tried everything and am now out of seeds with nothing to show for it. Waste of time and money!

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Chocolate Chip Cookie Mix, 19.0 OZ
review_headline: GF?  These make me sick
review_body: I have had made these a few times and each time I really need to watch how much I eat, as they will make me sick.  I wonder if they are really gluten free or if there is something else in them that I am sensitive too??  A coworker is sensitive to xantham gum, so I was thinking that could be it...but I eat other stuff with xg that doesn't seem to bother me.  Just be careful.  Even worse was the Betty Crocker Devil's Food cake mix.  After having a piece of that, the next day i was SO sick.  Sicker than if I eat a little of something I know is not gluten free.

product_title: FTD Flowers Always You Bouquet-14 Stems
review_headline: Late and rotten
review_body:
Helped a friend order these for her mom. They arrived after four days, and evidently half the flowers were rotten. Next time she'll just look up a local florist and order direct.

Fail.

product_title: Schar, Baguettes, Parbaked, 12.30 OZ (Pack of 6)
review_headline: A rotten Baguette
review_body:
11 were OK. 1 was rotten. I have no idea why.
I don't have time to return it. It looks good though.

product_title: ARCTIC ZERO Fit Frozen Desserts - 6 Pack - Chocolate Peanut Butter Creamy Pint
review_headline: Made me violently ill
review_body: I tried this on a hot afternoon when I had a hankering for ice cream and within hours I was violently ill throwing up and more- beware!

product_title: Sugar-Free Butter Toffee from The Swiss Colony
review_headline: Weird tasting / made me sick
review_body: I love toffee but not all the sugar so I thought I would try these.  Strong maple syrup smell and strange taste and after taste.  Then there is a warning that eating more than the 3 piece suggested serving size could cause stomach issues.  WELL 3 pieces and sick to my stomach a few hours later so not worth it.

product_title: Sans Sucre Classic Blondie Brownie Mix (sweetened with Stevia)
review_headline: made me sick
review_body: tastes good, easy to make, but made me sick! made my kidneys hurt. its the artificial sweetner! do not buy

product_title: Fresh Whole Rabbit
review_headline: I think mine was sick or something
review_body:
I was so excited when my rabbit arrived, but unfortunately it ended up being a terrible disappointment.

It wouldn't play. It wouldn't eat. And petting it made my hand smell funny.

I took it to the vet, but they made me leave and said that if I came back, they'd call the police.

I finally decided that maybe it needed some fresh air, so I took it outside, and a dog ran off with it.

Maybe they'll be friends.

product_title: Bell Plantation PB2 with Premium Chocolate
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body:
The powder consistency was OK.
the taste was a bit different for me. After a few bites to make sure I didn't like it I started to feel sick to my stomach.
In the end I gave it away.

product_title: Old Wisconsin Summer Sausage
review_headline: Terrible, made me sick!!!
review_body: Worst sausage I''ve ever eaten!!! Never buy it!!! Take care of your stomach!!! Also, too salty to eat!!! Worry about the quality as well!!!

product_title: MacroLife Naturals Superfood Bars - Fortified with Macro Greens or Miracle Reds - All Natural Raw Super Food Bars - 12 Bars
review_headline: Probiotic made me sick
review_body: I tried this bar for the first time yesterday and ate two, about 4 hours apart. The taste is great, but I developed significant abdominal cramps and bloating. I had to go to bed early because the pain was disabling and I had to use naproxen sodium for pain relief. I am still miserable almost 24 hours later.  I would not want this to happen to anyone else. I would check with a pediatrician before feeding this bacteria-containing bar to a baby.

product_title: MW Polar Fancy Whole Smoked Oysters Cocktail, 3-Ounce Units (Pack of 24)
review_headline: Awful crap-and, non-returnable! Danger, danger, Will Robinson!
review_body:
I should have read the reviews before ordering these. They are TRULY AWFUL! Don't order them, unless you want to get them to TRY to feed them to your cat. (mine won't eat them). They do taste like smoked oysters, great price, but horrible.

They crumble like some horrible stuff (you can't even fish ONE from the can). They all fall apart, into little pieces. too large, just gross stuff. Never again. You truly do, as they say, get what you pay for. I'd rather have paid a few more bucks to go to the grocery, or bought some that were 6-8 bucks more. Eccchhhh! Horrible stuff. Why does Amazon even offer them? Terrible, terrible product.

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Tastes good - made me sick
review_body: I have been gf for a few months now. I occasionally would splurge on gf baked goods from a bakery but I wanted to make stuff on my own. I have a more mild gluten issue: I can tolerate small amounts. I tried these and definitely reacted to them as I do when I eat regular baked goods with gluten. The reaction was a bit less severe than the regular products, but I reacted none the less. Beware. There is something off in the Betty Crocker gf products. I've also tried the chocolate chip cookies and had similar issues.

product_title: Two Pounds Of Turkish Pistachios
review_headline: every 5th nut was rotten
review_body: After eating the 10th or so rotten / moldy nut, I gave up. These nuts must be very old. It would be nice to have a fresh source of Turkish Pistachios.

product_title: Carolina Gold Nuggets Microwave Pork Puffies Bake-N-Puffs, Original, 16 Ounce
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: Cooked a small amount as directed. Product was extremely salty, and later I was very sick. Not sure if these were spoiled or what. Not at all like what I was expecting.

product_title: Mug Root Beer Diet, 12 oz Can (Pack of 24)
review_headline: I felt sick, when I tried to drink this soda...
review_body: I do fine with REGULAR Mug Root beer, but this really bugged me. I think it was the sweetener that made me feel sick at my stomach when I drank it. (It wasn't a bad pack, NO one else felt sick). I don't have food allergies, or anything like that, so it's really weird, that it would make me feel this way. So, you might want to try a can somewhere before you order this, if you have NEVER tried this before.  It tastes a lot like REG. mug root beer. but you can taste the sweetener in it so, be sure it agrees with you before you order a case.

product_title: Grove Square Cappuccino, Single Serve Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
review_headline: dangerous
review_body: That this product contains both sugar and sucralose SHOULD BE LISTED ON THE INDIVIDUAL PACKS or shipped with the packs so diabetics who can't have sugar don't accidentally ingest it. This product is commonly included in variety packs I receive as gifts. There are a lot of flavored coffees and the majority of them do not contain sugar. Variety packs are great so you can sample many brands but there needs to be a legal requirement that they begin sending a list of ingredients for all flavors included (or find a way to fit the \\"potentially sensitive\\" ingredients on the lid).

product_title: Gold Mine Kelp Noodles, 16-Ounce Pouches
review_headline: Product was not as expected - possibly rotten
review_body:
3 of the packages were normal noodle in clear liquid, 3 were in a red liquid which was not ordered and not common for Kelp noodle in water, therefore we are not using any of the six packages as it appears they may be bad.

Unfortunately because this is a food item it is not returnable, so I recommend you do not purchase from this supplier.

product_title: Traditional Medicinals Organic Herbal Power, 17.6 Ounce (Pack of 6)
review_headline: icky
review_body: taste awful and made me sweattttttt like crazy.  Had to stop using it cause it made me so flush feeling.

product_title: Café Escapes Keurig K Cups
review_headline: Watery, icky taste
review_body: I don't usually do anything too fancy when it comes to making cocoa for my kids, just milk and a packet of mix, but this stuff was disgusting. I took three sips to be sure, but I just couldn't finish the cup. I brewed it on the 7 oz. setting. Perhaps, I'll let my kids try it after brewing it on the 5 oz. setting, but I'm not optimistic. I think I'll just have to stick with milk and Nestle Rich Chocolate in the Cocoa-Latte machine. I was really hoping this would work out, but I ended up paying $6 for 3 sips.

product_title: Fiber One Chewy Bars, Oats and Chocolate, 5-Count Box
review_headline: Tired of getting sick
review_body: My husband and I used to be HUGE Fiber One Chew Bar fans until the last 6 months or so. It seems every couple of boxes or so we get a couple that makes us incredibly sick. When it first happened to me I kind of blew it off and never mentioned it to my husband, then it happened again, and then a third time. I finally made mention of it to him and he admitted to having the same problem! This package is the last one we will ever be purchasing.

product_title: 9 Lives Daily Essentials, 15-Pound Bag
review_headline: made cats sick
review_body: I usually buy Cat Chow at the store.  I got this because it qualified for Prime.  My cats threw up every time they ate it.  I won't buy it again.

product_title: Taste Nirvana Coconut Water, Coco Motion, 16.2 Ounce (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Bad product - Made me sick.
review_body: Made me sick. The originial is good. Not the Coco Motion. It gave me motions. You cannot return the item. You are stuck with it. I will not recommend this product to anyone. Go for the plain original.

product_title: Yogi Tea
review_headline: It made all co-workers sick
review_body: This Tea had a horrible after taste. There was 3 of us who tried this tea at work. We all didn't like it. So you can multiply this reveiw by 3. That makes it thriple terrible. After first the taste is warm and thick, but then the after taste was thick and sweet in a not good way. The after taste lasted a very long time too.

product_title: Lowrey's Bacon Curls, microwave Pork Rinds  (chicharrones)
review_headline: Made me sick to my stomach
