review_body: I really was hoping to like these. I bought them on Subscribe and Save and was planning on getting them every two months. Now of course, everyone's tastes are different but not only did I find these unusually spicy, which is not necessarily a bad thing, I found them overwhelmingly salty; so much so that eating a bag literally made me sick to my stomach. I see that generally the reviews for this item are favorable. I guess I have a more sensitive stomach and/or palette than most :-)

product_title: Ty Ling Smoked Mussels, 3.66-Ounce Tins (Pack of 10)
review_headline: Again, kind  f gross and icky
review_body: These are, like the Roland brand, awful. Yeccch! Decided to try them instead of Roland. Just soft, mushy, gross. Virtualy inedible.

product_title: Dubble Bubble, Original Flavor
review_headline: denture wearers should avoid
review_body: Taste was nostalgic but unfortunately, I now have an upper dental plate and I'm finding that it's impossible to chew this gum as it adheres to the plate.  It is also proving difficult to remove. I was able to pull off the majority by hand  but the pieces lodged in the tooth crevices are not being so cooperative.

product_title: Hi-Country, Sweet Teriyaki Jerky Spice Kit
review_headline: The smell of it cooking made us sick.
review_body:
Not sure what spice was in it but the smell made my family sick and the taste was bad. You millage may vary. The video and instructions were good just the taste was bad.

Thanks
Robert

product_title: Hain Pure Foods Light Safflower Mayonnaise, 24 Ounce
review_headline: Kind of icky texture
review_body: The texture of this item is like a thickened jello. To cut the fat/calories, they used cornstarch to thicken it. It shows in the texture. It tastes ok, but the regular safflower is much better. I will not buy this again once I use these. My son has a corn allergy, so I have to be sure he has the right mayo on his sandwich.... I'm very disappointed with the cornstarch additive.....

product_title: The Green Cup - Coffee Pod Adapter for Keurig and Kcup Coffee Machines
review_headline: Warning, warning danger Will Robinson!
review_body: The only thing "green" is the color. Not a good value. You are locked into buying coffee pods that are for another type of coffee maker. Then you have to fold spindle and mutilate the pods to get them to fit so the bags are punctured. The coffee that comes with the purchase is the worst coffee I have had since Viet Nam.

product_title: Numi Organic Pu'erh Tea, Tea Bags
review_headline: Has a slight stinky fish odor when waking up the block
review_body:
Has a good puerh tea flavor. Good color, etc.

My only gripe is the icky fishy odor when you first "wake up" the puerh.

Expect about 3 cups out of each cube. I cut mine in half.

product_title: Turnbull Farms™ Fresh Gourmet Quail Eggs
review_headline: I started getting sick
review_body: These eggs were good, however, they started making my stomach hurt after 2 months.  I had sever stomach cramps, the cramps stopped after I stopped consuming the eggs.

product_title: Sjaak's Foil-Wrapped Organic Chocolate Bites, 0.25 oz.
review_headline: WARNING!!!!! Spoiled and outdated. Made me sick. NO STARS
review_body: I ordered the Sjaak's dark chocolate orange bites. These were spoiled and old. I tasted one and it gagged me and I had to spit it out. When I unwrapped another I could see how visably old they are. I will try to upload the picture. Then I looked at the label. They were 6 months past the expiration date. Now I feel sick to my stomach. So be warned. Unbelievable that this company would send these out to people. Irresponsible.

product_title: Pamela's Products Amazing Wheat Free & Gluten-free Bread Mix
review_headline: makes me sick
review_body: i dont know whats in this mix, but about 30% of the time I eat bread from it, I get awful stomach aches. May as well be normal gluten-containing bread. Don't waste your money like I did.

product_title: Solofill V1 GOLD CUP 24K Plated Refillable Filter Cup for Coffee Pod
review_headline: Further innovation needed to avoid coffee grinds
review_body: I love that I can use up my large bag of coffee in the V700 and create varied tastes and flavors, however I always end up with coffee grinds in my cup and it's not easy to clean this Solo Fill cup.  I'm mixed on it.  My plastic hinge lid broke after 1 use, too.

product_title: Swanson Purelo Lo Han Sweetener (Monk Fruit) 2.8 oz (80 g) Pwdr
review_headline: QC failure: 1mm grey particulate, "inulin danger" claims gross frippery
review_body:
{LOT# 125912} Tastes like warm honey. There are [initially] no unpleasant flavors or unpleasant aftertastes. However stir one tablespoon into 8 ounces of R.O. water and let sit 20 minutes. Now one detects an unpleasant aftertaste VERY similar to stevia. But how often will that happen? Sweeten to taste and consume happily.

taste: 5 stars
Quality Control: -3 stars

Inulin is NOT dangerous to consume as outlined in my review of the 7oz version of this product, ASIN [[ASIN:B006MRKA5K B006MRKA5K (Purelo 7oz)]]. Inulin is not a substance but a set of substances classified by the shape of the chemical structure. It is soluble fiber or more specifically a \\"digestion resistant starch\\" **

As I found four 1mm hard grey particulate near the bottom of the container I have lost confidence in the others. While it is likely the particulate is organic matter from earlier stage in production it certainly does not belong in a fine powder. Compare your lot number (bottom of container):

LOT NUMBER: 125912
EXP DATE : 05/14

PureLo like many things in life is best in moderation. A sweet tooth in the house decided to attack the first container spoon in hand. Initially sweet as \\"warm honey\\" as in my 7oz review, but as the monk appellation implies the sweetness paradoxically fades into unpleasantness.

Of the Lo Han concentrate powdered sweetener varieties this is the white powdered version. Jarrow offers the beige powdered variety. Until I receive a replacement for the Jarrow version it's unreasonable to compare -- Jarrow LoHan tastes like badly burned toast with Xylitol. Lakanto is another popular beige powdered version but cut with cooler Erythritol.

[[ASIN:B006MRKA5K Swanson]]: [[ASIN:B0087QLB3Y Inulin]] + LoHan (3:1)
[[ASIN:B005P0RAIU Jarrow]]: [[ASIN:B0013P3KC6 Xylitol]] + LoHan (3:1)
[[ASIN:B0046DPKBQ Lakanto]]: [[ASIN:B000Z978SS Erythritol]] + LoHan
[[ASIN:B007TGO1U8 Nectresse]]: [[ASIN:B000Z978SS Erythritol]] + sugar + LoHan + Molasses

.
.

** my full review from the 7oz version of the same product:

.
.

Tastes like warm honey. There are [initially] no unpleasant flavors or unpleasant aftertastes. However stir one tablespoon into 8 ounces of R.O. water and let sit 20 minutes. Now one detects an unpleasant aftertaste VERY similar to stevia. But how often will that happen? Sweeten to taste and consume happily.

Cooking is chemistry. If one entirely removes sugar replacing it with Lo Han expect UNexpected results. Use this as a sweetener only to avoid undesirable or unexpected results.

.
.

__fyi__
Proctor and Gamble hold the patent for the process of extracting mongrosides, the sweet parts of the fruit. Mogroside is found in the skin and flesh of the fruit. BioVittoria has a patent on the MonkFruit variety used in its trademarked products and a patent on MonkFruit processing. BioVittoria owns the trademark on Fruit-Sweetness and PureLo. BioVittoria Limited was founded in 2003 and is based in Hamilton, New Zealand.

NECTRESSE(tm) will likely be the most abundant USA based product for BioVittoria MonkFruit sweetener. UNFORTUNATELY Nectresse will be flavor-obstructed by the other sweetener ingredients: Erythritol, Sugar, Monk Fruit Extract, Molasses

.
.

__joy__

mmmmmmmmmmmmm!! And merely $29.69/pound. Amazon does not offer quantities larger than 7oz.

.
.

__science__

Inulin is a generic term to cover all beta(2-->1) linear fructans [1]. Inulin is a digestion resistant starch that not only promotes good bacteria in the gut and intestine BUT ALSO through this activitiy produces better immune function. Prebiotics include inulin, fructooligosaccharides, mannosoligosaccharides, and arabinogalactans.

* reduce triglycerides
* improve bowel habits
* promote more good bacteria than bad bacteria
* trains immune system
* strengthens immune response: T cells, B cells, NK cells, macrophages
* strengthens endocrine function
* enhance calcium and magnesium absorption
* improves glycemic control
* decreased risk of colonic diseases
* decreased risk of non-insulin-dependent diabetes [2]
* decreased risk of obesity
* decreased risk of osteoporosis
* decreased risk of cancer

Unlike baseless claims of toxicity through inulin consumption written lunatic-style here on amazon inulin is net-beneficial. Find below some studies cataloged on medline (actual-science) vs some guy raving on his blog. Using the DOI (Digital Object Identifier) number you can fetch the study through whichever indexing system you prefer. Interweb search \\"using DOI\\" should you need assistance else dx dot doi dot org . PMIDs are exclusive to pubmed.

doi: 10.1017/S0007114511007276 ; 2012-Jan-16
Inulin promotes good bacteria in people

doi: 10.1128/AEM.07702-11 ; 2012-April-06
Establishes strong correlation between consumed quantity of chicory sourced prebiotic plant fiber with bacterial colonies in the gut and intestines.

doi: 10.1002/biof.186 ; 2011-Oct-28
Inulin stimulates stronger macrophages (immune cell)

doi: 10.1016/j.lfs.2010.11.014 ; 2011-feb-28
A patented prebiotic provided better glucose absorption.

doi: 10.1089/jmf.2009.0128 ; 2009-oct-12
inulin can increase the uptake of glucose despite insulin resistance.

doi: 10.1017/S0007114508055608 ; 2008-Sept-25 -- meta study
Inulin arrives at the colon undigested where it stimulates growth of beneficial bacteria. Through this and related activities inulin improves immune function and better regulates inflammatory response

PMID: 19076004
Consuming prebiotics (includes inulin) improves immune response in the gut and elsehwere, and improves peripheral circulation.

Find the luntatic-style review deriding inulin atop the stack for the 2.8oz version of this product: ASIN:B003IO20T4. Perhaps the reviewer and the five dozen or so people wrongly elevating it have reading comprehension impairments as the reviewer's quote refutes his assertion:

\\"Although Klebsiella is present in the colon of most people, it is held in check by beneficial bacteria and is harmless within the colon. But once it gets to other areas of the body\\"

- held in check
- must somehow escape to cause more drama

\\"but once it [escapes]\\"

And how does consuming Swanson's Lo Han sweetener or other inulin sources CAUSE escape of the cited bacteria?

ZERO evidence for the one crying bacteria wolf

.

BioVittoria has patented the Fruit-Sweetness(tm) product itself.

Fruit-Sweetness(tm) is approximately 150 times sweeter than sugar,.. concentrates [of] the sweetest part of the monk fruit. [The sweetness] comes from naturally occuring [sic] sweet constituents in the fruit called mogrosides. In pure form, mogrosides are up to 300 times sweeter than sugar.

sweetness intensity in monk fruit extracts is directly proportional toMogroside V content

product_title: Great Lakes Unflavored Gelatin, Kosher, 16 Ounce Can
review_headline: Made us sick and.....
review_body: This product and company are AWFUL!!!  I researched to make sure this product was GF and safe for our family with Celiac to ingest as a dietary supplement to help with leaky gut.  I could only order a 6-pack directly from the company, but figured that was fine as this product gets such rave reviews.  2 days into using 1 tsp a day per person in a hot lemonade drink---we were SICK with glutening symptoms.  Bad symptoms.  Within 2 days of not ingesting this product, we got better.  Not to mention the taste and smell of the gelatin itself is absolutely DISGUSTING---It literally tastes like eating smelly, boiled shoes.  I called the company to report our problems, and the woman on the phone was extremely rude and belligerent---insisting that there was NO way the gelatin made us sick and perhaps my kitchen was just dirty.  really?!  She would NOT refund my money unless I paid a 15% restocking fee---even though the product made us sick!!!  The gelatin is made from boiled cow hides from Argentina and made in Argentina also.  This product is horrible, this company is horrible and I wouldn't even let my worst enemy eat this toxic garbage!  I was SO angry after my phone conversation with this company--I can't even get myself to send the 6 cans back because I don't trust them.  Perhaps I can sell them online myself?

product_title: Mariani Sun Ripened Mixed Fruit No Sugar Added Dried Fruit 36 Ounce Value Bag
review_headline: smelled rotten, tasted worse.
review_body: dunno if i got a bad batch or if it was old, but the fruit was mushy and rotten tasting. Smelled really bad too. threw it away as soon as i tried a bite. not happy with purchase.

product_title: Quaker Quisp Cereal, 8.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Ate as a child, avoid as an adult
review_body:
Corn Flour, Sugar, Oat Flour, Brown Sugar, Coconut Oil, Salt, Niacinamide (One of the B Vitamins), Reduced Iron, Zinc Oxide, Yellow 5, Yellow 6, Thiamin Mononitrate (One of the B Vitamins), Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (One of the B Vitamins), Bht (A Preservative), Riboflavin (One of the B Vitamins), Folic Acid (One of the B Vitamins).

Check those ingredients. The first five ingredients are basically sugar. Zinc Oxide is not to be taken internally. Yellow 5 & 6 are suspected carcinogens, and BHT is one of the nastiest, cancer-causing chemicals on the planet. Notice you don't find these things in healthy foods. I ate this as a child too. But if you bother to read labels, you will see that NO ONE should be eating this crap as a child or adult today. We didn't know any better in the 1960's. What's your excuse today ? I also have ADD from childhood. Wonder why, huh ?

product_title: 24 BAGS VIFON STYLE INSTANT RICE NOODLE BEEF FLAVOR
review_headline: The good, the bad, and the stinky?
review_body:
THE GOOD:

1) It tastes pretty good. It's certainly a lot better than ramen noodle soup. It's not as good as the kind you would get in the restaurant, but it's still very tasty and filling. I even really like the texture of the noodles.

2) It's super easy. Despite the directions being in poor English, they are still very easy to understand. Just dump the noodles in a bowl (tupperware is good, because it has a lid). Open the 3 packets that come with it (flavoring oil, soup base, and vegetables), and dump them in the bowl. Microwave 400 ml (approximately 1 3/4 cup) of water in a separate container until it's boiling (about 3 minutes and 20 seconds). Dump the water over the noodles, cover, and let sit for 3 minutes. Easy.

3) It's cheap. I got 24 bags for 22.75. Less than a dollar a package. That's a good deal.

THE BAD:

This is the item description when I ordered this product:

\\"ITEM DESCRIPTIONS 30 BAGS VIFON VIETNAMESE STYLE INSTANT RICE NOODLE BEEF FLAVOR OR PHO BO BRAND VIFON NET WT 60G OR 1 OZ. INGREDIENTS: RICE, SALT ,SUGAR, FLAVOR ENHANCER, MONOSODIUM GLUTAMATE, SEASONING: SALT, SUGAR, REFINED PALM OIL, FLAVOR ENHANCE, MONOSODIUM GLUATMATE, DISODIUM 5'-INOSINATE, DRIED VEGETABLE, SPICES, GINGER, SHALLOT, CINNAMON, ANIS, PEPPER, ARTIFICIAL BEFF FLAVOR, NATURAL COLOR, BETA CAROTENE, CARAMEL. PRODUCT OF VIETNAM\\"

1) There are 24 packages, not 30.
2) I am so dumb that I didn't realize that monosodium glutamate is MSG. After I had a a couple of packages today my head started killing me, and I couldn't figure out why. MSG gives me horrible headaches, but it took me a second to make the connection. If you have a reaction to MSG like I do, be warned.

THE STINKY:

Although the soup tastes good, it stinks. I mean... really, really stinks. LOL! It's not a problem, since it still tastes fine, but my room still stinks hours after I've eaten it and washed the dish out. Even after the tupperware dish went through the dishwasher, when I pulled it out, I could still smell the soup in it. I guess that tupperware bowl will just be dedicated to making this soup in it. LOL!the dish out. Even after the tupperware dish went through the dishwasher, when I pulled it out, I could still smell the soup in it. I guess that tupperware bowl will just be dedicated to making this soup in it. LOL!

product_title: Tostitos - Creamy Spinach Dip - 15 oz
review_headline: awful. avoid!
review_body: this dip is awful!!! what a waste of money. it smelled so putrid and the taste is horrific. just the smell of it makes you vomit. avoid!

product_title: Back to the Roots Oyster Mushroom Kit
review_headline: A waste, avoid this and save your money
review_body: Saw the reviews but being adventurous I thought id give it a shot. This is a complete waste of time and money. dont even bother

product_title: Hubba Bubba Max Outrageous Original Bubble, 5 Piece (Pack of 36)
review_headline: danger: contains ASPERTAME
review_body:
i liked this gum until i saw that it contains ASPERTAME.
this gum is not a sugar free gum so why use the dangerous
ingredient?

product_title: Kookaburra Licorice, Traditional Liquorice, 10-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 4)
review_headline: This product contains sugar which i avoid, and would not purchase had it been posted on Amazon.
review_body:
The label states this item contains sugar; however, that was not listed nor disclosed amongst the ingredients on Amazon.
I have tried to return the times, but I am blocked to contact Amazon regarding this, and a message says this item cannot be returned. I cannot use the item and wish to return them. If you cannot accept a return, please credit my account. Thank you.

product_title: Bariatric Advantage Complete MultiFormula Wild Berry Punch Crystals, 14.2 oz. 45 servings É
review_headline: icky
review_body: Taste a bit like alka seltzer and aspirin, with a bit of fruit.  Nasty.  It does dissolve well though and shipping was fast.  Taking into account that most products like this taste nasty, it meets the status quo.

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Made me very sick, go with King Arthur GF Brownies instead...
review_body: After eating several of these browines each day for 2 days, I am having incredible gluten allery type reactions; both intestinal and a dermatitis herpetiformis outbreak.  Coincidence?  Given: I ate more than I should have, but I did the same with the King Arthur brand and suffered no ill effects.  There is something wrong with this item.  I DO NOT recommend anyone with celiac disease consume these brownies.  I found that the King Arthur brand both tastes better and does not make me sick.  Even if this item is truly GF, it made me sick. STOP READING HERE IF YOU HAVE A WEAK STOMACH.  (The toilet was actually filled with \\"brownie mix\\" that separated out, floated to the top and lined the toilet bowl.  I've never seen anything like it in my life.) Shame on you Betty!

product_title: NoSalt Original Sodium-Free Salt Alternative 11 Ounce (Pack of 2)
review_headline: icky
review_body:
I bought for my husband who was on a heart healthy diet.
He tried it and wouldn't use it again.

product_title: Melissa's Fresh Pomegranates, Set of 6
review_headline: 1/3 of product rotten
review_body: 2 out of 6 of the pomegranites I ordered were rotten and I couldn't use them.  The price was already high, so I did not get the value I'd expected.

product_title: Cugino's Gourmet Foods, Ridiculously Delicious DIPZ!, Cheesy Bacon Dip Mix, 0.78-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Not that great, got sick of it after one batch
review_body: Its OK for one time, but get sick of it.  Its like thick cheddar cheese dip.  Too cheesy, not enough bacon flavor.  I use fat free greek yogurt to make it which is great alternative to sour cream.  I would love to try their other flavors but dont want to buy 12-pack to risk not liking it again.  I wish they made variety pack.

product_title: A 5+ Year Old Juniper Bonsai Tree in Japanese Setku Bowl
review_headline: Got sick and died within months
review_body:
It came infected with some mites or something and ended up dying a slow painful death.

To be fair the company did offer to replace it as it died well within their one year replacement policy. I did not end up taking them up on this as it required me to send back the bowl and you know, life just gets so busy and I was pretty sure I would just end up with another bug infected tree and didn't feel like starting down a path of having to send a bowl in to replace a defective tree every couple months.

product_title: Full Dozen Gourmet Dipped Swizzled Strawberries
review_headline: Too pricey for rotten berries
review_body: Ordered Shari's Berries for Valentine's Day.  The berries are premium priced, so I'd expect excellent quality berries.  Instead, half were overripe and half were green.  Nothing will kill your appetite faster than biting into a rotten berry.  The first box was shipped for the wrong day, so the company sent out a second one overnight to make it on Valentine's Day.  This box had at least 2 completely rotten berries, that had to be thrown out and several green/sour berries.  Come on Shari!  At those prices, you should have a little better quality control on the fruit.  Second box came several days later, and the entire box had to be thrown out.

product_title: Chimay Trappiste with Beer (8 ounce)
review_headline: If you like stinky cheese, go for it
review_body: Too soft and a bit stinky, which might appeal to some folks but isn't my favorite. A bit gummy, too.

product_title: Case of Hormel Compleats Creamy Chicken Carbonara (6 Total)
review_headline: Great if you want to feel physically ill!
review_body:
I know the other guy got a snippy comment for eviscerating this simple little meal, but look. There are plenty of inexpensive, microwave-for-a-minute food products that have *not* made me feel as though I am about to become violently ill. This is not one of them.

As soon as I opened the package, there were alarm bells going off in my head. "What is this brown, murky swamp doing in place of my chicken carbonara?" I should have tossed it right then and there, but I am stupid and therefore did not. I swirled the swampy bits around to see if maybe it would begin to resemble something food-like. Eventually, noodles and chunks of chicken made themselves apparent, along with wispy peppers and barely detectable bacon pieces. I hesitated. I allowed myself another moment of doubt, another moment during which I could have done the sensible thing and removed this unholy nightmare from my kitchen. But no. I put it in my mouth instead. It was...not good, but I kept at it with a weird sense of determination. It continued being not good, the only function of which it is capable. At some point, I think I developed Stockholm Syndrome; by the time I gave up--I think I'd eaten maybe two-fifths?--I was convinced it wasn't THAT bad.

It's been about three hours since I deemed this...stuff...fit to put in my body, and let me tell you: it is THAT bad. It really, really is. Things are happening to my stomach which should not happen to human stomachs. I have been on the verge of vomiting for at least 45 minutes. I actually felt motivated to write an Amazon review of a microwavable meal I bought for like $2.30 at the grocery store, so clearly *something* terrible has happened. Let me assure you, this Creamy Chicken Carbonara is in no way "creamy" and is barely chicken carbonara. It is an unnatural concoction spat forth from the bowels of hell, which in turn makes me feel like spitting forth from my bowels.

Please, dear God, I urge you to avoid this at all costs. Your life is worth more than this.

product_title: Romanoff Caviar Black Lumpfish, 2 Ounce Jar
review_headline: If you like rotten fish stink...
review_body:
Then this is the fish roe for you!
Terrible and pretty much inedible.
Tastes like anchovies but a little fishier and saltier.

product_title: Chestnuts, Fresh, approx. 1lb
review_headline: all rotten
review_body: all rotten: not even one was ok to eat. very disappointing order. I wondor why it was was all like this

product_title: Tea of Life Tea, 2.12 Ounce
review_headline: Tastes horrible, but is great for when you're sick. :)
review_body: I can't say I care too much for the taste, as it is very mild and tastes strange even with some honey added. If you are like me, and prefer rich sweet flavors, you may not like this one. I was given this tea as a gift. Taste aside, I give it three stars for being literally the most effective tea to drink while you're sick. From my experience, anyway. The ginger soothes your stomach while you are suffering from nausea, though I am not too familiar with the other spices. (sorry, still new to this stuff!) I just know that when I get sick or even have a cold, this stuff aids in the recovery process. :)

product_title: Milk Chocolate Coconut Clusters - 1lb Gift Box
review_headline: icky
review_body: One of my favorite candy treats is coconut clusters. I have tried many brands, this has been my least favorite. My husband got these for me for V-Day. The candy is salty and has a toffee favor not really coconut, just weird. Fast shipping though.

product_title: Kellogg's Krave Chocolate Cereal, 11.4 Ounce
review_headline: Contains cancer causing GMO's, good taste but very unsafe to eat
review_body: i just read an article where a bunch of rats were fed moderate amounts of GMO corn and the rats in this study had huge tumors and suffered from liver damage. when i tasted the cereal it taasted incredibly chocolaty, sweet and lucscious but apparently this product is not supposed to make you gain weight and is only 120 calories per serving so that already made me wonder is it too good to be true? apparently it is because of all the modified genes.

product_title: 5 FRAGRANT Paperwhite Daffodil Flower Bulbs
review_headline: Old product, rotten bulbs
review_body: Ordered as an "add-on."  Product arrived in a twisted (open) plastic bag (like a grocery bag) bouncing around the box that had another item carefully packed in it.  Two of the five bulbs were completely rotten, as in, I could stick my thumb through them.  The others already sported 2" yellowed sprouts.  Also the bulbs were overly wet, and the Q&A sheet was wet and crumpled.  Bulbs typically are packed in shavings and aerated packaging.  These are old, seemingly "leftover" bulbs. Not happy.

product_title: Cento, Bean Lupini, 8-Ounce (12 Pack)
review_headline: rotten beans
review_body: My first case was fine, the second and third cases have had as many as 20 rotten beans and at least 10 in every single jar.  I have written to the company and they gave me free beans, but those still had a lot of rotten ones in them. Going to try another brand.

product_title: Ranise Tarufa Bianco (White Truffle Infused Extra Virgin Olive Oil), 3.38-Ounce Glass Bottle
review_headline: Poor quality, avoid this product
review_body: I dont normally write reviews but I this product is not good.  I should have listened to the other reviewer who said it tastes like regular olive oil, that review is spot on.  I have tasted good truffle oil and this is not it.  Not worth the price. I tried this because it was cheap but I am going back to truffle hunter brand which is fantasic.  And no I do not work for that company, they just make a surperior product.  The reviews reflect that.

product_title: Almond Breeze Almondmilk, Almond and Coconut Blend
review_headline: milk curdled
review_body: In a week the milk curdled and exp date said may 2013. Very disapointed and I bought a case of this.

product_title: Light Grey Celtic coarse sea salt, 1 lb. bag
review_headline: WARNING -- Could make you sick!!!
review_body: As other reviewers have already stated, some of these arrive with moisture trapped in the bag, and so did mine. When I cut open the bag, I was instantly hit with a sharp aroma of mildew! Would you ingest mildew with your salt? The back of my bag had a sticker with 12 07 2012 printed on it... So, it's been sitting around some warehouse for over a year. Yes, I know, not a big deal for salt, but for salt that wasn't properly dried out or not vacuum sealed, it creates a breeding ground for mildew. Apparently, this company has a problem with quality control over its packaging process. Maybe you'll be one of the lucky ones and get a bag that was properly sealed or wasn't sitting around for over a year in a damp, dark warehouse. Good luck and here's to your health!

product_title: Indomie Variety Pack - 1 Case (30 Bags)
review_headline: Easy to get sick of
review_body: I bought a box of these thinking I could eat these at work and save myself a lot of money.  After I had eaten 5-10 of these, I had enough.  They are delicious to have every once in a while, but daily will get really old really fast.  They all have the same basic flavor, with varying degrees of 'hotness'. They do seem like a really good alternative to ramen though.

product_title: Mrs. Grass Soup Mix
review_headline: makes me sick
review_body: Mrs. Grass chicken noodle soup without noodles or fat cube gives me intestinal problems. Does not list ingredients of broth mix. If contains wheat egg milk or gluten would explain my health reaction.

product_title: Royal Family Japanese Mochi Green Tea, 7.4-Ounce (Pack of 8)
review_headline: Awful, avoid like the plague.
review_body:
I have tried other Royal Family mochi, and generally have had positive experiences. I really enjoy the Azuki Bean one... This was definitely not the case with the 'green tea' mochi.

First they don't taste anything like green tea, I feel like even making the claim is dishonest. The only thing they have in common is that they are slightly colored green, thats it.

Secondly and the worst offense of all is that these mochi taste like someone poured a bottle of pungent perfume/soap into the filling. I can't even get the taste off my tongue, I dare say it's not even edible.

Into the trash they go.

product_title: Quaker Real Medleys (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Sticky icky
review_body: The first time I tried the summer berry oatmeal. Firstly, I am not a berry fan, but I gave it a chance. I made it and it was completely sticky and not very tasty. I, however, am willing to give it another try.

product_title: Jelly Belly Sugar Free Jelly Beans, Assorted Flavors, 2.8-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Tasty but dangerous
review_body: These tasted fine, but heed the warning on the label that they may cause a laxative effect in some people.

product_title: Timothy's World Coffee K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
review_headline: So weak and ill-tasting, to call this Expresso is criminal...
review_body:
In my search for a decent full-bodied cup of K-coffee, I have read from just about every major coffee site/blog on earth, and tried just about every \\"bold\\" K-Cup out there. I have come across a few gems (Emeril's Big Easy Bold, Tully's Italian Roast), and a few disappointments (Dark Magic, Fog Chaser). None were as misleading, off-tasting, and generally as abysmal as this fraudulently-called Expresso. For one thing, it's not full-bodied or strong in any way. It tastes watery, even at the 6OZ setting! For another, it has a strange burnt off-taste finish that I found in a few French Roast K-Cups. Sorry, I have nothing good to say about this one.
Timothy can call his coffee anything he desires. I must assume SOMEBODY who works there has had a decent Expresso in their life. If not, either fly to Milano, or change the name. To call this K-Cup Expresso in ANY way is criminal, IMHO... I would have given it zero stars if allowed...

product_title: Hostess Twinkies - 10 Individually Wrapped Cakes - 13.5oz
review_headline: spoiled rotten!
review_body: I recieved this order today(JANUARY 2nd) at 1:52pm, and upon opening the box I found partially smashed twinkies. They didn't taste good, were falling apart, cold, wet, and some of them had mold. When I checked the expiration date, I noticed it was past the due date. I do not recommend this product to anybody!!!  Amazon has in the past fixed other order problems that i've had, but after they fix an issue, they have the audacity to request any bad review be taken down. I find this to be in bad taste!!. if one does not want any bad reviews, one should not provide a poor product, that does not at all live up to its advertising!  This review stays put, no matter what.

product_title: Alwadi Al Akhdar Baba Ghannouge, Eggplant Dip, 12.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Nothing like what you'd expect-avoid this junk!
review_body:
I received this today, and had ordered it because sometimes I crave the taste of Baba Ghannoche. As one of the previous reviewers has said, this tastes like hummus; no question. No eggplant flavor, tastes like hummus, out of the can. Even though the can says to add garlic, olive oil, and lemon to it, it still tastes like expensive hummus. I have made Baba Gannouche many times, from scratch. Not like this product at all.

Really terrible as a product, Amazon should be ashamed to sell this crap. And it does taste like junk that you'd never buy again, which I never will. "Warning! Danger, Will Robinson!" A total waste of money.

product_title: AeroShot Energy (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Nasty and dangerous
review_body: I received a free sample from their website. It does what it says. Instantly I felt energy but to the point I felt jittery and sick to my stomach. Maybe an hour later I had trouble breathing. It's now half a day later and I still can feel tightness in my chest. I'm a fairly active and healthy female. No health issues otherwise. It has less caffeine then a cup of coffee. I think you would be better off drinking that.

product_title: Kirkland Signature Campbell's Tomato Basil Soup 8 Pack
review_headline: Makes me sick thinking about eating it
review_body: I love soup, all varieties of it, but this stuff is so bad I can't believe it. I started eating it, and immediately I thought it tasted weird, but still edible. About halfway through the bowl, it dawned on me that it was the worst soup I have ever had. The taste seems to get worse the more of it you eat. If I dipped anything in the soup like grilled cheese for example, it would also become terrible. By the time I was eating the last couple bites I was literally choking on this stuff. If you think you want to buy this soup so you can taste it for yourself, then just come to my house and grab a can from me, then I can write it off on my taxes as a charitable donation, as long as you don't call the police and get me charged with assault.

product_title: Salem Baking Company Original Cheddar Southern Classic Cheese Straws, Family Size, 9-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Made me sick
review_body: I got the cheese straws in the cardboard package for Christmas, and I don't know what it was that made me sick but I ate them on two occasions and was sick on my stomach both times. They have a powdery taste, and do have a cheddar flavor so maybe it was the shortening or butter - or some spice, but I don't think I will buy any again. Disappointed because they look good in the photo.

product_title: Grove Square Cappuccino, Single Serve Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
review_headline: made me sick......!!!!!
review_body: Keurig should discontinue their partnership with Grove Square.  It tasted completely artificial.  No coffee taste at all.  It made me sick!!

product_title: Gimbals Scottie Dogs Licorice - Sugar Free - Black, 10 lbs
review_headline: Made both people that tried these very sick.
review_body: I ate some of these the first day I got them and I had major stomach issues all night. Thinking it must have been a fluke, I had a few pieces a couple days later and again I got sick. At this point I figured That it was just me. I gave some to a friend of mine who likes licorice, and I let him know at the time that I couldnt eat them cause they didnt agree with me. He ate a hand full and a couple hours later he called to let me know he was sick also. Not wanting anyone else to get sick, i threw almost the whole 10 lbs away.

product_title: Bauli I Grandi Classici Profiteroles Deliicous Holiday Christmas Italian Cakes
review_headline: Bad, dry, icky
review_body:
I love Bauli brand Panettone. So I thought I would try this item, I too bought it at Costco but not at a road show.

The cake is NOT shiny chocolate like in the photo, it is dull and lifeless so not even a good presentation. It was near impossible to slice with the proper sharp knife. The \\"cremes\\" are icky and artificial and nauseating. The cake is dry and not at all fluffy like the panettone.
I have returned it to where I bought it as even my not so fussy kids took one bite and said NO. Very disappointing since the picture is beautiful and I expected more from this brand.
I really did feel nauseated for hours after eating one slice. That's not typical for me.

product_title: Frontier Orange Peel Granules Certified Organic, 16 Ounce Bag
review_headline: Smells rotten
review_body: I got this item for the fresh and clean smell of citrus.  The moment I opened the bag, I smelled rot.  It doesn't appear to be rotten, but it smelled like something died in there.  There was no fresh citrus smell at all.  It gags me to think of it.  I am unable to return this item, so it's going directly to the outdoor trash bin.  It smells too bad to even put in the trash in my kitchen.  Something was definitely wrong and it's not returnable, so I recommend not taking a chance on this one.

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Made my daughter and I sick.
review_body: These brownies taste really good, but if you cannot tolerate gluten, you may have a bad reaction to it as my daughter and I both did.  She and I have tried these brownies 3 times now, and every time, we have both had bad intestinal reactions as she and I are both gluten intolerant.  We unfortunately had our 3rd reaction when I made them and forgot that a few months ago we did not respond well to them after 2 tries of eating them.  Beware if you are celiac or gluten intolerant and try the Gluten Free Pantry brand which we have had very good success with.

product_title: Sugar-free Sour Spiralz Lollipops - 4 Pack
review_headline: Horrible, icky flavor & just not good
review_body:
Sorry to say but we were not happy with these at all. I try to buy the candies that are not loaded with sugar for my kids, but these just missed the mark.

First off, in the picture they look much larger than they really are. And I mean MUCH LARGER. When I received them, I was shocked when I saw them. They are maybe the width of your finger (middle finger) and the length of it as well. So, they are tiny. In addition, they had shards of the candy filled in the bag where the sucker had broken in several places. Not likely shipping caused because Amazon sent them enclosed in bubble wrap, but you never know. The flavor was nothing to brag about. Not sure if I just received a bad set, or if that was the standard, but I would not purchase again. I was expecting a lot more, and better quality, for the price I paid. I hope you have a better experience! :)

product_title: Create-a-treat Gingerbread House Kit, Deluxe Model net wt.2.66 lbs
review_headline: Big disappointment...avoid this brand.
review_body: Our family makes these gingerbread houses every year at Christmas time - in completely different environmental conditions from hot and humid to cold and nippy. So we have lots of experience putting the houses together so they stand in any conditions. Despite it being cool and no humidity this year, the frosting in this kit was just soft and unable to hold the house sides up or the roof on. The kids finally just gave up and piled the pieces on top of one another.

product_title: Lucy's Cookies
review_headline: Made me sick :(
review_body: These tasted great but I got sick after eating them. When I looked into it turns out oats are not safe for all people with celiac disease and these cookies contain oats. They are listed as gluten free oats but apparently some percentage of celiacs react to oat avenin as if it were gluten. Wish Lucy's would have put that warning on the label. :(

product_title: Gluten Free Cafe Soup
review_headline: Very salty, rubbery chicken, but you know, I'd rebuy for sick days
review_body:
I bought a can of this soup at Whole Foods to have on hand for when I might get sick. Well, thsi was the month. Bronchitis. While I prefer fresh made soups--and hubby got me Thai and onion broth from restaurants--I opened this one to try.

It's not as bad as some have written. But then, again, this company may have quality control issues. I did have the rubbery and few chicken pieces (used to that from my young days drinking Campbell's), and I supplemented it with canned organic chicken breast. The noodles were fine. Soft, mushy, slippery--which is good when one's throat is raw. The broth was just okay, and would have benefitted from HALF the salt. Super, super salty. That was the biggest drawback.

I hope this company reads these reviews and 1. comes out with a lower sodium type 2. improves or removes the chicken (seriously, no actual chicken pieces would be better than what's in there now, and they could call it chicken broth with noodles) 3. have BPA free cans . I don't know if they do, but I assume not.

I'd rebuy it for sickroom emergency days, but it's not great. It's adequate.

product_title: Ranieri - Flavoured Extra Virgin Olive Oil White Truffle - 250ml
review_headline: No Truffle scent or flavor. avoid
review_body: arrived earlier today. i was going too use it for a few things for thanksgiving.  once i opened the bottle, i noticed no scent.  i knew right away there would be little or no flavor.  tasted the oil alone on a spoon, about 2-3 drops.  just olive oil, no truffle flavor.

product_title: Eden Organic Wild Berry Mix, 4-Ounce Package (Pack of 5)
review_headline: Got sick
review_body: I just ate a bag of these yesterday and got very sick last night.  I'm positive it was from the trail mix.  Buyers beware!

product_title: Fontana Sauce, 63 fl oz
review_headline: made me ill
review_body: I kept getting sick and thinking it was coffee that was the cause but it was this container with a green slime around the pump on the inside.  It eventually sent me to the emergency room.

product_title: Tea Forte BULK PACK Lemon Sorbetti Green Tea
review_headline: made me sick twice!
review_body: I drank some of this tea a month ago and within hours had a terrible stomachache and slept the entire next day.  I am a person who NEVER gets sick having missed only one day of sickness due to illness in 23 years as a teacher.  Then a few days ago I tried it again and the same thing happened.  I guess I won't try it again!

product_title: Corn Pops Cereal, 12.5-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
review_headline: dangerous GMO ingredients
review_body: If you read the label on Kellogg's Corn Pops, you will see that it contains corn, sugar, soy & cottonseed. According to the information Kellogg gave me when I called, they are using genetically modified corn, soy, sugar from sugar beet and cottonseed oil. These GMOs have not been tested long enough to prove they are safe and the first long term, independent, peer reviewed study on the GMO corn found it is linked to mammary tumors, organ damage and premature death in lab rats. Kellogg's refuses to label these GMOs because they don't want you to know. The stuff is sprayed with RoundUP and the corn & cottonseed are actually EPA Registered pesticides. My family thinks Corn Pops taste like chemicals and it is not surprising when you know what the ingredients are. Kellogg's Corn Pops gave us stomach problems. We are very sensitive to these chemicals and we have stopped buying all Kellogg's products.

product_title: New York Prime Meat USDA Prime 21 Days Aged Beef Rib Eye Steak Bone, 1-1/2-inch thick, 2-Count, 24-Ounce Packaged in Film & Freezer Paper
review_headline: This steak took 1 week to arrive...it was two orders of rotted meat...
review_body:
How do you think it smelled....therebis no way to contact them...unless i want to return rotted meat!!
Run from any meat that doesnot come froma butcher....
This is an AMAZON product....
I want a refund

product_title: Marutomo Katsuo Bonito Flake Hana, 16-Ounce Units
review_headline: please read - made my cats sick (or so it seems)
review_body:
First of all, my cats had no problem with these flakes at first. That's important to note. And, I stored them properly, per the instructions on the bag. But after awhile (perhaps because they were around for a long time), my cats started to get sick after eating them. Here's my story - and then you can decide whether you think you want to feed your cats these flakes or not:

Although these flakes are for human consumption, the ingredient (100% Bonito Tuna Flakes) is identical to that in other tuna flakes I've purchased for my cats. Given the huge cost savings buying these, I thought they were a great deal, and my two cats didn't seem to notice a difference. They ate the flakes as their nightly treat for a month, then another, and into another .... Eventually, my cats started to get sick nearly every night or near morning. At first, I thought one or both were going through a \\"hairball\\" period and tried their hairball treats. Nope, that didn't do the trick. Then I considered their food and pulled back a new kibble I had added to their regular diet given they both had dental care done a few weeks back. No change. So, on to the vet we went to make sure the problem wasn't a side effect of their dental procedures (e.g., infection, some other problem). Nope - my cats were otherwise healthy.

But the problem persisted and was becoming a real issue: I was tired of seeing them miserable (in the times I saw them during the time they were sick) and I was tired of buying (and using!) SpotShot to clean carpet stains. Finally, in desperation, I did the only other thing I could think of - I stopped giving them their tuna flakes. They weren't happy. They cried at night. I live in a rural area and was patiently awaiting the next order of tuna flakes for cats (paid for 1-day shipping, but didn't order until late on a Saturday afternoon - alas!) Here's the amazing thing: the nightly vomiting stopped. When the new flakes arrived (from a company I used before, who also sells flakes in volume, although about 1/3 the volume of this bag), I carefully started to give them their nightly treat again. No problem at all. They've been fine since.

I'm not a scientist. I can't conclusively state the flakes made my cats sick or at what point the flakes became too old to be safe for my cats. These flakes are labelled as for human consumption, but the ingredient is the same as what is in cat tuna flakes (although I thought these flakes might be a touch \\"smokier\\" in scent). But what happened is enough for me. I won't be buying these anymore. Not worth it. My kitties and I are back to a happy nightly feeding schedule with their old flakes and no problems!

product_title: Nature's Hollow Sugar-Free Jam Preserves
review_headline: Was rotten
review_body: Culd not eat it, but the other flavor I ordered was fine, not sure why it was not ok, when the other one was

product_title: Dr. John's® Sugar Free Simply Xylitol® Natural Mixed Fruit Lollipops (1 Lb.)
review_headline: icky sweet
review_body: If you like really sweet lollys then these would be the best by far for you.  For me, they were just too sweet. The positive is that you just cannot believe they are sugar free!!!

product_title: Gloria Jean's Coffees, French Vanilla Supreme, K-Cup for Keurig Brewers
review_headline: Strong icky fake vanilla taste
review_body: I bought this item after reading great reviews.  I did not like this coffee at all.  Maybe it's because I really like Dunkin' Donuts vanilla coffee.  Or the Starbucks vanilla lattes.  This coffee has a fake vanilla taste to it that has quite the bite and leaves a horrible taste in your mouth.  Some people like this coffee, but it's really not for me.  If you ever had the trader Joes vanilla creamer, it tastes similar to that, which I am not a fan of either.

product_title: Promax Lower Sugar Protein Bars (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Low sugar = potentially dangerous sugar substitute?
review_body: I love these protein bars, but am a bit upset with the marketing. I thought the term \\"low sugar\\" meant there was simply less sugar. It turns out in addition to this smaller amount of sugar, there is also a sugar substitute called \\"Stevia\\" which may or may not cause cancer... I would rather not find out. I will not be buying any more of these. In all fairness, this detail IS in the product description - my mistake for simply looking at the image of a familiar product rather than reading in-depth.

product_title: Barney Butter Almond Butter, Crunchy, 16 Ounce Jars (Pack of 3)
review_headline: Deliciously dangerous...
review_body:
The almond butter itself is very scrumptious. I personally eat it by the spoonful! In fact, my first jar was devoured within the first day of arrival!

Anyway, my almond butters seemed to be contaminated. After my first jar, I continued on my second jar; which was contaminated with what I believe to be salmonella or something really bad (I've done research that led me to this conclusion; lots of recalls on nuts!). The contamination caused me to vomit violently along with persistent stomach aches. THe third jar seemed to be have the protective seal broken with pinkish-oily material spread all over under the cap.

Be careful purchasing any nut based products as of now! There are many reports of recalls and salmonella outbreaks, especially almond-laced products!

product_title: Case of Propel® Zero Cherry Lime Powder Packets - Propel Packs
review_headline: This stuff made me very ill.
review_body: I got very ill from drinking this kind of Propel. I was drinking many different flavors and decided to try the powdered kind. I was so sick that I spent days in bed, and getting blood tests at my Doctor's office. One day the nurse told me to drink a lot of water and since this contains no sodium or sugar I drank about 32 ounces of it. I became sicker than ever and tried not drinking any more of it. Over night I was cured. I had itchy hives on my back and upper arms and I thought my dreded kidney disease had returned. Beware of this stuff, I don't know why it affected me that way but, I have a whole bunch of it that I'm going to trash first thing tomorrow.

product_title: blk Premium  Alkaline Water Infused with Fulvic Trace, 16.9 Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24)
review_headline: fulvic acid is dangerous
review_body: Producers of BLK have recently changed their bottler (and water source), removing the \\"spring water\\" from the label.  If these people have mixed fulvic acid with any municipal source containing chlorine or fluoride, it could be carcinogenic.  Please do your homework on fulvic/humic acids mixing with chlorine and flouride before you ingest this.  And do not use it if you are undergoing any therapy (chemo, etc.) that compromises your immune system.

product_title: Tate's Bake Shop Gluten Free Chocolate Chip Cookies, 7 Ounce
review_headline: Supposed to be gluten free but made me pretty sick.
review_body: These are supposed to be gluten free but they made me pretty sick. When I looked carefully at the package it says \\"made in a faciity that also processes wheat.\\" so I guess I can't trust it :(

product_title: Imperial Taste - Preserved duck eggs - 12.69 OZ. / 360 G - Product of China
review_headline: Horrible!  Could they be rotten?
review_body: I don't know if preserved eggs can go bad but these were absolutely horrible.  They didn't smell like a rotten egg but they did smell really bad and the taste was even worse.  Very disappointed as this was a gift for someone who absolutely loves these eggs.

product_title: Vivier France (Tin) Hazelnut Oil - Huile De Noisette, 16.9-Ounce Cans (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Rancid, rotten oil
review_body: Do not purchase this crap as it will arrive rancid and the cans are dented. If I had not been so busy, I would have shipped them back. Oh!!  Good idea.

product_title: Great Lakes Unflavored Gelatin, Kosher, 16 Ounce Can
review_headline: This stuff made me sick...
review_body: After reading the good reviews, I decided to give this gelatin a try.  Unfortunately, I didn't read Amazon's return policy first.  I gagged trying to drink this in water, so I tried mixing it in yogurt.  Still couldn't stand the taste.  Then I felt terrible all day. After smelling it, I had concerns, but thought I might be able to mix it with something to overcome the odor.  It didn't work, and it definitely isn't worth feeling bad.  I can't imagine how so many people can tolerate this stuff.

product_title: Gluten Free Homemade Wonderful Bread Mix
review_headline: Garbanzo beans can make you sick if you have trouble with soy
review_body: I love most Bob's stuff, but I bought this bread mix and made rolls.  I had two in one day and woke up with terrible stomach pains the next morning.  As most of us who must stay gluten free do, I went over in my mind what I had had to eat the day before and these rolls were the only new thing.  I then researched garbanzo beans.  They are in the soybean family.  My doctor has told me that I must also be careful of soy as well as milk unless it is lactose free.  The garbanzo beans were the problem so I had to go to another brand with the other types of flour.  If you don't have a problem with soy, the rolls were very good.  Wonderful taste and very soft.  However, you may need to stay away from it if you are allergic to soy also.

product_title: Mr. & Mrs. T Pina Colada Mix, 33.8-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Makes you sick
review_body:
Makes you so sick, stomach hurts, stay away!!!!

Not worth the cheap buy. Just go to the grocery store and pay a little more for good mixes.

Or go with brand name brands instead

product_title: Premium English Pumpkin Spice Scone Mix
review_headline: icky-poo sweet, inedible
review_body: Cheap and awful tasting.  No relationship to a scone.  Went right to compost bin. Can't believe this came from Seattle where I've had the best scones ever.

product_title: Black Garlic, 1lb Bag
review_headline: came slimy and rotten
review_body: i ordered it for my father when i was in town and i haven't seen him. he felt bad to tell me but i just asked him and he told me they came slimy and rotten. it's over 30 days so i am beat for $25.

product_title: Izze, Sparkling Mandarin Esque, 6/4/12 Oz
review_headline: Doesn't taste good and made me feel icky
review_body:
This is like the worst of both worlds. Flavored, unsweetened seltzer is fizzy and refreshing. Full on soda (made with fruit juice concentrate or sugar) is sweet and tasty. This tastes like ice cubes melted in your fizzy juice. It's fully fizzy but the flavor is so dilute as to be very unappealing.

Both my husband and I felt a major blood sugar drop after drinking this, which is weird given how few calories (50 per bottle) it has and that we drank it with food. (We had completely different meals, so I'm pretty sure it wasn't the food. And, we're both in good health.) I felt so lousy after drinking it that I read the ingredients three times to see if I'd missed some weird additive.

product_title: Tom's of Maine Natural Deodorant Stick, Aluminum Free, Long Lasting, Unscented, 2.25 Ounce
review_headline: The Unscented one is not really unscented and you end up smelling like stinky feet
review_body: I think I covered it all in the subject. The bar itself smells kind of like lemon, so it isn't really unscented as the company claims, first of all. They also claim it protects for 24 hours, when in fact it hardly protects for 4. I should've actually typed in protects between quote signs, because very shortly after putting it on you start smelling strange and as time goes by, it becomes a nasty smell, literally like feet that have been wearing sneakers in humidity. I am not overweight nor do I have strong bodily odor, but what I do have is a strong sense of smell. Honestly, I think the only way you could actually vote this product highly is if you: (1) have very poor sense of smell; (2), if you're 9 years old and still have extremely low pheromones; or (3), if you were paid to say so. If you wanna give it a try, I suggest you buy personal cleansing moist toilettes for when you're at work or away from home, and make sure you take the deodorant with you to reapply, because you're gonna need it. Perhaps this could be your cheap option for when you're at home, and you can have a better deodorant for when you go out? Personally, that's not enough for me, though. I've used way better deodorants that are not antiperspirants.

product_title: Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pineapple, 16.9 Ounce (Pack of 12)
review_headline: Vita Coco is usually great but avoid the seller
review_body: I love Vita Coco and thats why decided to go for this product. However, when I received the package - I was totally disappointed. I have opened 4 packs and all are used. Usually, every pack has two seals - one on the top and one at the surface of the pack. The one at the surface is broken suggesting it is a refilled and not original Vita Coco. I will highly advise you against this seller. Please avoid at any cost.

product_title: Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Another sick customer says NOT GLUTEN FREE
review_body: Oh, convenience.  You bring me back time and again to products that I should probably know better than to try. Like the other dozen or so one-star reviewers, I picked up this mix for some quick brownies and wound up with a full-blown gluten reaction - bloating, pain, nausea, the whole deal. I know this was the source of the problem because I haven't had anything new, different, or strange in a week or so. It couldn't have been the xantham gum because I had a very small portion - if the laxative effect is that strong in what would normally be considered a very, very small brownie (1.5\\" by 1.5\\",) then too much xantham gum is being used. The sad thing is, I used my brand new non-stick baking pan for this and now have to replace it (for the unaware, gluten can hang on in plastic, silicone, and non-stick coatings.) I'm just glad I had these after my anaphylacticly allergic child went to bed!

product_title: Miracle Noodles, Angel Hair - 24 Pack
review_headline: They made me sick
review_body: These noodles just arrived yesterday and I now know the secret of their weight loss properties: they will have you throwing up all night. I ate some of these for dinner last night and though I didn't really like them I thought I could at least tolerate them but I started feeling very full after I'd eaten a small ammount (which I thought was a good thing at the time) and ended up waking up at 2am this morning with intense stomach pain, nausea and vomiting. I have never had stomach pain this intense in my life and I have a very strong stomach so this was a horrible shock. I would NEVER buy or reccomend this to anyone ever.

product_title: EZ-Sweetz Liquid Sweetener, 0.75-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Bad dispenser; avoid
review_body: It's strange but these bottles are much flimsier than than the larger 2 oz bottles of the same product. You can't really  dispense just one or two drops with one of these. The slightest pressure streams way too much sweetener.

product_title: MIO Berry Pomegranate, 1.6-Ounce (Pack of 4)
review_headline: stil sick
review_body: my babe gurl is stil sick :((((( thes dont werk they jus mad her swet and her tooths red. but they taste gud as hell for babe meds, maybee they shood sell thes for fun.

product_title: 9GreenBox - 5 Money Tree Plants Braided into 1 Tree – Ceramic Pot
review_headline: This was a very sick plant when you sent it to me..horrible
review_body: the 9greenbox -box...the last one was the worst..the new one was beautiful one..the other is so sickly looking..I only paid $7.50 for it..I guess that is why it has been horrible..the one that I ordered around the end of June..was beautiful and healthy

product_title: The Peanut Shop of Williamsburg Green Boiled Peanuts, 8-Ounce (Dry Weight) Tins (Pack of 6)
review_headline: low quality produt - avoid unless desperate
review_body:
the few boiled peanuts that are good in the can taste great... beyond that, i can't find much positive to say about these. more than 50% of the product was rotten/mushy/empty shells/tiny undeveloped peanuts. they clearly put the absolute dregs of the peanuts they have in the \\"boiled peanuts\\" bin when they sort them at the processing facility. i bought a 6-pack an this was my experience with all 6 cans, so it was no fluke.

also, i emailed the peanut shop about this, thinking that they might be concerned... sadly, they weren't! at all. all they would say was contact amazon.

product_title: Waggin Train Chicken Jerky Tenders 40oz
review_headline: Very dangerous for your dog
review_body: I am a longtime loyal customer of amazon. I am a longer time animal lover, animal parent and foster. I would encourage anyone contemplating a purchase of any pet treat or food made or sourced from China to research them first. These \\"wholesome\\" chicken jerky treats are killing dogs. There is a Facebook page Animal Parents Against Pet treats and food made in china where you can find accurate information. The first treat could be the last for dog or it could take years and then one day that one treat kills him/her. Please don't take the chance. Find some Made in the USA treats on amazon such as Zuke's. don't take the chance, they're your babies and they trust you!!!

product_title: Waggin Train Chicken Jerky Tenders 40oz
review_headline: Please Beware -- Made our pups very sick
review_body: We are very careful about what we feed our dogs, and I thought these would be perfect, given they are just chicken...  Pups loved them; however, within a week they started puking and having diarrhea many times per day.  We couldn't figure out what it could have been from, as they have always been very healthy!  Thank goodness for our dog walker, who noticed these treats.  They had to get injections to stop their puking, and are currently on two meds and special food, to help remove toxins and calm their stomachs.  After reading other reviews, it seems like we were extremely lucky to have caught this so early.  DO NOT BUY -- NOT WORTH THE RISK!

product_title: Tazo Matcha Green Tea Latte Concentrate
review_headline: Tastes like rotten melon, looks the color of the dead
review_body: Do not buy! Does not compare to what you order from a coffee shop. When prepared, it has the color of dead zombie flesh and tastes like a rotten honeydew melon. Green Tea flavor is not detected. Disgusting and unpalatable.

product_title: Bacon Flavored Decorating Cake Frosting Novelty Gift
review_headline: Totally icky
review_body: OK, I didn't expect it to be like regular frosting...I mean, it's bacon flavored!  But the smell!  Ewwwwwwww!  The worst, though, is it wouldn't squeeze out of the tube.  I ended up cutting the tube open and even then.....it was so dry I couldn't do anything with it.  Don't waste your money.

product_title: Green & Black Organic Dark Chocolate Cherry ( 10x3.5 OZ)
review_headline: what an icky trick!
review_body: I've got to be honest, I don't care at all about free trade. I do care deeply about taste and this stuff takes two things I love and somehow screws them both up beyond recognition. what an awful disappointment. I don't think \\"tart\\" is a fair description, mouth puckeringly sour and acidic (not in a good cooking way, more like a stomach acid way) would be a more accurate description of the flavors. I don't taste any chocolate and not really any cherry (even tart) it's more just a chemical reaction with no flavor. it's actually similar to their chocolate chili bars - I love both of those things too and love the combination but rather than getting chili flavor and heat you somehow only get the unpleasant heat and no flavor.

product_title: Green Mountain Columbian Fair Trade Select K-Cups 80 Count
review_headline: If you prefer a strong bold coffee - avoid this.
review_body:
I try and try many Keurig blends and the biggest challenge is to truly find a strong bold coffee to match my Starbucks Dark Blends of French Roast or Italian. I have to blend this at the smallest setting and then it's still weak and I must add a Dark Magic or Emerills Bold with it otherwise it's much too weak if your used to a strong bold coffee blend. This tactic gets quite expensive.

The weakest point of a Keurig are it's boldest blends cannot touch an actual strength of a Starbucks French Roast which my wife packs into a cartridge in the Keurig daily as she is used to French Press and Keurigs weakest point are it's weak coffee blends in about 90% of the cartridges I've tried. I like Columbian Coffee taste but this stuff comes out like TEA even with the lowest volume of water. If you favor a weak tea blend then this is your cup of tea not coffee. ;)

product_title: Waggin Train Chicken Jerky Tenders Dog Treats - 48oz. Bag
review_headline: ANOTHER sick dog
review_body: My small dog loved these treats-- little did I know they were making him sick. I introduced nothing else new in his diet, and he began throwing up every other day, often tinged with blood. After he threw up his entire supper on the kitchen floor with pieces of this chicken very evident in it, I put the bag away and called \\"Waggin' Train\\". Not surprisingly, he hasn't been sick since. They don't think their food is toxic of course, but they did send me a refund for the bag I purchased. How they remain in business ethically or legally I don't know. I'm so thankful my dog has so far been able to handle the ill effects of the \\"chicken dog treats\\" (or whatever they really are); I know others are not as fortunate and have lost their beloved pets. I will never again feed my pet anything made in China. This company puts profit above health.

product_title: Earth's Best Fruit Variety Pack, 4-Ounce (Pack of 12)
review_headline: The food was rotten
review_body: Packaging was fine but the baby food were rotten. However, Amazon.com does not let me return it. This is not right!!!! I have put the pic of the food on packaging review page. Buyers should all take a look at it.

product_title: Waggin Train Chicken Jerky Tenders 40oz
review_headline: Made both of my dogs sick!
review_body: I have two large mix breed dogs and they both became ill after feeding these to them.  Don't risk it!!

product_title: KIND Minis Variety Pack
review_headline: Love the bars, but they made a dangerous change to the items included in this mix...!
review_body:
I really love Kind bars but I was very disappointed when they recently changed the mix of bars included in the multi-pack. My husband is allergic to peanuts but can eat all other nuts. Previously the mix included only one bar with peanuts, which was great - I ate those and he could have everything else.

In my last \\"subscribe & save\\" shipment, they sent a different mix of bars which has TWO kinds of bars with peanuts in them. I am mad that they made this dangerous change without alerting us - previously there was one \\"color\\" of wrap that my husband knew to avoid. He could have been sent into anaphylactic shock if he had mistakenly eaten the wrong bar because of the \\"blind\\" change.

The mix no longer includes the apricot bars.

product_title: Cavender All Purpose Greek Seasoning
review_headline: BEWARE!  This contains MSG a dangerous neurotoxin!
review_body: I bought this product and was very happy with it until I realized that it contains MSG a very dangerous neurotoxin.  Please check this out before using it again, you may want to find something safer.  [...]

product_title: Alvita Tea Bags
review_headline: dangerous for some health problems?
review_body: It isn't the product's fault that this review isn't better. I didn't realize when I ordered it that people with heart problems and high blood pressure weren't supposed to use it. I had seen a show about it on \\"Dr. Oz\\". Looks like he would have warned about any negative effects, doesn't it?

product_title: Amoretti Premium Cinnamon Syrup (750mL)
review_headline: avoid this product
review_body: I love the smell and taste of cinnamon and thought this would be a nice addition to my morning coffee.  It tasted terrible and actually gave me a stomach ache.  I threw it out.

product_title: Purina Tiny Bonz Dog Treats Filet Mignon Flavor 44 oz.
review_headline: sick dog
review_body: After my dog was sick for three days and had only had two of these Tiny T Bonz, I finally read the label; mostly chemicals.  I should know better but being a Purina product,  I figured it was okay.  Not the case with this garbage.  My suggestion: DO NOT FEED THIS JUNK TO YOUR DOG!

product_title: GROVE SQUARE (™) - Single Cup Coffee - Light Roast - 24ct
review_headline: Tasted like ammonia
review_body:
I got a new Keurig and thought it was my machine. One sip - it tasted like ammonia. I run a hot water cycle, check the water, no problem there. I then try another Grove Square. The smell was the same - ammonia. Nope - this insult to cat urine they call coffee is the problem.

I then ran another hot water cycle, and then one of the sample Green Mountain k-cups and I get a perfect cup of coffee. I thought I got a bad batch of stuff from Grove Square. Then I did a bit of research. Man was I stupid for even thinking this stuff was a good deal.

I could still taste the ammonia from the single sip I tried this morning by lunch. Yuck!

Did you notice all but three reviews give this horrible stuff 1 star and if they could they would have given it zero stars? DON'T BUY IT!!!

I will be taking this back to Wal-Mart and getting my money back.

EDIT: (5/16/12) Just got off the phone with the manufacture - I spoke to a very nice customer service rep named Heather. Apparently they are getting swamped with calls of people complaining about the product.

product_title: Keenan Farms In-Shell Pistachio, Naturally Tree Opened, Roasted with Sea Salt,  28-Ounce Jars (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Too many rotten pistachios
review_body: I love love love pistachios and the price was pretty decent on these but there are LOTS of rotten, or bitter pistachios.  ugh.

product_title: Kirkland Signature Ground Saigon Cinnamon, 10.7 Ounce
review_headline: This is NOT "real" cinnamon and is potentially dangerous!
review_body: The \\"real\\" cinnamon is Ceylon cinnamon. This stuff is the same, cheap knockoff that the USDA allows them to call cinnamon. In fact, this is Cassia, not even the same plant! This stuff is not what you want to use for health benefits because it has up to 1000x more Coumarin than Ceylon cinnamon. Coumarin has been linked to several health problems, even taken in very small amounts. Granted, when used in baking or cooking, this is not a problem, but if used for health benefits, where you take a tsp. or more at a time, it can be dangerous!

product_title: Splenda No Calorie Sweetener Packets
review_headline: Makes you ill
review_body: Do not consume splenda.  Research it and read how sick it can make you.  I know because I was consuming lots of it in tea and over a period of time I kept feeling worse and worse.  Muscle and joint pain and headaches were unbearable.  It is poison, first developed as a pesticide.  If you use it look for side effects.

product_title: Ekobrew Coffee Reusable Filter, Small, Violet
review_headline: Defective design avoid product. Company advertises Made in USA - lie Made in China!
review_body:
I received the product and carefully read the instructions that were included and examined the product and inscriptions on it. I cleaned it off, added my coffee and inserted it into my Keurig brewer. I lowered down the latch and noticed that the fit was not exact even though I had inserted the Eko cup. I brewed my coffee and then proceeded to clean out the Eko cup. That's when I noticed that even though the Eko cup was inserted, it had wiggle room to pivot in the K-cup holder and by doing so, the needle on the bottom of my K-cup machine that punches the drain hole into a pre-filled K-cup bottom had pierced through the bottom of the Eko cup ruining it. Now the manufacturer did make a cut out space for the needle to fit into, but the tolerances are not good enough and no warnings exist on the Eko cup or written instructions to caution against this situation. There are no alignment arrows imprinted on the cup and no directions to alert the user to make certain the fit is correct even if it seems that it is correct. So, I brewed a $10 cup of coffee and Amazon has a no return policy on this product. My advice: stick with the K-cup or Solocup until this design defect is corrected. Also of note, the manufacturer's website proudly displays a Made in USA graphic while the actual product is made in China. That stinks!

ADDENDUM ON APRIL 27, 2012: THE EKOBREW CUSTOMER SERVICE REP. CALLED ME AND WAS VERY NICE. I EXPLAINED THE PROBLEM THAT I HAD EXPERIENCED WITH MY EKOBREW CUP. HE ACKNOWLEDGED THAT THE PRODUCTS MADE IN CHINA HAVE THE ABILITY TO HAVE THE KEURIG NEEDLE GO THROUGH THEIR BOTTOM AND HE SAID THIS WAS DUE TO THE VARYING PLACEMENT OF THE NEEDLE IN THE KEURIG MACHINES. FURTHERMORE, HE SAID THAT THE PRODUCT HAS BEEN REDESIGNED TO TIGHTER TOLERANCES WITH LARGER SPACE PROVIDED IN THE AMERICAN MADE PRODUCT FOR THE BREWING NEEDLE. THE MADE IN USA HAS BEEN PRODUCED SINCE MID-MARCH. SO AMAZON ADVERTISED THE NEW PRODUCT, SHIPPED THE OLD, APPARENTLY INFERIOR PRODUCT AND EKOBREW IS SHIPPING ME A REPLACEMENT NEW PRODUCT. I WILL COMMENT ON THAT WHEN I RECEIVE IT AND BREW SOME COFFEE.

ADDEENDUM ON MAY 2, 2012: TODAY I RECEIVED THE NEW MADE IN USA EKOBREW CUP. COMPARED SIDE BY SIDE TO THE CHINESE CUP, THE CUT OUTS ON THE BOTTOM OF THE CUP APPEAR ABOUT 30% BIGGER THAN ON THE CHINESE CUP. THE CUP SETTLED DOWN INTO MY KEURIG MACHINE WITHOUT ANY DIFFICULTY AND CLEARED THE NEEDLE THAT PUNCTURES THE EXIT HOLE IN A STANDARD PRE-FILLED K-CUP. I WILL REPORT BACK ON MY COFFEE EXPERIENCE IN THE FUTURE. HOWEVER, IF YOU HAVE RECENTLY RECEIVED THE CHINESE EKOBREW CUP, YOU SHOULD REQUEST A REPLACEMENT FOR THE USA MADE CUP.

product_title: The Neuhaus Collection - Truffles
review_headline: Outdated. Hope we don't get sick
review_body: [[ASIN:B004LKGSB0 The Neuhaus Collection - Truffles]]  The box of truffles we received were outdated by a month and tasted funny. We ate them before we saw the date. We are in the process of trying to return them. Hopefully the seller will do the right thing.

product_title: Meow Mix Original Choice Dry Cat Food
review_headline: Made cats sick, destroyed beige carpet
review_body:
Have 4 cats and gradually worked in this cat food over the course of a month. Result was 2 cats apparently have an iron constitution.

One cat puked every other day although he continued eating the food so he did like it. Discovered that the reason I couldnt get it out of the beige rug is because they add RED DYE! That must be to impress the consumer, doubt cats care about the color of the food.

My other cat got very sick. Was puking alot, stopped eating, went to the vet and they kept him overnight. His Xrays showed \\"something\\" in his stomach which they could not tell was an object or serious gas. Ended up being gas. Put him on Prescription Diet ID (VERY pricey). He's back to normal but it took almost 2 weeks (and $500 later). He's worth it though. I wont even put this crap out for the feral cats that come up at night to eat.

product_title: Milo's Kitchen Chicken Jerky Strips Dog Treats, 23 oz.
review_headline: Our dog has been very sick!
review_body: Please do not trust even the beef treats. We will be seeing a Vet Specialist in NH for our dog LuLu. We thought she was having a reaction to all the early pollen. But, once we stopped the treats, her breathing improved. I will be much more cautious of all dog food and treats after this experience. They may love them. But, it's not worth the cost of their health!

product_title: Happy Hips Dog Food
review_headline: Made my dog sick
review_body: I was used to buying this item off the shelf, but was disgusted by the contents of my mail order.  First off, the product image is misleading.  The image shows the \\"Vitality\\" duck and sweet potato product (which I was familiar with and wanted), but what came was the \\"Happy Hips\\" duck and sweet potato product.  My roommate had actually purchased the \\"Happy Hips\\" product through the mail before and while we noticed some uneven quality, my order was disgusting.  The contents of most of the 12 cans in the cans in the first box had congealed into a super hard blob with none of the meat chunks and vegetables recognizable, and covering the top and interspersed in the contents were what looked like maggots.  I tried the can with the best looking contents, convinced myself that the white grains were rice (even though rice is not listed in the ingredients) and mixed some as usual with my dog's dry food.  When I came home from work today, my dog had thrown up twice.  I opened one of the cans in the second box just to see what was inside.  The contents of it looked much more like what I was used to, but I saw some of the \\"rice grains\\" on top.  That was it - I called Amazon and asked for a refund.  It's hard for me to blame Dogswell because I have liked their products for so long, but either on their end or the seller's, a BAD product is being distributed!  I won't be able to bring myself to try this project again for a long time, if ever.

product_title: Vita Coco Coconut Water
review_headline: Very poor. __Bad taste and must be rotten.
review_body:
Product arrived in great condition. But, taste was very bad. it was yellow color and very bad taste. I think one of the other reviewer mentioned that.
I am never buying perishable food from amazon again. I should have listen to other reviewer.

product_title: Annie's Naturals Dressing, V/F, Lmn and Chives, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6)
review_headline: Very prominent oily taste, would avoid
review_body:
The chives should be front and center in the flavor profile but unfortunately they are muted, the prodominant taste is that of oil, with a hint of lemon. Quite insipid.

I could describe it more eloquently as a haiku:

Chives taste like summer
But this just tastes like oil
Aftertaste is vile.

product_title: Eden Organic Wild Berry Mix, 4-Ounce Package (Pack of 5)
review_headline: Stale, avoid!
review_body: Stale, and can't be returned. I've had good luck in the past ordering Eden dried fruits online, but I knew ordering anything with nuts in the mix was a gamble, and I was right...it was a gamble I lost. No returns. Stale. Never again.

product_title: Waggin Train Chicken Jerky Tenders 40oz
review_headline: Potentially dangerous or fatal
review_body: I have a friend who got a sample of this in his bag of dog food. His dog got ill immediately which was fortunate since the dog didn't continue to ingest this except for the one day.  He was completely unaware of any complaints and made the association himself that it was these treats that caused his dog to become ill. It's not worth taking a chance.
